loans.name: Grégoire Birame

texts.fr:
Monsieur Grégoire Birame est un jeune frigoriste âgé de 35 ans et père de deux enfants. Son activité consiste à vendre des pièces détachées. Il est aussi réparateur de frigo .Métier qu’il exerce depuis  plus de 6 ans.
Avec le crédit il envisage d’acheter  des moteurs de réfrigérateurs et du gaz pour  le revendre.
Avec les revenus de son activité Grégoire arrive à satisfaire  les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Grégoire Birame is 35 years old and the father of 2 children. He has been a refrigeration engineer for over 6 years and sells spare parts as well as repairing fridges.

Grégoire will use this loan to buy refrigerator motors and gas for resale. His earnings allow him to take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy refrigerator motors and gas for resale.

loans.name: Fuasou

texts.en:
Fuasou is married with three children. She is 25 years old.

Fuasou owns and operates a business venture selling fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business.    

Fuasou needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $167 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Fuasou joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fuasou's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Nail

texts.en:
Nail is a 39-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children. He is a cattle breeder and has four years of experience in this field.  Nail chose this particular activity because meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and most of the national dishes like dolma and pilau are made of meat. 

Nail usually buys small calves in the central bazaar, fattens and raises them for 5-6 months. Then, he resells the grown cattle for a more profitable price to market vendors and butchers. His wife helps to look after the animals and feed them.  

Demand for fresh meat is very high and Nail would like to cover the demands of his permanent clients. For this purpose, he applied for 550 AZN. He will use the loan to buy two baby calves.

loans.use: to purchase two baby calves

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is from Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 36 years old. Estella is married and has nine children. 

To make a living, Estella owns & operates a business in the food sector, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Estella has been in her business for two years and earns 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Estella joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estella is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fruit to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit  to sell.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 57 años, es una mujer amable y muy trabajadora, esta separada del que fue su esposo y con quien tuvo tres hijos a quienes crió y educó. Ahora son mayores e independices, ella vive en su casa propia en donde comparte junto a su hijo además de su nieto, quien es la alegría de su hogar. La actividad a la que se dedica Reyna es al del alquiler de cuartos y locales comerciales en el amplio terreno que tiene en su casa. Desde hace 10 años que se dio cuenta que como su terreno colinda con una calle muy concurrida y comercial y vio en ella una fuente de ingresos muy rentable así que decidió realizar la construcción de sus cuartos y locales y ponerlos en alquiler. Empezó con 2 y ahora los amplio a 6, los que le permiten tener buenos ingresos fijos al mes. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que a medida que crece el comercio en esa zona, también crece el costo de alquiler. Espera que le siga yendo bien y desea ampliar un par de locales mas y así incrementar sus ingresos. Este será el crédito número 5 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que recibirá el apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo y así mejorar su capital, además se compromete una vez mas en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en otros crédito que tuvo, por otro lado menciona que se siente muy cómoda en su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales para poder refaccionar algunas paredes y los pisos de sus locales.
texts.en:
Reyna, 57, is a kind, very hardworking woman.  She’s separated from her husband with whom she had three children that she raised and educated.  Now, they are independent adults.  She lives in her own house that she shares with one of her sons as well as her grandson who is her home’s joy.

Reyna works leasing out rooms and commercial sites on the large piece of property her house is located on.  Over ten years ago she noticed that her property is situated on a very busy commercial street and saw the possibility of a profitable source of income so she decided to build rooms and commercial units and to rent them out.  She started with two and now has expanded to six which produce steady monthly income.  She’s doing very well because as commerce grows in the area housing costs rise accordingly.  She hopes to continue to do well and wants to expand with a couple of more sites to thus increase her income.

This will be MFP loan #5.  She’s very happy to know that she will have financial support to be able to continue in business and improve her capital.  She once again commits to make her installment payments like she did with her previous loan.  She mentions that she feels very comfortable in her communal bank because her fellow members are responsible and very supportive.  She will use the requested amount to buy building materials and supplies to redo some of the walls and floors in her units.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is living in the Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She is 30 years old and she is married with four children. Two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She makes a living through planting potato and rice for 17 years. She can earn about 72,000KHR per day. 
This is the second loan for her withVisionFund. With herfirst loan, she could cover her crop as well and achieve the good yields. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for her potato plantation. She expects that this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to better off her living’s condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her potato plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Itaf

texts.en: Itaf is a 43 year old Lebanese divorced woman. She lives with her parents and sibling. In order to help her family financially and enhance her family way of living. She opened her own shop for selling clothes and shoes in 2009 and provides her customers with the best products at fair prices. She is satisfied with what she has attained so far, even though she wishes to enhance her work even more. Today, she is seeking a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to buy a new collection of clothing and shoes to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. She is very proud of her business growth and she hopes to enlarge her shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Revelations Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Lydia is married and has four children. She is the Chairlady of welfare in the same group. She is also a of mothers union member where she is a church treasurer. She has been in the group for the last four years.

Currently she has two dairy cows. Has been keeping around 500 chicken a business she started in 2004 using the first loan of USD.300 from WEEC. She sells eggs to local market and Nairobi. The demand is high and would like to increase the number of chicken to at least 1000.She is able to provide for her family all the basic necessities.

loans.use: She would like to buy more chicken to meet the demand of eggs in Thika.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elisabeth A. is a fifty year old widow. Left with five children by her deceased husband in 1984, she has once again taken up the business she inherited from her mother, preparing and selling ‘ablo’ corn bread. Despite her minimal education, she is gifted with an aptitude that has earned her a good reputation in her business. By selling ‘ablo’, a corn-based dish that’s very common in her village, Mrs. A. manages to provide for the needs of her fatherless children. She is now requesting a loan of $700, which will provide her with the funds needed to prepare and sell ‘ablo’. This will boost her resources and help her to cover her many family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Elisabeth est une veuve qui est âgée d’une cinquantaine d’années. Laissée par son mari défunt avec cinq (05) enfants en 1984, elle a retrouvé son activité de préparation et de vente du pain de maïs « ablo » héritée de sa mère. Malgré son niveau d’instruction très bas, elle est dotée d’une aptitude qui lui confère une bonne réputation dans son activité. A partir de la vente d’« ablo » un met fabriqué à base de maïs très consommé dans sa localité, Madame A. réussit à subvenir aux besoins de ses orphelins. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit de $700 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour la préparation et la vente de ablo. Ceci pourra la relancer dans son économie et l’aidera à couvrir les nombreuses charges de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire the raw materials for the preparation and sale of 'ablo' corn bread.

loans.name: Ladger

texts.en: Ladger has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She cooks palm kernel oil and sells to customers in drums and gallons. She is seeking a loan of US$700.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Business Description: Mrs. N. began her business 9 months ago with the money her husband was able to save. Today, her store has grown and sells products in need. It is located in a high-transit location and she has progressed.

Use of Loan: She will use the credit to make improvements to her store and buy more merchandise in order to have a larger variety. This way she will provide a better service to her clients.

Personal Information: She is 24 years old and has 2 children. They live in a home that is made of cane which is located right next to her store. She works in the business with her husband, has a stable family situation and her goal is to have a big product store in the area.

Translated to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio: La Señora empezó su negocio hace 9 meses con un dinero que el esposo pudo ahorrar, hoy en día su tienda ha crecido y vende todos los productos de primera necesidad, su ubicación es un lugar muy transitado y ella ha progresado.

Uso del Préstamo: Ella va a usar su crédito para adecuar el local y comprar mas mercadería para poder tener en su local mas surtido y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal: Tiene 24 años y 2 hijos su vivienda es de caña junto a su negocio, ella trabaja en el negocio con su esposo, tiene una estabilidad familiar buena y su meta es tener un local de productos grandes en el sector

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy A. is 24 years old, and married with 4 children.  She sells provisions and drinks to her community.  She has 6 years experience in her business and has been a LAPO client for 3 years.  She hopes to buy more provisions & drinks to sell with the loan above.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & drinks to sell

loans.name: Ni Putu Widiantari

texts.id:
To have a constant income that could help her husband's salary is the reason that Ni Putu Widiantari to be a pig farmer, a mother blessed with a baby since last year. Although a business considered young, her income is not bad. From sales of 2 piglets bought for Rp150,000 (about US$16.50)/piece, after 3 months sold for Rp450,000 (about $49.50)/piece. While feeding expense was only Rp250,000 (about $27.50). This gave Widiantari motivation to increase her farmed animals. Dinari additional capital of Rp1,500,000 (about $165) will be used to build a stall with cement floor and bamboo walls. A very simple stall, but enough to provide comfort to her animals. The rest would be used to buy feedstock. Widiantari is proud of what she has done so far, because with it, Widiantari could have an income, and help her husband's burden who received just enough salary as a carpenter. While rearing up her 2 year old child, Widiantari did not forget her responsibilty as a housewife, and mother's activities in her village.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Memiliki sumber pendapatan tetap yang mampu membantu penghasilan suami menjadi alasan Ni Putu Widiantari untuk menekuni memelihara babi . Ibu rumah tangga yang baru di karuniai seorang anak ini mulai menekuni memelihara babi sejak 1 tahun yang lalu. Meski tergolong usaha yang masih muda, hasil yang di perolehnya cukup lumayan. Dari hasil penjualan 2 ekor ternak babi yang di belinya dengan harga 150.000,- / ekor, setelah tiga bulan laku di jual Rp 450.000,-/ ekor. Sedangkan biaya pakan yang di habiskan hanya Rp 250.000, -. Hasil itu memacu semangat Widiantari untuk menambah ternak peliharaanya Dinari memberikan tambahan modal kepada Widiantari sebesar Rp 1.500.000,-yang dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang dengan alas semen dan dinding bambu. Suatu kandang yang sangat sederhana tetapi mampu memberi rasa nyaman bagi ternak-ternak peliharaannya. Kemudian sisa uangnya di belikan bibit . Widiantari sangat bangga dengan apa yang dapat dikerjakannya saat ini , karena dengan begitu ,Widiantari bisa mempunyai penghasilan dan bisa meringankan beban suaminya yang punya penghasilan pas-pasan sebagai tukang kayu. Sambil mengasuh I Gusti Putu Desta Winata, anaknya yang masih balita ( 2 Th ), Widiantari juga tak melupakan tanggung jawabnya sebagai ibu rumah tangga dan selalu aktif dalam kegiatan ibu –ibu PKK di desanya.

loans.use:
To built better stall and buy pig feedstock

Membuat kandang yg lebih baik dan membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en: Mrs. Chorn C. S., age 20, sells grocery products and fresh vegetables at a market, earning on average US$3 a day in revenue. Her husband is employed at a private company as a driver, making about US$2 a day. They have one child who is too young to attend school. Mrs. C. S. would like to request a loan of US$1,000 in order to purchase more grocery products for her inventory and buy a horse cart. The cart would allow her husband to generate additional income by transporting passengers when he is not working at his full-time job. The couple plans to use the additional income to re-invest in their business, raise the standard of living of their family, and save for their child’s education.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products and a horse cart

loans.name: Catita Alvina

texts.es:
Señora Catita belongs to the communal bank "La Mujer Riojana" (The Riojan Woman), and she makes a living by selling juice and fruit and vegetable extract. Her business is located at 129 Mercado Central Puesto in the district and province of Rioja in San Martín. Because of her charisma and good treatment of her clients, they visit her everyday and also in the afternoons. For five years, she has sold juice and popsicles in her home located at 219 Jr. Julio C. Arana.

With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a refrigerator so she can keep her fruit fresh and always have supplies. She will also use this to refrigerate her popsicles, and she will buy fresh fruit that is in season every day.

Catita is the mother of 3 young children, and the oldest helps his siblings with their studies and expenses. She has always tried to help her children get ahead and to be a good example for them. Her perseverance and happiness have made her a great woman.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Catita pertenece al banco comunal La Mujer Riojana, se dedica a la venta de jugos y extractos de frutas y verduras, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Mercado Central Puesto N° 129, distrito y provincia de Rioja, departamento de San Martín. Su carisma y buen trato hacia sus clientes ha permitido que ellos acudan diariamente, también por las tardes, desde hace cinco años, se dedica a la venta de refresco y chupetes en su domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Julio C. Arana 219.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará una refrigeradora para poder mantener la fruta fresca y así estar siempre abastecida y también lo utilizará para refrigerar los chupetes, también diariamente comprará fruta fresca y de estación.

Catita es madre de tres jóvenes y es el mayor de ellos el que le ayuda con los estudios y gastos de sus hermanos. Siempre se ha esforzado para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y ser un buen ejemplo para ellos. Su perseverancia y alegría han hecho en ella una gran mujer.

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and fruit

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Mr. Emile M. is married and the father of two children. After secondary school, he did an apprenticeship and on completion, received a driver's license. He became a driver and worked for two years for the owner of a vehicle. Now, Mr. M. would like to have a vehicle of his own, but he lacks the necessary financial means. He is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 to purchase a vehicle to use as a taxi. The income will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1972, Monsieur Emile M. est un jeune homme marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Après ses études secondaires, il se lança en apprentissage qu’il acheva avec un permis de conduire. Devenu chauffeur, il a travaillé pour un propriétaire de véhicule pendant 2 ans. Aujourd’hui, Monsieur M. Emile désire avoir son propre véhicule mais ne dispose pas de moyen. Il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour acheter un véhicule destiné au transport. Les revenus lui serviront à mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
purchase of a vehicle to use as a taxi

Achat de véhicule pour transport

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Mrs. Alvina lives in the province of Marshal Cáceres district of Juanjui. She works selling food in the Nº 02 market of the district.

She has been dedicated to the business for 9 years. Her first business was not yielding good results. There were days that she did not sell anything and she had to pay the household expenses, but could not even pay the rent. So a friend gave her the idea of selling food in the country house where she lived and she began selling cebiche (a seafood dish) and other dishes, with good results. She decided then to leave the business of selling vegetables and to sell food in the place she already had in the market. This is how she began. She needed more capital to be able to expand and to continue with the business now that she did not lack for clients. A friend invited her to the "Union and Work" Communal Bank, to which she now belongs.

With the recent loan of 500 soles which will be paid off in 4 months, she will buy articles for her business such as 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, kilograms of stew, oil and meat for the preparation of dishes.

Señora Sara Alvina is 44 years old and has 2 children of which 1 is still is in her care. She lives with her husband who supports her and with whom she works in the business of selling food. At present they have two positions for selling food and one of their projects this to acquire another position with the new loan that she wishes to receive.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Alvina vive en la provincia de Mariscal Cáceres distrito de Juanjui, se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado Nº 02 del distrito.

Tiene dedicándose al negocio 09 años, su primer negocio no le estaba rindiendo buenos resultados, había días que no vendía nada y tenia que pagar los gastos de su casa, no le alcanzaba para pagar el alquiler ; es así que una amiga le da la idea de vender comida en la quinta donde vivía y empezó vendiendo cebiche y otros platos, dándole buenos resultados, decidió entonces dejar el negocio de la venta de verduras y vender comida en el puesto que ya tenía en el mercado; es así como empezó. Necesitaba de más capital para poder ampliar y continuar con el negocio ya que los que clientes no le faltan, entonces una amiga la invita al Banco Comunal ”Unión y Trabajo” al que pertenece actualmente.

Con el reciente préstamo de S/.500.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará artículos para su negocio como son 01 saco de arroz, 01 saco de azúcar, menestras en kilos, aceite y carne para los preparativos.

La señora Sara Alvina, tiene 44 años, 02 hijos de los cuales 01 aún está a su cargo, vive con su esposo quien la apoya y con quien trabaja en el negocio de la venta de comida, actualmente tiene dos puestos de venta de comida y dentro de sus proyectos esta el adquirir otro puesto de ventas con el nuevo préstamo que desea recibir.

loans.use: To buy one bag of rice, one bag of sugar, kilograms of stew, oil and meat for the preparation of food for sale.  Also to purchase an additional position for selling foods.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An C., 63, is a widow who lives with her adopted daughter. She and her daughter sell fish at Prek Pnao market. They buy them from the fishing lot to resell. Mrs. An has been doing this business for twenty eight years. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. An and her daughter are in the process of rebuilding their house; it is not yet complete.

Mrs. An is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1,000 to complete her house.

loans.use: To complete her house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married, and has 3 children. Her children are 13, 10, and 8 years old. Elizabeth owns a small shop, which she started working at in 2004. She works everyday from 6 AM to 10 PM, and earns around $400 from her sales.

Elizabeth would like a loan to purchase more items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shop items for her business.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Ángela is a very hard-working woman. Her 8 children were and are the reason for her effort. Since she formed her family she has been in the business of selling clothing for children, men and women in the fairs in the various towns around the city of Juliaca while her dear husband has a business selling books. In her free time Ángela, like all mothers concerned about their children, tries to look for ways to bring in extra income whether it be helping in food preparation in restaurants or cleaning. Both parents strive and put forward their best effort to give their dear children the necessary wellbeing, education and other tools to be able to achieve success in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ángela es una mujer muy trabajadora, sus 8 hijos fueron y son la razón de su esfuerzo, desde que formó su familia se dedica a la venta de ropas para niños, caballeros y damas, en las ferias de los distintos pueblitos de la ciudad donde radica Juliaca, en tanto su querido esposo hace lo propio con su negocio de venta de libros.En sus horas libres doña Ángela como toda madre preocupada por los suyos trata de buscar la manera de llevar al hogar ingresos extras, ya sea apoyando en la preparación de alimentos en los restaurantes o haciendo la limpieza.Ambos padres se esfuerzan y ponen lo mejor de sí con el fin de otorgarles bienestar, educación y las herramientas necesarias a sus queridos hijos, para que más adelante puedan alcanzar el éxito.

loans.use: Increasing her capital to offer a larger quantity of clothing

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi S. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of three. In the photo, she is the person on the left. She has been a retail seller of ready-to-wear clothing for over ten years, and her merchandise is set up in the marketplace of Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to grow the capacity of her business by buying a lot more clothing for resale. The profit from her business will help her to better support her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Akouvi S. est âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Dans la photo, elle est la personne située à gauche. Elle revendeuse des habits prêts-à-porter depuis plus de 10 ans et installe ses marchandises au marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite, avec ce crédit accroître la capacité de son activité en achetant beaucoup plus d’habits pour la revente. Les profits de son activité l’aideront à mieux supporter ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy a lot more clothing for retail sale

loans.name: Adjowavi

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1964, Mrs. Adjowavi M. currently lives in Blamacondji with her husband, who is a farmer, and her five children. Being illiterate, she learned early on that working on the land is always reliable. Known as a devoted woman, she is becoming an example among women during the agricultural period. This year she has high hopes for the new crop season. To accomplish her goals, she is requesting this loan in order to rent land and buy fertilizer to enrich the soil. This way she will be able to expect a good harvest, allowing her to better provide for the many needs of her family.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attitogon en 1964, Madame M. Adjowavi vit actuellement à Blamacondji avec son mari cultivateur et ses cinq enfants. Analphabète, elle a compris très tôt que le travail de la terre ne trompe jamais. Reconnue comme une femme très dévouée, elle devient une référence parmi les femmes en période agricole. Cette année tout son espoir se repose sur la nouvelle campagne agricole. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite ce crédit pour louer les terres et acheter de l’engrais pour nourrir les sols. Ainsi, elle pourra s’attendre à une bonne récolte qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille. ra à mieux satisfaire les besoins des personnes à sa charge.

loans.use: Renting land and purchasing fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
Wayan W. is a very diligent worker. She farms rice and pigs at her home. Every mornings and evenings, she always feeds and cleans her pigs to produce the best quality meats. She needs about $130 to take care of 4 pigs and the rest are used to purchase feeds. She earns about $20 profit per month. She comes back to DINARI to increase her working capital to farm more pigs. This second loan will be used to purchase piglets, feeds and medicines. Wayan is very serious in her farm business after realizing that it provides her with excellent income potential. Wayan hopes that her income for the next 6 months will be better than previous periods.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Wayan W. sangat tekun dengan pekerjaannya. Disamping sebagai petani, Wayan W. juga menggeluti usaha beternak babi di rumahnya. Setiap pagi dan sore harinya Wayan W. selalu rajin memberi makan serta memandikan babi-babinya untuk dapat menghasilkan panen babi yang bermutu baik. Modal yang dibutuhkan sebagai peternak babi sekitar Rp.1.300.000,- untuk memelihara 4 ekor babi dan sisanya dipakai untuk membeli pakan babi. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perbulannya sekitar Rp.200.000,-. Karena itulah Wayan kembali meminjam ke DINARI untuk menambah modal usaha sehingga babi peliharaannya bisa bertambah banyak. Pinjaman kedua ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit babi serta sisanya untuk pakan dan obat-obatnya. Melihat hasil dari beternak babi ini sangat bagus untuk menghidupi keluarga bersama dengan suaminya maka Wayan sangat serius untuk menekuninya. Wayan berharap pemeliharaan kedepan selama 6 bulan akan memberikan keuntungan yang melebihi sebelumnya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets, feeds and medications

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji is married and lives in Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its spicy fish, a sweet dish called Andrassay, and decorative embroidery. She and her family have lived in this city for the last 6 years in a two-room brick house that they own. Kalsoom is the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her elder son and her daughter are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. 
<paragraph>
Kalsoom baji's husband sells buffalo milk. He has been in this profession for the last 5 years and has one buffalo at his house. Kalsoom baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of the buffalo. She is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Rosita Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosita tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, que cursa el segundo grado de primaria, su compañero de vida es de oficio transportista, su proposito es poder manteniendo su negocio, de esta manera poder persivir sus pròpios ingresos y no estar a la dependencia de la ayuda de su compañero de vida, su mayor deseo es poder llegar a covertir su pequeño negocio en un rancho de comida tipica, donde se oferte un servicio tanto a domicilio como en el establecimiento, su sueño es poder llegar a tener su propia casa ya que en la actualidad vive donde su señora madre, su deseo es pode seguir manteniendo la unionde su familia, poder ayudarle a su señora madre en lo mas que pueda, e ir creciendo en clientes. Actualemnte su actividad economica es la venta de sopa, comida corriente, cerveza y gaseosa, en dicha actividad tiene siete años de dedicarse , dio inicio como una manera de obtener sus propios ingresos y como toda mujer luchadora puso en practica esta idea de negocio que espera poder ir mejorando con la ayuda de los creditos, esperando contar siempre con el apoyo de nuestra institucion y su programas para consolidad su idea de negocio.
texts.en:
Rosita is 37 years old and single. She has a 6-year-old son who is attending the second grade of primary school. Her domestic partner works in the office of transportation. Her goal is to be able to maintain her business and thereby be able to continue providing her own income and not be dependent upon her domestic partner. She very much wants to be able to convert her small store into a local eatery. Here she would make her clients feel as much at home as at a business. Her dream is to be able to have her own home given that she now lives with her mother. She wants to keep her family together, to be able to help her elderly mother as much as possible, and to keep growing her clientele. Her business actually consists of sales of soup, fast foods, beer and soft drinks. She has dedicated herself to her business for seven years. She started in the business as a way to generate her own income, and like all women with a fighting spirit, put her business ideas into practice. She hopes to continue improving with the assistance of loans, hoping to always count on Kiva field partner Fundación Leon 2000 and its programs.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Jesús es viuda, tiene 67 años y 8 hijos, Jesús vive con uno D. sus hijos, Jesús venD. leña en la casa donD. vive, la leña lo manda hacer en Ccejelambras para lo cual contrata a peones luego lo transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en un carro alquilado. Además en algunas oportunidades venD. ropa a pedido en algunas ferias.
Jesús necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. árboles D. eucalipto.
Jesús sueña con tener una casa propia, mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Jesús is a member of the Awakening Communal Bank. Jesús is 67 years old, a widow, and has 8 children. She lives with one of her children and sells firewood from her home. She hires laborers to chop trees into firewood in Cejelambras and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho in a rented car. Sometimes she also sells clothing in some markets. Jesús needs a loan of 2,000 soles ($650), which will be invested in the purchase of eucalyptus trees. Jesús dreams of having her own home and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy eucalyptus trees

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. Aun P. lives in Lvea Sor Kandal village in Kandal Province. She sells cabbage in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Chea Phong, is a construction worker. Even though they have different businesses, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. 

Thus, Mrs. Aun P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cow. 

She is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are enrolled in the local school. Her husband appears on her right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en: Koem S. is 58 years old a resident of Pursat Province where he has owned a plot of land since 1979. He grows rice crops, which he plants twice a year. He is a good father of seven children: four are single and three are married and live away from home. He is married to Horm Sen, age 57 who also is a rice farmer and raises pigs from their home. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, four of his children are working with him.  Rice growing is Koems main source of earning income to sustain his family’s living conditions. S. is applying for a $700 loans to buy two water buffalo to use for plowing the fields..

loans.use: to buy two water buffalo

loans.name: Paraiso Norte Group

texts.es: LAS  SOCIAS QUIENES CONFORMAN EL GRUPO " PARAÍSO NORTE" SON PERSONAS QUE SE CONOCEN DE MUCHO TIEMPO YA QUE RESIDEN EN EL MISMOS, ESTÁN REPRESENTADAS POR LA SEÑORA ESTELA QUIEN ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO. EN SU MAYORÍAS LOS SOCIOS (AS ) SE DEDICAN A PEQUEÑOS NEGOCIOS DE VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMO ROPA, COSMÉTICOS, COMIDA, BEBIDAS Y A ACTIVIDADES DE SERVICIOS COMO CONSTRUCTORES, COCINERAS Y TÉCNICOS EN REPARACIÓN ELÉCTRICA. DENTRO DEL ÁMBITO COMERCIAL Y DE SERVICIOS EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA FUERTE DE LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA, PERO LA EXPERIENCIA DE LOS SOCIOS Y LOS AÑOS DE SERVICIO HACEN QUE SEA MAS LLEVADERA. EL FINANCIAMIENTO ESTA DESTINADO A LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES Y HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO PARA BRINDAR UN MEJOR PRODUCTO Y UN MEJOR SERVICIO ACORDE A LA DEMANDA DEL MERCADO. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SE SIENTEN CAPACES DE ADMINISTRAR LOS FONDOS OTORGADOS YA QUE CUENTAN CON EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS Y SABEN RESPONDER Y CUMPLIR CON SUS OBLIGACIONES YA QUE SON GENTE CON GANAS DE MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA Y LA DE SU FAMILIA CON SU TRABAJO.
texts.en:
The partners who make up the Group "Paraiso Norte” are people who have known each other for some time as they reside in the same area. They are represented by Señora Estela, who is the president of the group. The majority of members run small business that sell products such as clothing, cosmetics, food, beverages, and service activities such as construction, coking, and electronic repairs. Within the scope of services, there is strong competition for supply and demand, but the members’ experience and their years of service make it more bearable. They are requesting funding for the purchase of materials and tools to offer an improved product and service to meet market demand. Members are capable of managing the requested funds because they have experience with group credit and understand how to respond and comply with their responsibilities, as they are people wanting to improve the quality of life for their family through their work.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For capital

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero is 55-years old and married with three children. She lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria. Vero sells shoes and clothing materials, a business she has had for a long time. Vero is requesting a loan to expand her inventory which will improve her business opportunities. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Aubierge

texts.fr:
Née le 20 Août 1974 à Sèmè-Podji dans le département du LITTORAL,G. A. Aubierge est originaire de la ville historique d'ABOMEY dans le département du ZOU. Aubierge est photographe et reporteur-vidéo de formation. C'est par manque de moyens financiers pour s'acheter des appareils afin d'exercer sa profession qui fait qu'elle s'est lancée dans le commerce. Aubierge est Mariée à DJIHOKIN Basile un mécanicien vélo moteur de formation.  Aubierge est mère de 2 filles et d'un garçon tous scolarisés. La famille d'Aubierge vit en location à Hlacomey, un quartier périphérique de la ville de COTONOU où elle mène depuis 15 ans l'activité de vente de divers (savons, riz en sac de 5Kg, 10Kg et 20Kg, laits concentrés, tomates en boîte, huile d'arachide, des détergents, des papiers de toilette, des cartons de sucre, des pâtes alimentaires comme des spaghettis, des fournitures scolaires, etc.). Depuis 4 ans maintenant, Aubierge a ouvert un télécentre à Tokpa , le marché international du BENIN où elle vend des cartes de recharges de tous les réseaux téléphoniques au Bénin.  Aubierge dispose de quatre combinés téléphoniques pour permettre aux usagers du marché d'émettre et de recevoir des appels téléphoniques. C'est Aubierge elle-même qui s'occupe du télécentre au marché Tokpa. A la maison  Aubierge se fait aider par l'une de ses sœurs dans la vente de divers. Aubierge a 5 personnes en charge; ce qui fait qu'elle dépense en moyenne 3000 FCFA par jour pour les dépenses alimentaires de sa famille. Aubierge envisage créer encore un étalage de divers à côté de son télécentre au marché Tokpa. C'est pourquoi Aubierge sollicite un troisième crédit.


p> 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born on August 20, 1974 in Sèmè-Podji, in Littoral County, Ms. G. A. Aubierge traces her roots to the historic city of ABOMEY, in Zou County. Aubierge is a photographer and video-reporter by training. Because she lacks the financial means for buying cameras, so as to practice her profession, she got started in commerce.

Aubierge is married to Mr. DJIHOKIN Basile, a motorbike mechanic by training. She is the mother of two girls and a boy who are all in school. Her family lives in a rental in Hlacomey, an outlying district of the city of COTONOU, where her business of 15 years has been in selling various goods (soaps; rice in sacks of 5-, 10-, and 20-kg; evaporated milk, canned tomatoes; peanut oil; detergents; toilet paper; boxes of sugar; pasta such as spaghetti, school supplies, etc.)

Four years ago now, she opened a telephone center in Tokpa, the international marketplace of BENIN, where she sells recharge phone cards of all the telephone networks in Bénin. She has four phones allowing market-goers to make and receive phone calls. Aubierge herself is the one who takes care of the telecenter at the Tokpa marketplace.

Back at the house, she has the help of a sister of hers in selling various goods. Aubierge has five people to support, which means she spends 3,000 francs CFA on average for food per day for her family.

She envisions creating another display of goods next to her telecenter at the Tokpa marketplace. This is why she's requesting a third loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, rice, other grocery items, and school supplies

loans.name: Munh-Orgil

texts.en:
Munh-Orgil O. lives with her husband in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

In 2004, she started running a small stall for cell phone accessories in the Bayanzurh market, one of the largest markets in Ulaanbaatar. As of today, she runs two stalls for cell phone accessories and her husband is mostly in charge of running these two stalls. Besides the cell phone accessories business, Munh-Orgil's husband also uses his car as a taxi, to boost his family income.

She frequently travels to Ereen, China, (a major trade city where many Mongolian small business owners import cheap products) to bring in products for her retail business. Since its inception, Munh-Orgil has gained significant experience in this type of business. As her profits allow, she hopes to build a small house on the land where they now lives in a "ger" (traditional nomadic tent). She requests a loan to imports more products and pay rent on the additional stall.

loans.use: Buy mobile phone accessories and pay rent for a retail stall.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Mrs. Teresita M. D. P. of P1 Bacolod, Ozamiz City is a mother of 6. Four of her children are in school. She is hard working, and has been engaged in snack vending and barbeque vending since 2000. Aside from this business, she is also cultivating a little vegetable garden in their yard. Her husband is a carpenter.

As a new member of PDP-LP Program of Paglaum MPC, she enjoys the benefits of savings and insurances. Now she's applying for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy ingredients for her barbeque and snack vending business, additional utensils and for the purchase of fertilizer for her garden. Her aspiration is to give her children a better future, make a mini carenderia (a local eatery) and expand her business in other areas.

loans.use: Additional capital for barbeque and snack vending

location.town: Ozamis-Purok 1 Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Mery es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos, Mery junto a su esposo tienen 2 carros con los cuales realizan transporte publico a diferentes distritos de la región, además Mery siembra papa, quinua que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Mery necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos y mantenimiento de carro.
Los sueños de Mery son educar a sus hijos y comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
Mery is a partner in the Villa Huatatas community bank. She is 39 years old and married, with five children. Mery and her husband have two cars, which they employ in a public transport business that serves several districts in the region. Mery also grows potatoes and quinua, which she sells in the food market of Ayacucho. Mery needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll invest in spare parts and maintenance for her car. She dreams of educating her children and buying another car.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mery needs a loan of 900 soles, which she'll invest in spare parts and maintenence for her car.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
"I am a tenant and I till the land that I never own. Someday, I wish I could have my own farm so that I could give more support to my family especially my three children," says Danilo G., a farmer from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. From his harvest, Danilo has been able to pay for school, books and other needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to purchase certified seeds, ammonia, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers. The loan will really help improve his harvest and income as well. 

CEVI aims to help small businesses to grow. They provide more than just loans. They make sure that their clients are trained and covered with insurance.

loans.use: To purchase certified seeds, ammonium, herbicides, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Заррина молодая , весёлая , энергичная женщина. Которая занимается продажей фруктов и овощей. При каждом мониторинге убеждаемся , что у неё много своих постоянных клиентов , которых она быстро и качественно обслуживает. Вот и на снимке она очень занята обслуживанием клиентов , продавая огурцы и помидоры. Она за три года она смогла расширить свой бизнес и увеличить торговлю.
texts.en:
Zarrina is a young, cheerful and energetic woman. She sells fruits and vegetables. During every screening she confirms that she has many regular customers whom she services quickly and with care. On the photo she is buy serving her customers by selling cucumbers and tomatoes. During these three years she was able to expand her business and increase sales.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Faatasiga

texts.en:
Faatasiga T., 40, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers two days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (~158 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Faatasiga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is happy to stay a long time in the program and get more help for running her business and supporting her family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, farming equipment and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is 26 years old. She is a wife and mother of three children who are currently in school. She has operated a clothing shop for the past six years and sells jeans, cloth, blouses, skirts, women slippers, dressing bags and headscarves. She is currently constrained with funds to operate the business as a result of a business expansion. She needs the loan to enable her to inject more working capital and scale up her business. She believes the loan will help her to upgrade her inventory by purchasing good quality and a larger quantity of products. With the loan, she wants to purchase jeans cloth, ladies wears, headscarves and slippers. Her plan is to save more for the children's future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of jeans cloth, ladies wears and slippers.

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im S. is a villager in Boeung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Keo Bo, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. On this plantation, they face an obstacle because they usually pay a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow on the field. Thus, Mrs. Im S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding and to support the rice field. She is 57 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a policeman and the remaining is a farmer. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for breeding and to support the rice field

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth T. G. vive en Zaragoza ubicado en el departamento de la Libertad. Sandra tiene 23 años de edad y se encuentra casada. A pesar de esta muy joven Sandra ha logrado montar su propio negocio, tras la experiencia obtenida años atrás Sandra se decidió que estaba lista para emprender su negocio con una Sala de Belleza;  y es así como ahora tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en una zona de mucha afluencia y sus clientes son muy frecuentes. Sandra genera empleo a una persona más, que es cosmetóloga y ayuda a atender a los clientes, hoy Sandra solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con productos de belleza que le ayudan a generar mayores ganancias, ya que sus clientes siempre preguntan y quieren comprar productos para el cuidado del cabello después de ser atendidos.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth T. G. lives in Zaragoza, which is located in the district of La Libertad. She is 23 years old and married. Despite being very young, Sandra already has managed to start her own business. After a few years of gaining work experience, Sandra decided she was ready to open a beauty salon. Her business is located in an affluent area and she already has clients who visit her frequently. Sandra employs one other person, a cosmetologist who helps attend to her clients.

Sandra is requesting a loan to restock her business with beauty products, which will help generate more revenue. Her clients are always asking for hair care products they can use after they have received their treatments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products to sell at her salon

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia B. sells dried fish (koobi) and snails at Elmina near Ayisa. She is a widow and has six dependents. She has no educational background. She is responsible for paying school fees and utility bills.

Cecilia has been selling dried fish since 2006. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to be dried for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to be dried for sale

loans.name: Sadam

texts.en:
Sadam S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 18 years old and single. Sadam owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling Ready to Wear goods like dress, bags, sandals and others in the local community. Sadam has been engaged in his business for over 3 years.  

In 2009, Sadam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sadam is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Sadam from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma G. is from the village of Guinabot, Sapang Dalaga. She is 40 years old and married with one school-age child. To make a living, Elma makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her sales to expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her business

loans.name: Chiehon

texts.ru: Чиехон Рахматуллоев проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст 34 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена-домохозяйка. Чиехон имеет собственный магазин в котором более 12 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Chiehon R. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Chiehon owns a store, where he has been involved in retail sales for over 12 years. He primarily sells food products. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Hanina

texts.en: Hanina M. is 36 years old and is married to Pablo Jay, who is also 36 years old. They are blessed with two children named Princes Jay, who is 11 years old and a freshman high school student and Mohammad Al-Niesser, who is 10 years old and a grade IV student. They are happily living in the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. Hanina has operated a sari-sari store business (community based store) in their village for three years. She wishes for her business to grow for it is a great help in meeting the needs of their family. With her income, she is able to assist her husband who is now working abroad. With her desire to earn more income, she decided to request a loan of 10,000 PHP from lenders for her to buy stocks of commodities. With this loan, she can provide for the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy stocks of commodities to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Elizabeth is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ramzieh

texts.en:
Ramzieh is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been working as a hairdresser from home since 1998. She works hard with her husband for better life conditions.

Today, Ramzieh is applying for a loan of $1,000 to buy appliances she needs to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy appliances

loans.name: Rakiétou

texts.fr: T. Rakiétou est née en 1976 à Djougou dans le Nord du Bénin. Mariée à SOUMANOU Yacoubou, un chauffeur, Rakiétou est mère de trois enfants, dont deux sont à sa charge. Seulement certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis environs trois ans. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Rakiétou n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Rakiétou vend de la nourriture (riz et haricot, accompagné de friture, etc.) à son domicile. Rakiétou s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rakiétou a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. La demande des clients se fait de plus en plus nombreuse ; mais Rakiétou ne dispose plus suffisamment de moyens financiers pour satisfaire la demande de tous les clients. C’est la raison pour laquelle Rakiétou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Rakiétou T. was born in 1976 in Djougou, in the North of Benin. She is married to Yacoubou SOUMANOU, a driver, and is the mother of three children, two of which are still under her care. Only some of her children are educated. The family has been living together for approximately three years in the Finagnon area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and the couple share household expenses. Rakiétou has not been to school. Rakiétou has been selling food from her home for the past ten years: rice and beans, with fried food, etc. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Rakiétou has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, that were both fully repaid. Customer demand is now increasing to the point where Rakiétou no longer has the financial means to satisfy all of her customers. For this reason she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice and beans, and sauce ingredients (tomatoes, onions, chillies)

loans.name: Nuuao

texts.en:
Nuuao M. is 70 and married with 10 children (ages 21 - 40 years).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Nuuao needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 tala or US $125 per week) to make improvements to her house.

In 2008, Nuuao joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Nuuao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Nuuao M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.99 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.99 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 37-year-old married man with two sons, one of whom attends school. He has been collecting garbage and offering Mpesa (mobile banking) services since 1998 and employs four people. With the 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he hopes to improve his collection business. He hopes to purchase more trucks for his business to expand to other estates and open a dealership in the future. Michael describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more trucks improve garbage collection services.

loans.name: Julia Flores

texts.en: Señora Juliana Flores is a member of the "Villa Universitaria" committee in the city of San Ignacio Misiones, located on Route 1.  She is the mother of five young children who live with her. Juliana's husband is a bus driver, and travels frequently. Juliana is currently the Director of Finance for the committee.  She also bakes homemade bread and sweets to sell in the community and sells vegetables grown in her own garden.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is now a widow, but that doesn't stop her from continuing to provide for her family. At age 55, she still manages to run a rice farm. She has three children to look after, and the oldest child helps her maintain their farm. She wants to improve her family's living conditions. She is grateful to have gained access to CEVI, which she thinks has helped a lot of farmers like her. She requested a loan of 6000 PHP. With this amount, Miriam can buy the necessary farm supplies she needs, like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy necessary farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
The loans Adelina requested and has received from ASHI since she joined in 2008 have opened her mind to discover a lot of things she needs to develop within herself in order to become an entrepreneur.  One is the realization that she is very lucky to have access to loans and increase her business capital. This is important to her because being a poor person who does small business, gaining her neighbors’ trust to lend her money is difficult. Before ASHI, her life, along with her 67-year-old husband's, was never easy. All of their children have their own family now and they can’t even support their family’s own needs. 

Therefore, Adelina and her husband agreed to request for a loan from Kiva through ASHI to be able to sustain and grow their small vegetable-selling business. They also chose their own terms of payment according to their capacity to pay since both of them are already old. However, despite their age, they still want to do business because this is their only way to support their own needs, especially for their medicines and body supplements.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo de 20 Años Soltero de Profesión Bachiller en computación del paraje Xerancho de la Aldea Tunayac, municipio de  Momostenango  departamento de  Totonicapán, es una persona responsable que ha trabajado hace mas de 4 años, en diferentes actividades que se organizan dentro de la comunidad, y no han tenido problemas con nadie lo conocen bien en la comunidad  .
Actualmente trabaja en un centro de Internet ubicado en el paraje de Pologuá prestando los servicios a la población en general. Los fines de semana estudia en la universidad
 La persona  necesita ampliar su Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la asociación de ASDIR de Pologuá,  para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 20 years old and single. He has his certificate in computer applications from the Xerancho state, Tunayac village, Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán department. He is a responsible person who has worked over four years in different activities that are organized within his community. He has not had any problems with anyone, and he is well known in the community. He currently works in an Internet center, which is located in the Pologuá state. He provides services to the general population. On the week-ends he studies at the university. He needs to increase his working capital. That is why he came to the offices of the ASDIR Association of Pologuá. He wants to be able to get a loan for his economic activity and be able to improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Rosa De La Cruz vive en el Bº Sta Rosa de la Ciudad de Ybycui, vive con su marido y con sus 2 hijos.
Lleva mas de 30 años en dicho negocio, empezó trabajando con su mamá, después viajó a Asunción buscando mejores oportunidades, estando allí pudo perfeccionarse estudiando Corte y Confección, después regresó por su ciudad natal para montar su propio negocio y de ahí iniciarse como modista profesional.
Actualmente se encuentra trabajando en su domicilio y ya cuenta con buena clientela quienes admiran mucho los trabajos que ella realiza. Confecciona ropas de todo tipo trajes, vestidos para novias, pantalones para damas y caballeros. 
Ella desea brindar otro servicio a su clientela montando una tienda con telas para que los clientes puedan tener la opción de elegir, para este fin solicita el préstamos y además por que recibió pedido de confección de uniformes para empleados de una fábrica de la compañía de Ybycui, y para algunos alumnos de los distintos colegios de dicha ciudad.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la ayuda a través del préstamos y asegura luchar con muchas ganas para seguir progresando
texts.en:
Rosa De La Cruz lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood of the city of Ybycui, along with her husband and two children. She has worked in her business for more than 30 years. She started working together with her mother, and she later went to Asunción in search of better opportunities. During her time there, she was able to advance her education by studying clothing design and creation. She later returned to her native city to start her own business as a professional clothing designer and creator. She currently works out of her home, and she has a solid base of customers who greatly admire her work. She creates clothing of all types, including suits, bridal gowns and trousers for men and women. She would like to provide an additional service to her customers: opening a fabric store to provide her clients with more choices. She is requesting the loan for this purpose, and also because she has received an order from a factory in Ybycui for employee uniforms, as well as orders for uniforms for students in some of the city's schools. Rosa is grateful to the Paraguaya Foundation for the help provided through the loan, and she assures us that she will work hard with a great desire to continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabrics

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
San Vicente, es un reflejo de la vitalidad y confianza de su gente que cuida y valora su tierra, gente de trabajo que apuesta al desarrollo, al comercio y al turismo, siendo un cantón  costero y por ser balneario es rico en fauna marina contando con una gran variedad de mariscos, que lo hacen atractivo para muchos turistas, a todas estas buenas cualidades de este hermoso cantón se suma  la buena perspectiva que tienen sus habitantes para  trabajar, y así muchos trabajan en varias actividades, como el caso de la señora Narcisa que tiene  48 años, está casada , tiene 6 hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de huevos y  pollos ella tiene su negocio en su casa, 

Shirley hace sus compras por mayor  y a su vez  distribuye los pollo a sus cliente fijos y a otros que va adquiriendo diariamente,  al día entrega 15  aves según lo que le pidan, el dinero que esta solicitando es para invertir más en su negocio,  los huevos los entrega a las panadería y tiendas, ella no centra su atención y esfuerzos en  esta actividad, también  se dedica  a la costura, estudió para esta profesión,  Shirley  ya hace parte de la moda y no deja de coser todos los modelos que le pidan sus clientas,  su esposo es muy trabajador y dedica muchas horas a su trabajo, sabe que el esfuerzo vale la pena,  el es chofer de una granja.
El  sueño de ella  es tener su carro para movilizarse con mayor facilidad y así  distribuir su producto, cree mucho en ella misma y la ayuda que le ha brindado la Fundación, por eso no duda  de que pronto gracias a la Fundación Espoir su sueño se hará realidad
texts.en:
San Vicente is a reflection of the vitality and confidence of the people who take care of it and value its land. These are people who work in development, commerce, and tourism. Being a coastal canton, and being a seaside resort, it is rich in marine fauna with a great variety of seafood. These make it very attractive to tourists. All of these good qualities of this beautiful canton add up to the good prospect that the inhabitants have for working. Many work in various activities. That is the case with 48 year old Narcisa. She is married and has six children. She buys and sells chickens, and her business is at her house. Shirley buys wholesale. She delivers the chicken to her fixed customers and to others that she acquires daily. She delivers 15 birds a day, according to what is ordered. The money that she is requesting is to invest more in her business. She delivers the eggs to bakeries and stores. She does not focus all of her attention and efforts on this activity. She also makes clothes, which she studied as a profession. Shirley is now part of the fashion, and she sews all types of designs that her customers request. Her husband is very hard-working. He works a lot of hours, and he knows that the effort is worth it. He is the driver on a farm. Her dream is to have a car to get around more easily and delivery her products. She believes in herself a lot and in the help offered by the Fundación. Therefore, she does not doubt that soon, thanks to the Fundación Espoir, her dream will be a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and eggs wholesale

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es:
El señor Nemecio V., se dedica a la agricultura y cría de ganando vacuno, en la comunidad de Londo, en la provincia de Capinota en Santivañez, localidad rural muy distante del área urbana de la provincia de Cochabamba.El señor Nemecio vive con sus dos hijos, con Carmen y Hugo de 15 y 10 años de edad, a pesar de que es casado su esposa se encuentra en Argentina y desde hace 6 meses que han perdido comunicación, por problemas familiares.

El señor Nemecio cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganando, las cuales con ayuda de sus hijos han podido darse sustento, 
además cultiva zanahoria, cebolla, maíz y papa, productos que los comercializan en el mercado de Santivañez. Carmen y Hugo estudian en el colegio en Santivañez, son muchachos muy aplicados y responsables que no han defraudado a su padre, colaboran tanto en su hogar como moralmente a su padre.

El señor Nemecio desea ver a sus hijos salir del colegio y poderles pagar una carrera en la universidad. Carmen está cursando segundo curso de secundaria, y está pensado estudiar una carrera técnica, veterinaria en la Universidad. Carmen a la edad que tiene necesita del apoyo de su mamá, pero ha podido asimilar el abandono de su madre. 

El señor Nemecio ha hecho de padre y madre, desde hace 6 meses y aunque no ha sido sencillo lo ha hecho muy bien. De este modo el señor Nemecio ha solicitado un crédito para incrementar por lo menos una cabeza de ganado y alimento de este modo poder generar más ingresos, ingresos que los está ahorrando para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Nemecio V., works in agriculture and raising cattle in the community of Londo, Capinota province in Santivañez. This is a rural locality far from the urban part of the province of Cochabamba. Mr. Nemecio lives with his two children, Carmen and Hugo, 15 and 10 years old respectively. He is married, but his wife has been living in Argentina. They lost contact six months ago due to family problems. Nemecio has four head of cattle, which with his children's help has provided them with sustenance. They also grow carrots, onions, corn, and potatoes which they sell at the market in Santivañez. Carmen and Hugo study at the high school in Santivañez; they are very dedicated and responsible children that have made their father proud. They provide their father with emotional support and support in the home. Nemecio hopes to see his children graduate from high school and go on to University. Carmen is finishing his second year of high school and hopes to study to be a veterinarian at the University. Carmen is at an age when she needs a mother's support, but she is learning to cope without her mother. He has acted as father and mother for the last six months, and though it has not been easy he is doing well. Nemecio is applying for a loan to purchase at least one more head of cattle and cattle feed. This way we will be able to generate more income which he can use to support his children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy cow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn R., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Jocelyn, a widow with two children, has always been challenged to provide daily needs for her family. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own general store for years and is now planning to expand to a new variety store.

Jocelyn has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP50,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more quantities of groceries, beverages and other items for the opening of her new variety store.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide an education for her children. She also dreams to be able to buy their own house and lot. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying additional items for her existing general store and to buy bulk groceries and softdrinks for a new expansion.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad F., 55, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Alfredo F., a tricycle operator, and they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she earns well so that her family can have a better life. She has been managing her own tricycle business for quite some time now.

Felicidad has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her tricycle business.

To ensure the success of her business, Felicidad would like to apply for an 18,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital to expand her business by buying spare parts for her tricycle. Some of the loan will also be used to repair the tricycle. Felicidad dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide a comfortable and happy life for her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair a tricycle

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
En un barrio de Barranquilla donde el bingo y el festival de las cervezas es muy usual, para recaudar fondos comunes,porque lo conforma gente muy solidaria, Vive y tiene su negocio Diana María M., allí se dedica a la elaboración de comidas especialmente fritos y almuerzos. Ella  tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 27 años de edad, es separada y en la actualidad tiene a su cargo los dos hijos menores, a través del ingreso generado por este negocio.

Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que planea invertirlo en la compra del techo para su carro  de perros calientes,  o sea en una carpa y el  resto lo invertirá en materias primas como arroz, aceite y harina en mayor volumen.

Desde sus 13 años  Diana María comenzó a trabajar como empleada del servicio doméstico, hasta llegar a los 40 años, momento en el que decidió cumplir su sueño de niña: "el de tener un negocio propio", así fue como inició con la venta de fritos como patacones con  una ponchera en la puerta  de su casa;  luego amplió el negocio agregándole papas rellenas de carne o pollo y mixtas,  pasteles, almuerzos y así ha surgido y ha contribuido de manera importante con el sustento de su familia, especialmente de sus 2 hijos  a cargo,  levantándolos con esfuerzo y trabajo persistente,  por no tener el apoyo de su padre. Su sueño grande es tener una casa propia, ampliar su negocio con mayor variedad de comidas rápidas.
