Ahora su gran desafío es que sus hijos mayores sean independientes y también adecuar su negocio a las condiciones que exige la convivencia del barrio, así como cuando debió reemplazar rápidamente su trabajo en leña por una estufa a gas, ella se sintió mas cómoda y sus vecinos también.
texts.en:
Bingo and the beer festival are popular Barranquilla events where the community can earn money, because it is a community comprised of people with a great sense of solidarity. Diana María M. is a resident and has her business here, where she dedicates herself to making fried foods and lunches. She has 5 children ages 12 to 27, is separated and currently still cares for her two younger children. She makes her living through her business. This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to invest the funds into the purchase of a cover for her hot dog vending cart. She will invest the rest into buying basic ingredients in bulk, such as rice, cooking oil, and flour. When she was 13 years old, Diana María started working as a domestic, an activity she carried out until she turned 40. At that point, she decided to make a childhood dream a reality: to have her own business. This is how she got started selling fried foods such as patacones (fried plantains) from the front porch of her home. She later expanded her business by adding papas rellenas (stuffed potatoes) of beef, chicken or mixed, cakes, and lunches. This activity that has gone a long way in sustaining the family, especially the two youngest children that she still supports. She has triumphed through her own effort and work ethic, given the lack of support from their father. Her biggest dreams are to own a house and to expand her business with a greater variety of fast foods. Currently, her greatest challenges are to see her older children become independent and to outfit her enterprise to meet the neighborhood’s demands. So, when she had to replace her wood stove with a gas one, she was able to work and serve her neighbors more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cover for her hot dog vending cart, and to buy basic ingredients such as rice, cooking oil and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Kangulumira Aids Services Group

texts.en:
Most people supply the deficiencies in their salaries or low profits with odd jobs or they decide to concurrently run 2 or 3 businesses. From the point of view of a business, it is definitely an advantage when an individual bears a hand in many undertakings, the bottom-line being more profits.

S. John, 25 years old, makes 40,000 UGX per day from his business selling fruits and vegetables, primarily pineapples, jackfruits and passion fruits. For the past year, he has exhibited an enterprising and hardworking ethic that most young people of his age lack. He has won his laurels from his community of Kiwalasi-Kayunga, as the community leaders keep on saying that his example is one to be emulated by all young people. He is still a bachelor and has no children. With this in mind, he can look forward to a bright future. He is planning to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory: men´s and women´s fragrances, clothing

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida lives in a small city called Kot Radha Kishen which is a located in Punjab province of Pakistan. Kot Radha Kishen is famous for its agriculture and dairy industry.  She is 36 years old married to G. and a mother of three children, two sons and a daughter. Sajida is aware of the importance of education and that’s why she is why she is sending them in nearby school. Her daughter is studying in 5th grade and sons are in 9th and 8th grades respectively. Sajida is Christian by religion and lives in a 2 room brick house with her family in the area of Clarkabad.  Her husband operates a grocery shop in his house. He has dedicated a room for this purpose and sells cooking oil, lentils, rice, spices and other household items. He has been doing this business for the last 15 years. Sajida is very supportive in nature. Though she is a house wife, she works at the grocery shop in the absence of her husband.  

Sajida has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to use the loan to buy more grocery items for his shop. By adding more variety of groceries Sajida hopes that her husband will be able to earn extra income and improves his business condition.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 7th loan cycle. In previous loans she has proven to be a good client. She never missed any meeting and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for a grocery shop

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a soldier and he contributes to the family's basic needs. She has been operating her business of selling handbags, shoes and second-hand clothing for the last three years, and sells from home to her neighbors and passers-by.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase a bale of clothing, handbags and shoes. She faces a major challenge with high transport costs and seasonality. She hopes to be self-reliant in her business in the future. 

Mercy decided to work with Yehu in order to obtain a loan to add stock. She lives in her own house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothing, handbags and shoes for sale

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry P. was born in 1970. She is a villager in Thnong Roleung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Morn Oem, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a secondhand clothes seller in a local market where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So, to improve her goal, Mrs. Ry P. is applying for a loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She is a mother of five children, one of whom is a construction worker, three are studying in school, and the other does home work.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old.  He lives in the center of Capilla Santa Rosa in Caserio Siaulupe Baca in Lambayeque, a rural region predominately populated by individuals who raise animals.

For the last two years, Jose has maintained a business raising and selling livestock. He provides them with feed and shelter within his home. Once they have grown to the appropriate size, he sells them to his neighbors or in local markets.

Jose is requesting this loan in order to expand his herd, purchase feed in bulk and make repairs to his corrals. He expects that these additions to his business will help him expand his business and gain additional independence.

Jose is a hardworking young man with a strong drive to get ahead in life. This will be his first loan with our institution and he exhibits a clean credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals and feed and to repair the corrals

loans.name: Doruka

texts.en: Doruka O. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes at home and is requesting a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell.  Doruka is 35 years old and is married to a businessman. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 30 years old and is married to Ibrahim who alsw contributes towards the family income. Together they have two dependent children. Hannah has been running her grocery shop for nine years, with an income of Kshs 7400.

She is taking out her third loan with KADET to increase the stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes to expand her business to improve her standard of living and to accumulate some savings.

loans.use: Buy more stocks of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine Hitayezu is 32 years old and married to a veteran. She has four children between the ages of 1 and 12 years old. Three of her children go to school. Francine sells fruit, such as oranges; she has had this business for the period of ten years. 

She has requested this loan to buy more fruit to sell. She would also like to buy some livestock, which could provide much return in the future. Her business has done much for her daily life.  She dreams of owning a truck, which may help her in the transportation of her fruit and enable her to become a supplier in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: Koemsroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Koemsroeun P. (pictured with her young daughter) is 28 years old and her husband, Mr. Tharith Chea is 33 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 20 kilometers away. They have been married since 2000 and have three children--two sons and one daughter. The eldest attends school and other two are still too young. 

Koemsroeun sells rice and food in the village. Her husband has been a security guard for 2 years. She is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha Torres A. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa. Ella tiene su pequeño puesto en el populoso mercado Oriental desde hace 12 años negocio que poco a poco fue surgiendo en el cual invertirá el crédito.
texts.en: Mrs. Martha Torres A. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who is a clothing merchant. She has had a small stand in the crowded Oriental Market for the last 12 years.  The business has gradually been growing.  She will invest the loan in it.

loans.use: For clothing.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac M. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Isaac has a grocery store business, which he has run for four years.
To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items for his store. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Isaac hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Isaac hopes to expand his business further.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his store

loans.name: Carlos Jadith

texts.es: El Sr. Carlos Jadith F. C. vive junto a su esposa e hija. Vive en casa alquilada la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio de casablanca. El Sr. Carlos trabaja como obrero de campo en diferentes fundos de la zona hace varios años. Su esposa tambien es obrera de campo. El Sr. Carlos solicita el crédito para la compra de un modulo de vivienda. Su sueño según nos comenta es tener su propio terreno y poder construir su vivienda. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mr. Carlos C. Carlos Jadith lives together with his wife and daughter. They live in a rental home located in the village of Casa Blanca. Carlos is an agricultural worker on various farms in the area. His wife is also an agricultural worker. Carlos is seeking the loan to buy a housing unit. He tells us that his dream is to have his own piece of land on which to construct his house. Carlos is very grateful for the support that we can provide him through this financing.

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Jessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
JESSICA DEL CARMEN M. O., ELLA TRABAJA COMO SECRETARIAS TIENE TRES AÑOS DE EJERCER ESE OFICIO, ES MADRE DOLTERA DE UN NIÑO Y ESTE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR.
ELLA VISITA NUESTRA OFICINA DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ZINC, PERLINES Y PINTURA PARA REPARAR EL TECHO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION.
 ES PRIMERA VES QUE SOLICITA PRESTAMOS CON CEPRODEL, TODO ESTO PARA DARLES UNA MEJOR CONDICION DE VIDA A SU FMAILIA.
texts.en:
Jessica del Carmen M. O. has been employed as a Secretary for three years.  She is a single mother of a school age son.

She visits our Ceprodel offices to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, metal struts and paint to repair her house’s roof.

This is the first time she’s asked for a Ceprodel loan; all of this is in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Libia, tiene 56 años de edad, es divorciada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en la ciudad del Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Libia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la atender su tienda de abarrotes. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Libia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas para abastecer su tienda.   

Libia pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Libia, 56, has 4 children, is divorced, and lives in the city of Calca in Cusco department, Peru.  After finishing up her housework, she works in her grocery store. She has had this business for 15 years and it’s going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time Libia needs a loan to buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products to supply her store.

Libia belongs to the Señor de Huanca communal bank of the Arawira Association.  She is thankful for the opportunity offered her with this financing and she promises to complete her payments in the required time.

loans.use: To buy items such as rice, sugar, noodles and other products to supply her store

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat, who is 29 years old, married, and the father of one child, operates Jaostec Agencies, an enterprise which sells and installs car accessories such as alarms.  He also sells auto spare parts in order to supplement his income.  Previously a barber, Jopsephat has learned the importance of team work since he joined Hanan group in Faulu Kenya, something that has enabled him to save his money.  He has also been guaranteed a loan with the group members.  Josephat will use the loan of 20,000 Kes to buy car alarms and expand.

loans.use: To buy car alarms and expand.

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia tiene 43 años y nació en el departamento de Apuricma. Actualmente, Virginia vive en la comunidad de Yanahuara provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijos pues su esposo hace varios años que falleció pero Virginia es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora  que a pesar de las adversidad saca adelante a su familia, ella nos cuenta que en la comunidad en que vive la gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pues son los proveedores de verduras para las ciudad de Cusco, Puno, Puerto Maldonado y otros departamentos del Perú pero Virginia se dedica a la venta de cerveza, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para uso personal es que su casa falta poner ventanas y puertas a construcción nueva que hizo en su domicilio. 

Virginia pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varias años.
texts.en:
Virginia is 43 years old and was born in Apuricma department.  She currently lives in Yanahuara community, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.   Virginia is a widow and has three children.  Her husband died several years ago but Virginia is a driven, hard-working woman who has managed to get her family ahead in life in spite of adversity.  She tells us that the people in her community farm and raise livestock.  They supply vegetables to the cities of Cusco, Puno, Puerto Maldonado and other departments in Peru.

Virginia's business is selling beer.  On this occasion, she requires a loan for personal use.  She has built an extension on her home and it needs windows and doors.

Virginia is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “Villa Marcela de Virgen del Carmen” community bank and has been working with her fellow bank members for several years.

loans.use: to put windows and doors in an extension that she has built on her home (personal use)

loans.name: Gulbaara's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaara D., 56, is the leader of this group. She is a widow. All of her kids are abroad except her youngest son, who is a college student. 

Gulbaara has been a librarian for a long period of time. Aaside from that she also owns a rich household of a cow with a calf, six heads of sheep and goats. Her business was started with the breeding of one calf by Gulbaara’s mother-in-law. Gulbaara has worked hard to keep the business running and it has paid her back by allowing the family income to cover the major repair costs of the house. The monthly income is 3,000 soms. With the loan from Kiva, she plans to buy poultry and start the retail sale of eggs. Gulbaara’s dream is to build a poultry farm. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida is from the village of Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Naida buys and sells coconuts in the local community. 

Naida has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. Naida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase coconuts to sell.

Naida is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP with which she will purchase additional coconuts to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Naida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Joselyn

texts.en:
Joselyn is from the village of Tui-an Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta Mis. Occ. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joselyn runs a dried fish selling business. 

Joselyn has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5,735 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Joselyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC with which to finance her house repairs. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finance her house repairs

location.town: Oroquieta-Tui-an Dolipos Bajo, Oroq., Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Ife Sowakpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE SOWAKPO est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à la même association d’artisan. Le représentant de ce groupe, nommé Chèfiou, est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Chèfiou est marié à une certaine Mariama. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont les leurs. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Chèfiou a très peu fréquenté l’école, mais a appris le métier de coiffure. Il y a près de huit ans que Chèfiou exerce cette activité, ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Chèfiou désire mieux équiper son salon de coiffure par l’achat d’autres matériels de coiffure performants. Pour ce faire, Chèfiou  sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Ife Sowakpo group is made up of three people who belong to the same craft association. The group's representative Chèfiou is the one raising his hand in the photo.

This is the second time the group has sought ALIDé's financial support in order to increase the level of their business. Chèfiou is married to a woman named Mariama, and the couple is raising five children, all in school and four of which are their own. The couple lives with their children, and together they meet the various needs of the family.

Chèfiou did not go to school much, but he learned the hairdressing business. He's been in the business for almost eight years, and it allows him to meet his family's needs without much difficulty. In order to better respond to the demand of his clients, Chèfiou would like to upgrade his hair salon by purchasing better equipment. To do that, Chèfiou is seeking, with his group, a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy clippers and cosmetics.

loans.name: Walter Ivan

texts.es:
Walter Ivan tiene 30 años de edad, vive en union libre vive con la compañera y con los 4 hijos de 9, 5, 4 y 3 años, viven en Parroquia San Pablo perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel.

Los miembros de la V.R.C UNION Y ESPERANZA  se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia San Pablo a 30 minutos de la oficina en San Miguel los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembra de maíz, papas y al comercio ventas de legumbres y otros.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y choclo, este trabajo lo viene desarrollando desde hace mucho tiempo, las compras las realiza en San Miguel y Vende sus productos en San Pablo y San Miguel en las ferias.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz y choclo, el crédito el ayudado a aumentar los ingresos y la producción, ha enfrentado desafíos como la falta de trabajadores y el variación del clima que en ocasiones a dañado los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte como el indor y festejar las fiestas .
texts.en:
Walter Ivan, 30, lives with his partner and their four children who are 9-, 5-, 4- and 3-years old, respectively.  They live in San Pablo parrish in the Ecuadorean canton of San Miguel.

The members of the UNION Y ESPERANZA community bank meet in San Pablo, some 30 minutes from our office in San Miguel.  The members of the bank are famers.  They grow maize, potatoes and vegetables, among other crops.

Walter grows maize and corn.  He's built his farm over many years.  He buys supplies in San Miguel and sells his products in the markets in San Pablo and San Miguel.

Walter is applying for a loan to buy seeds for his next maize and corn crop.  The loan will help him increase his production and, in turn, his income. The challenges he faces include a shortage of workers and vagaries in the weather that damage his crops.  His dream is to buy land.

Walter likes to watch sports and go to local festivals.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Am

texts.en:
Am is 32 years old and resides with her husband and children at Siem Reap province. Since 2010, her career has been planting vegetables, and she earns US $3 a day. Her husband has been a policeman in the village since 1997, and his income is US $5 per day. She has two children, 8 and 5 years old. One is studying. 

Each month, she has to spend US $50 on food and US $8 on other expenses. 

Am would like to ask for a loan of US $600 to purchase a motorbike to go to work. 

In the future, she plans to raise more pigs to sell and if she can save more money, she will repair her house to be more comfortable. She will keep part of the profits she gets from her career for her children to study until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is 39 years old, married and has four children. For the last 18 years, he has earned a living making and repairing vehicle interiors. He has applied for this loan to buy more supplies and tools for his business. His goal is to use his profits to pay for his children’s education and improve their standard of living. In the future, he would like to keep expanding his business. Onesmus describes himself as hardworking, humble and friendly.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a business repairing vehicle interiors.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa situada en la ciudad de Quimbiri junto a su conviviente Alberto de 38 años y lo que más desean es sacar adelante a sus 02 queridos hijos y así poder vivir una vejez tranquila. Teofila anteriormente laboraba en diferentes trabajos, pero siempre anhelaba contar con su propio negocio. Es así que con sus ahorros acumulados más con el apoyo de su pareja pudo tener un bazar de ropa. Actualmente su puesto es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que ofrece ropa de primera calidad, ella es una persona muy atenta pues siempre recibe a sus clientes cordialmente dispuesta a ayudarles en sus compras, y así estén satisfechos. Su negocio es muy ordenado y apreciado por su clientela; su comercio lo realiza en la ciudad de Quimbiri, donde la atención es de primera calidad, el trabajo lo cumple en compañía de su pareja donde llevan trabajando 09 años. Con el crédito, comprará ganchos y andamios para exhibir mejor sus prendas. Este es su tercer crédito, esta muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir avanzando. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles comprará prendas de vestir y para ello viajará a la ciudad de lima.
texts.en:
Teofila is 32 years old. She is a very hard-working woman, who lives in her own house in the city of Quimbiri together with her partner Alberto, who is 38. What they want most is to help their two children to get on well in life and so be able to live to a peaceful old age. Teofila has previously worked in a number of different jobs, but always longed to have her own business. With her savings and the support of her partner, she therefore opened a clothing stall. Her stall is now well frequented by her customers, since she offers top-quality clothing and because she is a very attentive salesperson. She always welcomes her customers cordially and puts herself at their disposal while they make their purchases, and so they are satisfied customers.

Her business is always kept tidy, which is appreciated by the clientele; she trades in the city of Quimbiri, where people pay attention to quality. Teofila and her partner have had the business for 9 years now. With the loan, Teofila plans to buy hangers and rails to better display her garments. This is her third loan. She is very happy to know that she can once again count on your support. With the new loan of 2,000 Soles, she will travel to the city of Lima and buy items of clothing there.

loans.use: To travel to the city of Lima to buy more items of clothing.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been practicing mixed farming for 15 years in his hometown in eastern Kenya. His mixed farm produces cabbages, potatoes, maize and milk, which he sells to brokers. He earns additional income from his grocery shop in the same area. His biggest challenges have been pests and diseases, insufficient water for irrigation and a poor market for his farm produce.

John has made a loan request of 30,000 Kenyan shillings in order to cultivate potatoes and cabbages. He says that the income that will be generated from this project will enable him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he plans to acquire more dairy cows and buy a chuff cutter that will enable him to expand his dairy farm.

John is 59 and married with three children who all attend school.

loans.use: To cultivate potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en:
Rodulfo is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Rodulfo is providing motorela or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline used for his motorela services.

Rodulfo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Rodulfo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for gasoline

loans.name: Meth

texts.en:
Mrs. Meth is 45 years old and lives in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school and another daughter is working in a restaurant where she can earn a low monthly salary. 

Nowadays, Meth has a business selling plates, pots and frying pans. From this business, she can earn an average profit of around US $5 per day. To improve her family members' lives, Mrs. Meth would like to borrow some funds in order to purchase plates, pots and frying pans. She said that this fund is very useful for her business. Meth hopes to generate greater profits and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plates, pots and frying pans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 50 years old and married to Charles. They have four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Mary hopes to become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business of buying and selling farm products, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to expand her business and establish a shop to sell her products in the future.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
This is Herminia, 51, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Baldrich, a carpenter. All of her siblings are still studying. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Herminia owns a sari-sari store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar, and primary commodities that are needed in every household. Aside from this, she also sells pork and rice. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 that will help her to continue operations.  She will use the loan to buy additional grocery items that will help her to accommodate the demands of her customers.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business, “the more display of grocery items, more customers will come to your store because they believe you have what they need.” 

Herminia dreams of providing a comfortable life for her family and seeing all of her children with a stable job in the future. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San is 22 and is a young man who is married with a lovely kid. He is in the marketing business and sells products for the CK Company, located in Kompong Chhnang province. Every day, he travels back and forth to provide wholesale products to general stores around local markets and he also takes some time to find new customers. Mr. San is skillful in using his language to persuade customers to buy his products. He gets a monthly salary; however, he also receives a commission on every product he sells. Typically, he earns around 7.50 USD per day. 

Mr. San wishes to create a business for his wife to sell items such as groceries, foods, and other household products in a local area. He will buy these items in bulk and resell them at a reasonable price. Mr. San hopes this business will provide a high income and a better standard living.

Mr. San is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase the products to start this business for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and household items to sell

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 23 years old.  She is married and has one child who is 5 years old. She also takes care of a relative who is 17 years old. 

Antoinette is commonly known for selling charcoals.  Her business hours are from 7 am until 6 pm every day.  She currently employs 2 people to help her. 

Antoinette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more bags of charcoals for sale. With the additional charcoal, she will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and she can keep providing all the basic needs for her family.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Namubila S. H. G. Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namubila Group in Western Kenya! Janet is the facilitator of the Namubila SHG group. She is in the photograph with her group members. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janet takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janet was only able to harvest 1 bag of maize on 1/2 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Janet will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing (goats).

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February, 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. In 2012, the members of Namubila SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has been in active farming in her home area of Nkubu in Central Kenya for 24 solid years and currently still makes deliveries of milk,  potatoes, beans, cabbage, and carrots to the local market.

Margaret has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct a zero grazing unit on her farm. She says feeding of dairy cows has become very expensive and the unit will help manage the animals better. She intends to use the gains made in farming to educate her children.

She laments the high costs of feed and low prices for produce in the market.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Don Julio, de 49 años de edad, originario de Telica municipio de  la ciudad de León, casado, tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos se esta preparando para estudiar arquitectura y el menor de sus hijos esta cursando el sexto grado de la primaria. 

Don Julio se gana la vida vendiendo ropa en su humilde carretón de manera ambulante, el se ubica en el Parque  en Telica donde sale desde tempranas horas a vender camisetas, shorts, pantalones, blusas para damas, camisas y pantalones para niños. Ates se dedicaba a trabajar como chofer particular de una empresa, después fue taxista pero con su negocio de venta de ropa lleva 5 años. 

El requiere el préstamo para compra de ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos para aprovechar las ventas navideñas y mejorar las ventas pues parte de lo que gana lo ahorra para la educación de sus hijos que es lo mas importante para el . Además quiere en lo futuro quiere expandirse a vender en diferentes municipios como el Sauce, Malpaisillo, Quezalguaque y también quiere comprar un carretón, maniquíes para colocar su ropa y darle una mejor presentación a su mercadería.
texts.en:
Julio, 49, is a native of the town of Telica in the city of León.  He is married and has three children, one of whom is getting ready to study architecture.  The youngest of his children is in elementary school, in sixth grade.

Julio makes a living as a street vendor selling clothing in his modest cart.  He is located in a park in Telica, where he goes out early in the morning to sell t-shirts, shorts, pants, women's blouses, shirts, and pants for children.  Previously he worked as a personal driver for a company.  Later he was a taxi driver but he has had his clothing business for five years.

He needs the loan to buy clothing for children, youth, and adults, to take advantage of Christmas sales and improve his sales, because he spends part of what he earns on his children's education, which is the most important thing for him. 

In addition, in the future he wants to expand into selling in different towns such as El Sauce, Malpiasillo, and Quezalguaque.  He also wants to buy a cart and mannequins to display his clothes and better present his merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing for children, youth, and adults.

loans.name: By God In Power I Group

texts.en:
Lamrana is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lamrana was born in one of the several villages that make up the Sanda community. She is about thirty-three years of age. She is married to a businessman and the couple has three children, two of whom are attending secondary school. Lamrana sells market food – rice, groundnuts, onions, palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. She has been doing business for almost fifteen years now.

With the help of this loan, Lamrana and her group members will be able to expand their businesses and make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Lamrana will use her share of the loan to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, groundnuts, onions, palm-oil, margi, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

Teresita has been in this business for 25 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Aizétou

texts.fr:
Aizétou est une femme  âgé(e) de 43 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 05 enfants tous scolarisés. L’ainé a 20ans et le dernier 10ans.
Aizétou travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 1998. Elle vend au marché et n’a pas de difficultés principale.
Aizétou a requis son second  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales. Elle veut diversifier ses marchandises.
Dans les prochaines années, Aizétou voudrait agrandir l’activité.  Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille.
texts.en:
Aizétou is a forty-three year old woman. She is married to a driver. She has five children, all in school. The oldest is twenty years old and the youngest is ten. Aizétou has worked as a reseller of grains since 1998. She sells at the market and doesn't have any major difficulties. 
Aizétou has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy grains. She would like to diversify her merchandise.
In the coming years, Aizétou would like to increase her business activity. She says that with the profits, she foresees ensuring the vital needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
Don Juan Ramón tiene 53 años de edad, es casado con 4 hijos con edades de 29, 26, 23 y 18 los cuales ya trabajan, el vive con su familia en Cofradía, Cortes. 
Don Juan trabajaba como operario de maquina en una maquila, pero después se independizo para lograr establecer  su propia barbería la cual ha visionado tener. El inició su negocio desde hace 20 años brindando servicio  de corte de pelo, barba y otros, también ofrece a sus clientes la venta de gelatinas para el cabello, cremas de afeitar y  lociones. 
Es su segundo préstamo con ODEF el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos de barbería, gelatinas, cremas etc. Para poder ofrecer  a sus clientes un servicio completo y darle mayor realce a su negocio para así aumentar mas sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juan Ramó, age 53, is married and has four children, ages 29, 26, 23, and 18.  The children work.  He lives with his family in Cofradía, Cortes.

Juan worked as a machine operator in a factory, but he later became independent.  He did this to establish his own barber shop, which he envisioned having.  He started his business 20 years ago, and he provides services such as cutting hair, beards, and others.  He also sells hair gel, aftershave, and lotions to his customers.

This is his second loan with ODEF.  He will use it to buy barber products, gels, and creams, etc.  He will do this in order to offer his customers a complete service and to enhance his business to increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy barber products, hair gel, and creams, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a food market in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her stall.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gilda dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Margaret wants to rent a semi permanent stall to enable her display her finished work and tap more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE TWO MOTOR WATER PUMPS

loans.name: Baby

texts.en: Baby has been a client of Kraban Support Foundation for years now. She has had several training sessions on simple record keeping and loan management from the organization. She makes beads for local and foreign markets. She is seeking a loan of US$900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba is married and has a 9-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker. Ever since she was very young, Rosalba always enjoyed selling things, and, years later, she began helping her mother sell a variety of products to help her husband with household expenses. Three years ago, she started her own business selling solely beauty products. It has gone well for her, and she currently has a clientele who order several items from her.

Rosalba is requesting a loan of $200, which she will use to purchase supplies and satisfy her clients' orders so she can keep them coming back. She doesn't want to lose customers because there is a lot of competition in her field. She plans to repay the loan within three months. Rosalba and her family are very grateful for your support so they can continue growing their business and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosalba esta casada y tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como albañil y ella desde muy joven siempre le han gustado las ventas y empezó años atrás para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ayudando a su mamá en venta de diversos productos, con el paso del tiempo aproximadamente 3 años atrás se independizó y comenzó ella sola a vender productos de belleza. Le ha ido bien por ello continúa con su negocio y ya tiene una cartera de clientes los cuales le tienen varios pedidos y ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo.

Rosalba está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes y así mantenerlos y no perderlos ya que existe mucha competencia en este mercado, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Rosalba y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies

loans.name: Aishe

texts.en: Aishe has had her own business selling clothing for the past five years. Her little kiosk is located at the busy City market in Novaya Kohovka, Ukraine. Aishe started her business to help support her family. She and her husband, Vadim, have two children – a 17 year old daughter and 14 year old son. Aishe likes what she does and looks forward to increasing her income. She has requested a loan of $400 to help purchase more clothing and increase the assortment and quantity of her inventory.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Mushvig

texts.ru:
Mushvig lives in a suburb of Saatli, Azerbaijan, located in the Southern Caucasus. He is married and is 28 years old. 10 years ago he started his business by renting a store in Saatli. Using his personal savings he filled it with goods. He purchased part of the inventory on credit.

The business is going well, but Mushvig decided to increase his inventory through an infusion of capital which he would like to get in the form of a loan. For this purpose, he has turned to the local affiliate of Normicro with a request for a $500 loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Шахбазов Мушвиг живет в пригороде Саатлы Республики Азербайджан расположенном в Южном Кавказе. Он женат, ему 28 лет. 10 лет тому назад он начал свой бизнес, арендовав маркет в городе Саатлы. Имея свои собственные сбережения, он наполнис его товаром. Часть товара он взял в кредит. Несмотря на то, что торговля идет хорошо, Мушвиг решил увеличить оборот своего капитала за счет инвестиции, которую он хочет сделать в форме полученного кредита. Поэтому он обратился с заявлением к местному филлиалу микро кредитной организации "Нормикро" с просьбой о предоставлении ему кредита в 500 долларов.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 5 seats and a blow dryer

loans.name: Mayra Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mrs.M. used to work as an operator in a local factory but did not earn enough to suport her family. She decided to open a small retail shop selling sandals and medicine. Being a single mother of two children with an aging mom to tend to forced her to make the decision to seek a small loan to begin selling her goods from a small table and a basket.

Currently Mrs. M. feels very fortunate to have received 18 loans from Ceprodel. These loans have provided her with the working capital to improve her family´s quality of life and to reduce the costs of purchasing the medicine which she is selling.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Working capital and stock purchase

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B. is married with one child. She lives in Ordzhonikidze. Marina sells clothing in the local central market. Marina’s business offers a big assortment of clothing inventory at affordable prices - a combination that is always in high demand with customers. She started her venture three and a half years ago. Today she has about $12000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $700.

Marina is requesting a loan of $1200 to open a new vending facility in a different city market and stock it with merchandise. We believe Marina’s responsibility, focused commitment and willingness to make sacrifices even at her own expense will guarantee prompt loan repayment and result in the success of her small business.

loans.use: To open seasonal clothing facility

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia and her children live in a rental on Pinos Street in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She's a single mother who works as a maid, but her small salary isn't enough. That's why she decided to start a small-scale business and the loan she is asking for is starter capital to begin selling school supplies.

She doesn't have any credit history with IMPRO, but she qualifies for one because of her desire to better herself and the social aspect of our institution.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Virginia vive en alquiler en la calle los pinos de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz con sus hijos; es madre soltera y trabaja como empleada domestica pero su sueldo es muy poco y no le alcanza por lo cual decidió dedicarse al comercio minorista y el crédito que solicita es para capital de arranque y empezara su negocio vendiendo material escolar. No tiene antecedente Histórico con Impro pero califica para acceder a uno por su deseo de superación y por el carácter social que tiene nuestra Institución

loans.use: To buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, pens, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es:
Guillermo is a 64 year old man who lives in Laurels North. He is married; his wife is a housewife. They have 2 children. The eldest, 28 years old and married, lives with Guillermo and his wife. They are a very close family that likes having the children close by. The 28 year old son helps Guillermo with his work. Father and son work selling vegetables along a set route from the back of their small truck. Guillermo drives the truck and his son takes care of the sales from the truck bed. They work this way every day of the week, passing through all the surrounding neighborhoods block by block. Currently Guillermo is living a difficult situation. The motor of his truck has been damaged and he is requesting a loan with which to repair it, since the vehicle is his only means of earning an income.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Don Guillermo es un hombre de 64 años de edad que Habita en los Laureles Norte, es casado y su esposa es ama de casa, tiene dos hijos, el mayor de 28 años casado y vive con él ya que son una familia muy unida que les gusta tener a los hijos cerca, este joven le ayuda en el trabajo. Don Guillermo junto a su hijo trabajan vendiendo verduras ruteado en una camionetita don Guillermo maneja el vehiculo y su hijo en la tina se en carga de las ventas, esto todos los días por todos los barrios aledaños de cuadra en cuadra. Actualmente están pasando una situación difícil en vista que el motor del vehiculo se daño y solicita un préstamo para repararlo ya que ese vehiculo es su único medio de trabajo.

loans.use: Buy a motor for the small truck from which he sells fruit.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru:
Firdavs R. lives in Gissar region. He is 24 and single. He has a university diploma in economics. Firdavs lives in an area called Navobod where he has a small store. The clients sells food items. He has been in this business for 5 years. Firdavs has a lare family and his parents no longer work. The client can not take care of the family on a salary of an economist. His business allows Firdavs' family to purchase all the necessities.

Currently, the client would like to buy a large number of goods, which is why he needs money. Firdas decided to apply for a loan, thereby increasing the amount of his capital. Local people would be able to purchase all the necessary foods without having to leave the area where they live. The client plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer

Расулов Фирдавс Сангимуродович проживает в районе Гиссар.Возраст 24 года, холост.Образование высшее, по специальности экономист. Фирдавс проживает в махалле Навобод, там имеет небольшой магазин.Клиент торгует продуктами питания.Занимается бизнесом более 5 лет.У Фирдавса большая семья , родители уже не работают. Клиент содержать семью на заработную плату экономиста не может. Бизнес позволяет семье Фирдавса приобретать самое необходимое. В данное время клиент хочет закупить больше товара ,для чего ему нужны деньги. Фирдавс решил взять кредит ,тем самым увеличить оборот денежного капитала. Местные жители могут покупать необходимые продукты питания не выезжая в за пределы района.Клиент планирует погасить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Blanca Ninoska

texts.es:
Blanca is seeking a loan to invest into home improvements, specifically for the construction of a bedroom. She works as a primary school teacher at the Salomón Ibarra Mayorga School. She has a 5-year old child, who is in pre-school. Despite that she is single and can’t count on assistance from her child’s father, she is a very responsible mother. She also has assumed the responsibility of caring for her grandmother. It’s important to explain that she has improved her house little by little with previous loans. She is a hardworking woman who gets up at 4 a.m. each morning to make breakfast for her child and grandmother, given that by 6 a.m. she has to travel to the town of Los Angeles to teach the rural children of that area.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Blanca está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda para la construcción de una habitación, trabaja como docente de Educación Primaria en la Escuela Salomón Ibarra Mayorga, tiene un niño de 5 años de edad el cual esta estudiando en pre escolar; a pesar que es una mujer soltera que no cuenta con la ayuda del papá del niño, es una madre muy responsable con su hijo, ademas asume la responsabilidad del cuido de su abuelita, es importante explicar que está clienta con los créditos anteriores ha ido poco a poco mejorando su vivienda, es una mujer trabajadora que todos los dias tiene que levantarse a las cuatro de la mañana para así dejarle hecho el desayuno a su abuelita y a su hijo ya que a las seis de la mañana tiene que viajar a la colonia los Angeles a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de esa colonia.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36 year-old Sophia N..  She is married and has three children aged between 4 and 16. She has two dependents, both her nieces, who live with her.  In 2007, Sophia established a business selling shoes and handbags. Sophia requires a loan in order to expand her range of shoes and handbags. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand her range of shoes and handbags.

loans.name: Kokou Jean

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1981, Mr. Kokou Jean A. is a young, married man. He is responsible for five people. Farming is his main occupation. He started working the land after elementary school, which he had to quit. Today, he makes his income by selling farm produce. At the beginning of every crop season, armed with his tools, Mr. A. leaves his house every morning and returns in the evening. In order to increase his yield, he is seeking this funding to buy fertilizer to enrich his land. After having sold his produce, he will be able to pay back the loan and save up for a new season.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Attitogon en 1981, Monsieur A. Kokou Jean est un jeune homme marié. Il compte à sa charge un total de cinq personnes. L’agriculture est son activité principale. Il rejoint le travail de la terre après ses études primaires qu’il a dû cesser par la force de ses choses. Aujourd’hui, il tire son revenu à partir de la vente des produits agricoles. En début de chaque campagne agricole, houes sur l’épaule, coupe – coupe et poker en mains, Monsieur A. quitte tous les jours sa maison et revient, les soirs. Pour augmenter sa production, il sollicite ce financement pour acheter de l’engrais afin d’enrichi ses terres. A la vente des produits, il réussira donc à rembourser le crédit et à épargner pour une nouvelle saison.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the crop season

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Меликов Абдулло житель города Вахдат. Женат . Имеет троих детей. Ему 68 лет , но 20 лет из них он занимается торговлей. Имеет магазин рядом с домом и продает продукты питания . Его дом находится в одном из отдаленных кишлаков города. Поэтому его магазин имеет большой спрос. Он помогает населению приобретать товар прямо там не выезжая за приделы кишлака. Цены у него доступные и очень низкие. Сейчас хочет расширить ассортимент товара , поэтому ему необходимо подготовить новые стелажи. Для этого он планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Abdullo M. lives in Vakhdat. Abdullo is 68 years old and is married with 3 children. He has been working in retail for the past twenty years. Abdullo owns a food store, which is located next to his house. As Abdullo's store is located in a remote village. As Abdullo's store gives people an opportunity to buy food without leaving the village, there is high demand for the food he sells. The prices in his store are fair and even low. Abdullo wants to increase his store's assortment, and in order to be able to do so, he would like to build new shelves. Therefore he is appying for a loan that he plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shelves

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mr. Leng T. lives in Nikon Leu Village in Kampong Cham Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Yin Heng, are farmers who cultivate both rice and vegetables. They own a 0.7 hectare rice field and three hectares for vegetable farming. Since these fields are too large for them to cultivate alone, Mr. Leng T. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to work in those fields. He would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make his crop more productive. Mr. Leng T. is 40 years old and the father of four children: one is a laborer; two attend school; and the youngest child is four months old. His wife and daughter are shown with Mr. Leng T..

loans.use: To hire laborers to work in the field and to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Neo Club Group

texts.fr:
Créé en 2004, l’association NEO-CLUB est un groupe de sonorisation très sollicité dans le canton d’Aklakou et de ses environs lors des manifestations aussi bien heureuses (anniversaires, baptêmes, sortie de nouveau né, fêtes….) que malheureuses (décès). 

Cependant l’association ne dispose pas de véhicule pour assurer le transport des matériels de sonorisation. Ainsi, les dépenses occasionnées par la location de véhicule ne permettent pas aux membres de NEO-CLUB de dégager beaucoup de bénéfice devant leur permettre d’améliorer leur niveau de vie.

C’est pour plus de rentabilité de son activité qu’elle sollicite un crédit afin de se procurer de moyens de transport.
texts.en:
Created in 2005 in Aklakou in Togo, the group MIAWOGNOIN has 6 members. Its goal is to facilitate the access to credit and improve living conditions for its members.

In response to the ardent wishes of its members, the group has requested a loan that will serve as funds for making small loans to those members. Please note that since the creation of the group, they have never failed to make a repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: access to credit for utility services

loans.name: Buri

texts.en:
Buri H. is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 children. 

Buri is a farmer. Her business has been able to support her children and provide a house for her family. On her land, she plants crops like wheat, onions and potatoes. She also raises cattle on the land. 

Buri buys calves in the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a higher price. Her younger son helps her with the business. Buri and her son grow enough crops to feed the family and to sell on the market to help the family earn a living. 

Today they are applying to IMON for a loan. Buri hopes to produce a rich crop yield, which she can sell in the market at attractive prices. She is therefore requesting a loan of 500 Somoni ($150 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. Buri is planning to purchase fertilizer and to better maintain her cattle with the loan. 

Let’s support this courageous woman.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and maintain cattle

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith A. is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant. All their children are in secondary school. Edith sells second hand clothes.The demand for her second hand clothes is high. Edith is requesting  the loan amount of $1200 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Chheng Lach, 46, who live along National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1982 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family house; three daughters are garment factory workers, two children attend school and the other daughter is still young.

Chanthy has been selling vegetables for three years. She buys them from Derm Kor market for re-sale at Koki market near her village. Her husband has been a chef for 20 years. He cooks for wedding ceremonies and other special occasions.

Chanthy is applying for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a trailer to carry vegetables for sale

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio es albañil, trabaja en la ciudad de El Alto y también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para su posterior comercialización; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos y esposa. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona peri urbana de la ciudad de El Alto, Zona San Felipe de Seke.

El crédito lo destinará para comprar crías de cerdo (cerdos recien nacidos) para su posterior comercialización y generar mayores ingresos económicos.
 
Es el Cuarto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite facilitarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a builder whow orks in the city of El Alto and he is also dedicated to raising pigs for later sale; this activity is his primary source of income with which he suports is four children and his wife. He has his own house located in the suburban zne of the city of El Alto, Zona San Felipe de Seke. This loan will be destined to buy piglets for his later sale and to generate better economic income. This is his fourth loan with Impro. His good payment behavior facilitates the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying piglets for his business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has been a snacks seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. 
She belongs to Faraja loan group (Group code 2059).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $65. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. 
She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Salma is 38 years old, divorced, and has four children: aged 22, 12, 5 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more items for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa R. is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of two kids who are currently in school. She lives in Bekwai, Zongo community with her husband. Her husband works with the local council in the community. Zongo in Ghana is a place which is dominated by Muslims.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from palm kernels. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. However, her production is on the low side as a result of low working capital to afford a machine for the processing. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to reduce the drudgery of using manual labour to help produce larger quantities. She believes the loan will enable her to save more towards her children's education. Hawa belongs to a village bank called ‘Allah Febiri’. She hopes to receive GHS500 to develop her business by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Ibadet

texts.en: Ibadet Q. is a successful young father and a dedicated husband. He has an adorable daughter. Ibadet began a small food store six years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown larger and his grocery has become more popular. He is asking for a loan of $1225 so that he can expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store. Ibadet is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: Purchase more goods for his store

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa K. is a widow with 6 dependents. She is a food trader and has sold fried plantains and beans in Siwdo for 15 years.  Adwoa uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses, especially food.  She will use the loan to add capital to her business so that she can buy more food to sell, which in turn would help to increase her profit. Adwoa plans to reinvest any newly generated income back into her enterprise to ensure continued success.

loans.use: To buy more food for resale

loans.name: Mariza

texts.es:
La socia MARIZA; nació y vivió en el distrito de Ollantaytambo del departamento del Cusco, ubicado a una hora y cuarenta minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene 2 menores hijos de (13, 3) años de edad, de estado civil casada es madre sola, ya que ella trabaja mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos con su educación y su alimentación. Ella alternas sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, teniendo un pequeño puesto en el mercado central junto con su madre, ellas venden desayunos, almuerzos y refrescos, por ello solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en su pequeño negocio y así seguir cubriendo satisfactoriamente los gastos de su hogar y de sus otras necesidades.

La socia agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Mariza was born and raised in the district of Ollantaytambo, Cusco, which is less than two hours from the city of Cusco. Mariza is 36 years old and has two young children (age 13 and 3) from a previous marriage. As a single mother, she works a great deal to provide her kids with everything they need, including food and money for their education. Mariza divides her time between her household chores and a small business that she runs with her mother. They operate a food stand in a central market, where they sell breakfast, lunch and drinks. Mariza has asked for a loan so that she can re-invest in her business and keep up with her household expenses, too. She appreciates this loan and has agreed to make all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en:
"I own a one-hectare farm where I grow rice in order to provide for my family's needs. I continue working on the farm even if it's too hot. I hope that I will have an abundant harvest so I can save enough to buy another farm," says Adriano T., a forty-nine-year-old father of three children.

He wants a loan from CEVI, one of Kiva's field partners. He will use the loan to purchase urea fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will help him produce a better harvest and more income as well.

CEVI provides people a chance to start and run their own businesses. They give their clients loans as well as training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase urea fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Azal

texts.en:
Azal I. is the loving and self-sacrificing father of three children. Ever since he was very young, Azal has been around people raising animals and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the purchase and sale of cattle he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Azal harbors in his heart is that of increasing his capital to invest in acquiring more animals. He requests $1,200 to buy more cattle to expand his business. Let’s get together behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing well-being and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle

loans.name: Ario

texts.en: Ario S., age 30, is married and has one child.  She has 2 years of experience in the taxi business. She offers her services to the public 6 days per week. She has no previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Ario’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase car parts and paint.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 25 years old. She is a wife and the mother of four children who are currently in school. She is a trader who trades in clothing, such as jeans, blouses, skirts, women's slippers, and so on. She supports her children through the proceeds from the business. She sells through hawking (house-to-house selling).

Gladys is currently constrained by lack of funds to run the business as a result of business expansion. She needs this loan to enable her inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to have the resources to purchase a large quantity of good quality clothing to upgrade her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase clothes such as jeans, ladies wear, and slippers

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela lives with her family in Barangay Inaban Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She dreams of improving their current living situation, and through her business she is positive that she can achieve this dream.

She is engaged in the vending business, selling different commodities and snacks.  She hopes that with the income from her business she can continue to send her three children to school, and she hopes they will finish their college education. Carmela and her husband Gerardo are working hard to meet all the needs of their family.  

Carmela wants to improve her business, and this is why she needs a loan of PHP 10000 from the Kiva lenders. With this loan, she plans to purchase more merchandise, especially nutritious snacks. Her stall is located near the elementary school, so most of her customers are children.  She also wants to venture into the business of selling vegetables for additional income.  She hopes that lenders will grant her request, and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: Additional business capital

location.town: Inaban Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Tausi

texts.en:
Tausi is a member of the Kifea borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 41 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 20,18,15,06 years,she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Tausi started her own cafe business selling food 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Tausi second loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 400,000 Tsh in order to buy more shop commodities.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Tausi hopes to save money,pay school fees,and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,wheat,sugar

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer M. sells fish. He goes to sea for fish and sells them at Elmina. Ebenezer has no educational background. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader.

Ebenezer has been selling fish since 2005. He is responsible for paying school fees and settlement of utility bills. His loan will be used to buy to fishing net, fuel and other things for fishing. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to save to towards building a house.

loans.use: To buy fishing net, fuel and other things for fishing.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen chooses to raise ducks in their simple village at Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. She is  42 years old and she is married to Edwin P. Sr. who is a rice farmer. She would like to raise well all her poultry ducks so that she could be able to support the needs of her children. She has four children, and they are Herwin - 20 years old, Jovely - 18 years old both of them are high school graduate; Edwin P. Jr. who is four years old and Isabel who is three years old. Helen hopes that she could be able to sustain all the needs of her family by improving her livestock business. This is the reason why she hopes to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 as added business capital.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San T., 49, is a farmer and lives with her husband in Takeo province. She is able to make less than US$1 every day. Her husband is a palm climber. He usually collect palm juice and refines it to palm sugar. He typically makes US$2 every day. This couple has four children: three are in school and one is employed in a private company.

San T. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike her son needs to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to use to commute to work

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
For the second time, 32-year-old Shirley T. is requesting a loan through ASHI. The said loan will be used to finance another small business she will be starting, which is farming. It will be managed by her husband, who is a farmer, while she manages her previously started business, which is duck raising and hog fattening. The ducks and hogs she raises are sold once they have grown.

Shirley wants to augment the income she gets out of her previous business by starting a business for her husband through the loan she is requesting. This way, she believes that she will be able to achieve her dream of having a house of their own, where all of her three children can live in comfort.

loans.use: To pay for the purchases needed for the rice production (planting) business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
51-year-old Adelina C. sells fish paste and charcoal briquettes.  She runs a sideline business of repairing shoes and umbrellas.  With these simple ways of living, she supports her ten children, sending them to school and providing their daily meals.

She needs additional capital to help build up her business. She requested a loan of 18.000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use that amount to buy supplies for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and fish paste

loans.name: Unia's Group

texts.en: Unia N., the leader of her lending group, is a very determined business lady with a strong drive to succeed. Unia owns a pub where she sells beers, sodas, wines and spirits to her customers, as well as selling waragi. She says that her busiest hours are usually in the evenings after people have left their work to relax and socialize with friends. Customers often enjoy drinks until the late evenings at Unia's popular bar. She would like a loan to buy more crates of beer to increase her stock and improve sales.

loans.use: Buying more crates of beers, wines, spirits and sodas

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene en su domicilio juegos en red y billar, también se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y tiene un puesto en alquiler donde expone sus productos.

Vive en la Zona de Pazanqueri Provincia murillo de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposo trabaja como maestro albañil en la misma zona.

 Tiene cuatro hijos  los cuales uno ya salio bachiller, trabaja y ayuda a su familia; los otros tres aun están estudiando en el colegio de la misma zona.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (cosméticos) ya que por estas fechas se incrementara las ventas.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
