Maria has games on the net and billiards in her house. She also sells cosmetics. She has a stand that she rents where she displays her products. She lives in the Pazanqueri area in the Murillo province of the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a master bricklayer in the same area. She has four children. One already has a university degree and helps the family. The other three are still in school in the same area. The loan is to buy merchandise (cosmetics) because sales will increase during this season. It is her second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for Christmas sales

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: Mdm. Bineta B., l'age 42, travail au Agence de Santé Communicatrice à Bambey, une communauté rurale environs 100km vers l'est du Dakar.  UIMCEC y a ouvrit une caisse en Juillet 2009 pour mieux servir les clients ruraux.  Son activité secondaire est le commerce, et elle sollicite un crédit de 150,000 FCFA pour acheter des chaussures en gros pour les revendre à sa clientèle.  Sa soeur lui a fait aimer le commerce quand elle lui envoyait pour chercher les marchandises.  Mdm. B. se satisfait par l'autonomie fianciere du métier.  Elle est mariée et la mère de quatre enfants, entre les ages de 2 et 18 ans.
texts.en:
Ms. Bienta B., aged 42, works at the Agency of Health Communications in Bambey, a rural community about 100 km to the east of Dakar. UIMCEC (one of Kiva's field partners) started a loan fund in Bambey in July 2009 to better serve rural clients. Her secondary activity is commerce, and she is seeking a loan of 150,000 FCFA to buy shoes in bulk to re-sell to her customers. Her sister is responsible for her love of commerce, when the former sent her out to look for merchandise. Ms. B. is content with the financial autonomy of this job. She is married and has four children, who are between 2 and 18 years old.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell shoes

loans.name: Paese

texts.en:
Paese L. is 35 and married with 1 child (6 years-old).  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Paese has 7 years of experience in this business.  Paese needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 tala or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Paese joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Paese's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Paese L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.22 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.56 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Jeconiah

texts.en:
Jeconiah is a 43-year-old married blacksmith with three children, who all attend school. His wife is a teacher and he has been running his metal fabrications business, where he provides drilling, moulding, and welding services, for two years. He employs three people and his customers are vehicle owners.

With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase leaf springs and pay for service of his working machines. His other source of income is offering machine rental services. He is grateful to Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya for enabling his business to grow drastically. He hopes to start a large machine workshop someday. Jeconiah describes himself as industrious.

loans.use: To purchase leaf springs and to pay for service of working machines.

loans.name: Sergyi

texts.en:
Sergyi is married and has a 6-year-old daughter. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Sergyi runs a transportation service business. He offers regular transportation services, as well as ceremonial services at funerals. He owns two vehicles: a car and a hearse. He started his business twelve years ago. Currently, he gets 5000 UAH in income each month.

Sergyi is seeking a loan of 7000 UAH to perform major repairs on his car engine. It is the main source of income for his family. Sergyi is hoping to generate additional income and to invest it in refurbishment of his apartment and improvement of his living conditions.

loans.use: To repair the engine of his vehicle

loans.name: Nelly Ann

texts.en:
Nelly Ann, a rice farmer, wants to be successful in life. She wants to help improve her family’s living conditions. She currently has two hectares of rice field that she tills patiently. She also wants to venture into other kinds of businesses, but still waits for the right time. She is thinking of raising hogs so her family will have an extra source of income.

Nelly Ann is a new member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said she needs PHP 6,000 for her business. She would buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies with the loan. She also hopes to buy piglets so she can start raising pigs.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Agapita's Group

texts.en:
Agapita O. is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 50 years old and is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. Agapita is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like, shampoo, soap, coffee, noodles, eggs, salt, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Agapita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Agapita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es:
El cliente Nelson Francisco A. C.Vive en la Comarca la palma sector la puerta del municipio el sauce departamento león, tiene un hijo a su cargo se dedica principal mente a la actividad ganadería.
El cliente cuanta con una propiedad de 12 MZ propia de terreno, donde la desarrolla para la explotación ganadera. 
El destino del crédito fue para la compra de 4 terneros para el desarrollo. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y mejorar la producción de sus ingresos, para el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson has one son and lives in the “La Palma” region of the “La Puerta” sector of the city of “El Sauce” in the León department. He raises livestock and has developed a portion of land on his property for this use. He will use the money from this loan to buy four plots of land to develop. This will allow him to better maintain his herd and improve his income for his family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land to raise cattle

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Villa Huatatas.
Paulina es viuda, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Paulina viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. compra cereales, papa, productos que venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad.
Paulina necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa.
Los sueños D. Paulina son salir adelante y brindar buena educación a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the communal bank Villa Huatatas. Paulina is 48 years old and is a widow. She has 6 children. Paulina travels to different markets in the region where she buys cereals, potatoes, and other products, which she sells in the grocery market in the city. Paulina needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in the purchase of potatoes. Her dreams are to move forward and give her grandchildren a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potatoes

loans.name: Nuevo Bankito La Ramada (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nuevo Bankito La Ramada se encuentra en Nabon ubicado a 69 Km. de la ciudad de Cuenca, conectado por la vía Panamericana que va desde Cuenca a Loja, tiene una altitud: 3.000 m.s.n.m., su clima predominante es el frío. Los límites: al norte con Sigsig y Girón al Sur con Oña y la provincia de Loja, al este con las provincias de Morona Santiago y Zamora Chinchipe; al oeste con Santa Isabel y al suroeste con la provincia de Loja, los  lugares turísticos que se puede visitar son las  ruinas de Lumapara, las playas de Nabón y varias comunidades indígenas como Shiña, su gente se dedica a la agricultura,  la ganadería y la minería. 

La señora  Gloria Carrión es socia de este banco,  vive en la comunidad  Nabón con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 16 años y cuatro meses, su hijo mayor estudia en un colegio de la localidad,  tienen casa propia pero no  viven ella sino en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Loja de donde ella es oriunda. Su esposo es comerciante de gorras mientras que ella se dedica a su tienda  de víveres  desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. todos los días de domingo a domingo.

Este es su  primer crédito  gracias a su compañera del banco que la invitó a formar parte de éste¸ con éste dinero  va  a comprar más víveres como arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, atún, fideos y artículos de limpieza y cuidado personal para abastecer su tienda. Su meta es  tener una tienda más grande.

La señora María Ercila  Y. vive en la comunidad La Ramada en el cantón Nabon, es su primer crédito y fue invitada por la presidenta del bankito, se dedica a la agricultura actividad que ha realizado casi toda su vida, todo su producción  vende en la ciudad de Cuenca en el mercado de la feria libre y también vende en su comunidad.

María Ercila  tiene 40 años, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido siete  hijos quienes se encuentran de 23, 17, 15, 14, 13, 7, 5 años, su primera hija es casada y vive independiente, sus cuatro hijos siguientes nacieron con discapacitados son sordo mudos y los tres mas pequeños estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, tiene una casita pequeña de adobe donde comparte con ellos y  su esposo que  es jornalero, con su crédito va a comprar semillas de maíz, fréjol, arveja, etc.  para seguir con sus cultivos.

Su sueño es de tener una casita mejor y más amplia
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevo Bankito La Ramada” is located in Nabon, which is 69 kilometers outside of the city of Cuenca. This area is connected to the Pan American Highway that runs from Cuenca to Loja and is situated 3000 meters above sea level. The local climate is predominantly cold. Nabon is bordered to the north by Sigsig and Girón, to the south by Oña and the province of Loja, to the east by the provinces of Morona Santiago and Zamora Chinchipe, and to the west by Santa Isabel. The tourist sites that one can visit are the ruins of Lumapara, the beaches of Nabon, and various indigenous communities such as Shiña. The people engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and mining.

Sra. Gloria Carrión is a member of this Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Nabon with her husband and two children, ages 16 and 4 months. Her oldest child attends the local high school. Gloria and her husband own a home, but they do not live there. Instead, they stay at her parents’ house in the city of Loja, where is she is a native. Her husband sells caps while she manages a grocery store that is open every day from 7am to 8pm.

Gloria is receiving her first loan as a result of one of the other group members who invited her to join the Communal Bank. She will use the money to buy grocery items such as rice, sugar, salt, oil, tuna, pasta, cleaning products, and toiletries to restock her business. Her goal is to have a larger store.

María Ercila Y. lives in the community of La Ramada in the canton of Nabon. She will be receiving her first loan after being invited by the Communal Bank president. María Ercila has been involved in farming activities almost her entire life. Everything she produces is sold at the open market in Cuenca or within her community.

María Ercila is 40 years old, married, and has seven children (ages 23, 17, 15, 14, 13, 7, and 5). Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently. The next four children were all born with disabilities (they are deaf mutes), while the two youngest children attend the local school. María Ercila lives with her family in a small adobe house. Her husband works as a farm laborer. María Ercila will use her loan to buy seeds for planting corn, beans, peas, and other vegetables to continue her crops.

Her dream is to have a larger, nicer house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, salt, oil, tuna, pasta, cleaning products, and toiletries

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 45 años de edad, ella comparte su vida con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Su fuente de ingreso es un a bodega, negocio al cual se dedica la mayor parte del tiempo, puesto que lo tiene instalada dentro de su domicilio. Es así que desde muy temprano abre su negocio y con gran disponibilidad atiende a sus clientes, ofreciendo variedad de productos comestibles y vegetales. Gracias a los 10 años que lleva de experiencia en este negocio, ha sabido afrontar muchos inconvenientes que se le presentaron y actualmente tiene un negocio firme,  pues también recibe la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos. Luz quiere hacer crecer su negocio pero sabe que aún le falta capital para poder abastecerlo mejor y hacerlo mucho más atractivo a la clientela es por ello que solicita este nuevo crédito. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería para abastecer su tienda y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and she shares her lives with her husband and their three children. They all live together in their own home. Her income source is a small store, a business that takes up a great deal of her time since it is located right inside her home. In this way, she opens her store very early and is always available to attend to her customers, offering a variety of groceries and vegetables. Thanks to her 10 years experience with this business, she knows how to deal with many inconveniences that come her way, and currently has a very stable business. She also receives help from her husband and children. Luz would like to grow her business, but she knows she needs capital in order to be able to stock it better and make it more attractive to customers. For this reason, she is soliciting this new loan. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to be punctual with all her repayments. With the loan, she will buy merchandise to stock her store and in this way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
O. Robert is thirty-four years old and resides at Namrwothod Village in Nebbi town. He is a married man with six children and has two dependents; altogether, five are in school.

Robert owns O. Enterprises at Market Square, dealing in bicycle spare parts and repairs. He has been running the business for the last four years.

Robert is using the loan to purchase more bicycle spare parts, grease, and other lubricants. His future dream is to expand the business and, if possible, to open other branches.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle spare parts, grease, and other lubricants

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel L. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. He is 26 years old, married, and has three school-age children. 

Noel owns a business which provides trisikad (pedicab) services used to transport passengers in the local community. Noel has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Noel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Noel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Yvone

texts.en:
Yvone was born in 1986 and is single. She lives with her parents; she has to contribute to providing all the basic needs for her family. Yvone owns a small business selling shoes and handbags; this business is profitable in Kigali city. Yvone employs one person from her community; her daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Yvone is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more shoes and handbags for the purpose of satisfying her customers. In this way, Yvone will be able to earn more profit which will help her to change her living conditions.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her home by repairing the electrical system and plastering some walls.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng K., 40, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. K. and her husband sell groceries for an income of USD 12 per day. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K. appears in the photograph while she is sitting and selling at her shop.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Toek's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members led by Mrs. Toek T., 47, a mother of two young children who attend school. Toek T. is a farmer on a plot of land acquired from her parents. Toek T. is widowed; her husband died of senility years ago. She is able to earn a good income and living standard with her farming. However, some of her crops are not growing well because they need fertilizers. To remedy the situation, Toek T. would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer.

The other joint borrowers are:

T., 26, a local farmer, is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her crop.

S., 26, plants rice and needs a loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

T., 42, a local farmer, is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Khien Hing Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has thirteen borrowers who live in Prey Khcheay village in Takeo province. Mrs. Khien H., who was bO. in 1963, became a village bank president when she was selected by the other members of the group. They will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Khien is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice that she sells to support her family. She is also a pig breeder. Her problem is that her pigs are too small to sell, but she does not have money to support the pigs' growth. To improve this condition, Mrs. Khien H. is seeking a loan to buy pig food.  With the rest of the loan, she plans to buy fertilizer and hire farm laborers. Her husband, Mr. Him Nhoem, is a driver. She has four children who all are studying in school.

loans.use: To buy pig food, fertilizer, and hire farm laborers.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Since April, Maricela has been busy setting up La Quinta Drive-Thru, a drive-in convenience store complete with anything you would expect to find at a corner shop, except customers never have to exit their cars. Originally from Mexico, Maricela and her husband came to the U.S. to work as migrant field workers. After constantly relocating throughout the United States due to the seasonal changes, Maricela, her husband, and her three children settled down in McAllen. The couple began working as custodians for their current employer, the McAllen Independent School District. Maricela is excited to retire and work full-time at the store. Until then, she works nights and weekends, and her daughter will work during the weekdays.

Maricela spent her savings to set up the business and needed this loan for the final touches. This loan will pay for the roof that will cover the cars and will help Maricela to buy goods to sell. Maricela says, “All my life I have worked. When I retire, I want to have something that’s mine and that can secure a better future for my family.”

loans.use: To construct a roof to cover cars and buy inventory to stock up the store

loans.name: Handtseren

texts.en:
Handtseren T. is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her two children in an apartment in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Her son, age 14, attends local secondary school, while her daughter, age 29, helps out with her business.

Handtseren currently operates a clothing retail business in her community. She has been in this business for the past four years and has built a stable and successful operation. She has proven herself a reliable customer to the bank, always paying her loan in full and on time. She needs more funds in order to increase her working capital. Handtseren is a very modest and hardworking woman. She says, "I am planning to save enough money for my son's future education costs and wish my daughter could get a decent job." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase more winter clothing items in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothing

loans.name: Freshina Wanjiru

texts.en:
Freshina Wanjiru is 27 years old and has a husband named Joseph. Together they have four children. She has been running her boutique for 6 years with a monthly income of Kshs 14400.

This will be Freshina's third loan with Kadet, and she has repaid the previous ones well. She wants to use the loan to buy a motorbike in order to start a transport business. She hopes to expand the business and create employment for other people.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a transport business

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 44 years old and married to a businessman. She has eight children who are between three and twenty-two years old. All her children attend school except the youngest. 

Mediatrice owns a shop in which she sells a variety of items. She has been operating this business for the period of two years. She has requested this loan to buy more rice, cassava flour and cooking oil to sell. 

With the profit from this business she will pay tuition fees for one of her children who is a student at the university. She says her business is crucial in allowing her to cover the costs of her household. In the future, she would like to open up a cinema hall.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is 35 years old, married and has four children, all of whom live with him in his house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He dreams of building a new, larger home and currently makes a living as a a supervisor at a private tea estate. He has worked there for four years, but hopes to go into business on his own as a commercial farmer. He has applied for this loan to help care for his cassava garden, which is an important food source for his family.

loans.use: To help care for his cassava garden

loans.name: America Y Nadamas Group

texts.es: LA FOTO FUE TOMADA EN CASA DE LA SEÑORA MARÍA DE LOS ÁNGELES, UNA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO AMERICA Y NADAMAS QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA CIUDAD DE NOGALES ESTADO DE VERACRUZ EN MEXICO,SE VE A LAS INTEGRANTES ALREDEDOR DE LA MERCANCIA.LA SEÑORA MARÍA DE LOS ÁNGELES SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MANUALIDADES DE ESTAMBRE QUE INICIÓ HACE 10 AÑOS,SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA,SUS GANANCIAS AUMENTARON.AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE CONTENTA,ELLA TIENE 51 AÑOS,ESTUDIO HASTA SEGUNDO DE PRIMARIA,ES VIUDA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS: 2 MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE. QUIERE ESTE CREDITO PARA PODER HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO.TAMBIEN ESPERA OBTENER UNA BUENA UTILIDAD.EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITA UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN.
texts.en: The photo was taken at María de los Ángeles' house.  She is a member of the group America y Nadamas, which is located in the city of Nogales in the state of Veracruz, Mexico.  The members are pictured around the merchandise.  María de los Ángeles has sold handmade wool items for the last 10 years.  She is asking for the loan in order to buy raw materials, since her sales increased.  When she applied for this loan, she felt happy.  She is 51 years old and attended school through the second grade.  She is a widow and has 3 children: 2 women and a man.  She wants this loan in order to grow her business.  She also hopes to earn a good profit.  The group is made up of 9 members and this is the first time it is applying for a loan with Credicomun.

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 47 años, vive en su casa  que es propia, junto a su esposo y también con sus 2 hijos que aún estudian en el colegio.Se dedica a  la venta de pantalones, camisas, blusas y zapatillas, de marcas conocidas, pues  su hijo trabaja en tiendas comerciales de prestigio y se las brindan a módicos precios. Estas prendas son muy costosas en el mercado, pero ella las comercializa  a precios bajos y al alcance de sus clientes,  que constantemente le realizan cantidad de  pedidos. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que  las  ventas son rápidas, por ello en cuanto tiene las prendas no duda en ofrecer a determinados clientes, de acuerdo a la moda y época. Desde hace años se dedica a  este negocio, y ofrece sus prendas de casa en casa, lo cual le resulta muy rentable, pues no gasta en movilidad, lo único es que debe caminar bastante. Para el futuro tiene planeado construir su casa en el terreno que le cedieron  sus suegros, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.Es el 11avo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le crédito que necesita será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo se desempeña en su grupo comunal como una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cuál es muy respetada.María tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa casual como pantalones jeans, zapatos y zapatillas de esta manera espera abastecer los pedidos pendientes y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 47 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children who are still studying at high school.

María's business is selling well-known brands of pants, shirts, blouses and sneakers since her son works in prestigious stores and receives these products at reasonable prices.  These items of clothes are very expensive but María sells them at low prices which are affordable to her customers who make frequent orders for her products.  What she most likes about her business is that she makes quick sales.  As soon as she has garments to sell she doesn't hesitate in offering them to certain customers, according to the fashion and season.

María has been in this business for years and she offers her clothes from house to house which is very profitable as she doesn't have to pay any transportation costs.  The only thing she has to do is walk quite a lot.

In the future, María plans to build her own home on the plot of land that her in-laws gave her.  In this way, she hopes to continue making progress.

This is María's 11th loan with MFP and she knows that the loan she needs will be very useful in making progress in her business.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank, for this reason she is very well respected by her fellow group members.  María plans to invest her money in buying a larger quantity of casual clothes such as pants, jeans, shoes and sneakers.  In this way she hopes to fill her pending orders and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy clothes and sneakers to stock her business

loans.name: Evenor David

texts.es:
El señor Evenor David R. L. trabaja como Cajero Promotor en una empresa de Acueductos y alcantarillados, desde hace dos años

Es casado Ingeniero en Sistema,  de 28 años de edad, tiene una  persona bajo su cargo, menor de 15 años, vive en la ciudad de Managua en el municipio de Managua en el barrio Salomón Moreno.

Agradece CEPRODEL por brindarle este crédito que es el primero lo solicita para cubrir Gastos Personales.
texts.en:
Evenor David R. L. has worked as a payment collector in an aqueduct and sewer system business for the past two years.

He is married, a systems engineer, 28, and he has a 15 year old dependent.  He lives in the city of Managua in  Managua municipality, in the Salomón Moreno neighborhood.

He thanks CEPRODEL for offering him this loan, the first one that he has requested, to cover some personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Sirac

texts.en:
Sirac A. is a 45-year-old man from Bilasuvar. He lives with his wife and four children who are from 23 to 8 years old. Sirac has three daughters and one son, who actively helps him in his cattle-breeding business. He has been engaged in this line of business since 2002. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Sirac is a good client based on his history of repaying his previous loan from AqroInvest. He requested his second loan of 2000 AZN from AqroInvest and Kiva to invest more in his farming. He bought four more cows and thanks to that, the income of his family increased up to 400 AZN per month. Now Sirac has seven cows, but after repaying this loan he would like to take out another loan to buy five more cows.

loans.use: To buy four cows

loans.name: Flor Ninnette

texts.es:
Flor, tiene 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Calca del departamento de Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica de Flor es la administración de un Grifo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Flor  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para uso personal específicamente para comprar ropa, alimentación y educación para sus hijos. 

Flor pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Flor is 39 years old and the mother of two children. She lives in Calca in the Peruvian department of Cusco. Her economic activity consists in running a filling station. She has done that for several years and earned a good income thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Flor currently needs a loan to pay for clothes, food and education for her children.

Flor is a member of the communal bank "Señor de Huanca" of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by this microfinance institution and promises to pay the installments on schedule.

loans.use: To pay for clothes, food and education for her children

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is 43 years old, married, and has three children aged 19 to 24. Her husband is a driver. She sells fruits & vegetables, as the picture shows. This is her 13th successful year in this business. She currently employs one person, and she operates her business from 6am to 9pm every day except Saturday. 

Peruth has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase more fruits & vegetables to sell. She hopes to earn more profits, which will allow her to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mente Positiva Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité tuvo la iniciativa la señora Elvira M., hoy miembro del comité ”Mente Positiva”, ella fue quien contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en dicha zona en su zona.
El comité se denomina “Mente Positiva”, está en el Sexto Ciclo con 18 integrantes, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas.
La sra. Elvira se dedica a la librería, ella provee de todos los materiales necesarios para el estudio o papelerías a las diversas personas que acuden a su negocio, es muy reconocida en la zona debido al excelente trato que brinda y al manejo cauteloso con que administra su librería.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder equipar mejor su negocio y ofrecer artículos de distintas variedades, precios y calidades, comprando cuadernos, carpetas, pinceles, bolígrafos, plastificados, forros, tijeras, plasticolas, etc.
texts.en:
Elvira, still today a member of the “Mente Positiva” (Positive Mind) Group, initiated formation of the group.  She was the one who contacted her neighbors and friends to form this committee in her zone.

Their  “Mente Positiva” committee is in its 6th loan cycle and has 18 members. They are very united and responsible, and there is much solidarity among them.

Elvira owns a book store. She carries all the necessary materials for studying, including paper products, for the diverse people who come to her store. Elvira is well known in her zone, owing to the excellent treatment she offers and the great care with which she administers her bookstore.

Elvira requests a loan to better equip her business and to offer a distinct variety of articles, prices and qualities, by purchasing notebooks, files, pencils, ballpoint pens, plastic covers, paper covers, scissors, plastic goods, etc.

loans.use: TO BUY ARTICLES FOR HER BOOKSTORE (NOTEBOOKS, FILES PENCILS, BALLPOINT PENS, PLASTIC AND PAPER COVERS, SCISSORS, ETC.)

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en: Marthe is 39 years old, married and has five children who range in age from two to 20 years old. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food and beverages, including bananas, biscuits, tea, eggs and water. She has been in this business for more than four years and currently has two employees. She gets up at 6 a.m. and works until 9 p.m. every day, and is applying for this loan to buy more food for her restaurant, including bread, milk and sugar. She hopes to continue investing in and expanding her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant.

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
This is Cherryl Sta. A., 29, a resident of San Nicolas III, Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Sanly Sta. A., a waiter, and is the mother of three children. Two of her children are in elementary school, while the other one is not yet of school age. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send her children all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Cherryl, as she herself has been a high school graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children. 

Cherryl operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos 'worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at retail piece rates. She earns a minimum of 200 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operation of her variety store, she is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan. She plans to use this loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries, and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Cherryl dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She also prays that her business will become bigger and that she eventually will own a convenience store. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is from the city of Molicay Ozamiz City. She is 54 years old. Anita is married and has 6 adult children. Anita owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, and to pay for farm maintenance labor. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay labor costs for farm maintenance

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua buys and retails plastic bowls and cooking utensils in Abura in Cape Coast. She is married to a mason and has four children. Efua has a senior high educational background. She assists her husband to clothe and feed her family.

Since demand for her wares is increasing, Efua needs a loan to buy additional bowls and utensils. Any profit realized from her sales will be used to build a shop. At the time of the visit, Efua had run out of stock and was waiting to receive her new consignment.

loans.use: to buy additional bowls and utensils.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, vive con su esposa, su suegra y dos hijos, es empleado y su esposa tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas, esta venta la realizan todas las tardes, los fines de semana como él no trabaja colabora vendiendo refrescos y licuados.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mobiliario para el negocio, específicamente mesas y sillas, también comprara mercadería como chicharrón, quesillo, condimentos, estos pues para las pupusas.
Su pretensión es aumentar las utilidades del negocio, con un negocio más fuerte y ofreciéndole a su familia una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his wife, mother-in-law and two children.  He is employed and his wife sells "pupusas" (stuffed tortilla) every afternoon.  On weekends, since he doesn't work, he helps out selling softdrinks and smoothies.

He is requesting a loan to buy furniture for the business, specifically tables and chairs, and also buy goods such as pork rind, cheese, and condiments for the pupusas.

He hopes to increase profits and make the business stronger so he can provide his family with a sound economy.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs, as well as pork rinds, cheese and condiments.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
This is Maura , 48 years-old and a resident of Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Victor and the mother of seven children.  Two of her children are  working, one is in high school, and the rest are working with her in her food stall. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maura operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Aside from the food stall, she has an apartment for rent. Maura also earns income by selling Liquefied Petroleum Gas. Her stall is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1133 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings and an additional gas stove for her food stall. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maura hopes to be able to expand soon,  just as she hopes to support her children's schooling up to college level, and to pay her house in full. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products and inventory items needed for her food stall

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old and married. He sells snacks and cakes in a residential area and has two employees. He often sells his goods to individuals and shopkeepers in the area. Paul has been doing this for three years. Paul intends to use this loan to buy a bicycle so that he can deliver the cake that he sells. He also wants to use the loan to by an oven and baking flour for making cakes. 

This is Paul's third loan with SMEP. He is a good client that pays back his loans on time. Paul wants to own a large-scale bakery one day. He describes himself as hardworking, honest, committed, and aggressive when it comes to business.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle, oven and baking flour

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Señora Mariana vive en la zona de villa salome que esta ubicada a veinticinco minutos del centro de la ciudad, Ella vive junto a sus dos hijos, uno que ya es independiente y una menor que se encuentra estudiando en nivel secundario. La Sra. Mariana vende comida variedad de platillos como ser silpancho y asado en un puesto que tiene en su casa, abre su tienda solo por  las noches y tienen varios clientes. Ella trabaja con créditos en emprender desde el año 2005 y en todos estos años a demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable y puntual con sus cuotas. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de una computadora personal laptop que será utilizada en los estudios de su hijo mayor. El mayor anhelo y deseo de doña Mariana es poder algún día ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mariana lives in a zone called Villa Salome located 25 minutes outside the city center. She lives with her two children; one is already financially independent and the younger child is in secondary school. Mariana sells a variety of fast food such as silpancho (thinly sliced, breaded meat) and barbecued meat from a stand at her house. The stand is open in the evenings and has a number of different customers. 

She has been a client of Emprender since 2005 and over the years she has proven to be a very responsible client who is punctual with her repayments. Marinana is requesting a loan to buy a personal laptop computer for her eldest child's studies. Her greatest wish is to see her children achieve professional careers.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 25 years old; single and lives with two family members. One of the family members works.

Ahmad has had a barber shop since 2009 .He has more than five years experience,  a deep understanding of local consumer and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,500 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy shaving supplies. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop and to buy shaving supplies.

loans.name: Ramonita

texts.en:
Ramonita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Ramonita has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy beverages, canned goods & snacks.

Ramonita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ramonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods & snacks.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun is 63 years old, and is a farmer with $1.5 per day for her income. She is single mother with two children. They are all working with $6 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $47 on food, $3 on electricity, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a cow for  selling livestock. She hopes to have more money to buy more cows for livestock sales so that she can make more income to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a cow for selling livestock.

loans.name: Runyararo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Lennon from Masvingo. He is married and has four children age 2, 9, 12 and 16, with three attending school. 

Lennon buys and sells engine oil and filters. The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge he faces is the lack of funding to buy more commodities. 

Lennon has requested a loan of $400 to buy engine oil and filters. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living, have more disposable income and be able to pay school fees without difficulties. 

In the future, Lennon plans to open a shop in town.

loans.use: To buy engine oil and filters for sale.

loans.name: Felsie

texts.en:
Felsie is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Felsie has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional products from NATASHA & AVON for sale.
Felsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Felsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products from NATASHA & AVON for sale

loans.name: Zinakan's Group

texts.en:
Zinakan is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married to a farmer. In order to earn money for their livelihood, Zinakan provides sewing services. She started this activity thirteen years ago with an initial investment of 2000 soms. With that money, she purchased a multi-functional sewing machine. At the moment her business runs well, she has a lot of orders, and she earns about 9300 soms per month. With money received from the loan Zinakan wants to purchase fabrics and materials which are needed for sewing.  In the future, with the profits gained from the business, she wishes to build a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank has been a operating a butchery for the last four years. He is 30 years old, married, and blessed with two children.

He learned about KADET from the marketing done by the KADET staff in the area where he lives. Since this is his first loan, he plans to purchase more animals for slaughtering. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in meat distribution within the town.

His dreams are to be the best and most well-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for slaughtering.

loans.name: Esmeralda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Esmeralda posee una pulpería ubicada en su vivienda tiene 21 años de dedicarse a esta actividad y ha sido gracias a la cual ha dado alimento y estudio a sus hijos, es una mujer emprendedora a pesar de que ha sobrellevado cosas difíciles en su vida sabe que es muy importante para ella el obtener este ingreso para su hogar.  Ella se levanta desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche el entusiasmo que le brinda a su clientes es algo que a ellos les gusta. El crédito es para la compra de azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, huevos, crema, pan, fideos, fósforos, papel higiénico y sopas.
texts.en: Esmeralda has a home-based grocery store; she’s been in this line of work for 21 years and it’s been the source of nourishment and education for her children.  She’s an enterprising woman who despite overcoming difficult things in her life knows that it’s very important for her to earn this income for her home.  She rises daily at 7am and works until 9pm.  The enthusiasm with which she greets her customers is something they like.  The loan is to buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, eggs, cream, bread, noodles, matches, toilet paper and soup.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 32 years old. She is single and blessed with two children who are in school. She describes herself as a hardworking business woman. She has been running a butcher shop for the last two years to support her family. She also practices dairy farming to earn more income. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. Hannah is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy more cows for slaughtering. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: Cecilia de 28 años es una mujer luchadora. Vive en compaña de su esposo y sus 2 hijos: Jairo y Kiara a los que cuida en su casa propia; ubicada en el distrito de Chilca. El arte lo lleva en la sangre, desde niña aprendió a tejer, su madre le enseño todas las técnicas del tejido. Por eso Cecilia convirtió a su mejor pasatiempo en su medio de vida. El tejido de gorras, chompas y conjuntos de vestir enteros, es su actividad económica, todos los días recibe a sus clientes quienes le hace pedidos, pues conocen de su destreza. Además la quieren mucho; pues ella vive sola con sus hijos; ya que su esposo trabaja en una mina como obrero. Su trabajo lo absorbe tanto que solo viaja una vez por mes a visitarlos; “es el esfuerzo que tiene que realizar para brindarnos una mejor calidad de vida”, afirma con optimismo. Por ello espera que dentro de muy poco pueda ampliar su negocio, generar buenas ganancias y de esa manera tener a su familia unida. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Cecilia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de madejas de lana para sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 28, is a fighter.  She lives with her husband and two children, Jairo and Kiara, for whom she cares in her own home located in the Chilca district.

Art is in her blood.  She learned to knit as a little girl.  Her mother taught her all the techniques of knitting.  This is why Cecilia converted her favorite pastime into her means of support.

Knitting caps, sweaters, and entire outfits is her job.  Every day she receives her customers, who order from her since they know her skill.  They also love her very much.

Cecilia lives alone with her children since her husband works as a mine laborer.  Her work takes up so much time that she travels only once a month to visit him.  "It's the effort he has to make to offer us a better quality of life," she affirms optimistically.  This is why she hopes that soon she can expand her business and generate good profits, and in this way have her family together.

This is her first loan with MFP, for which she hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments.  She also is pleased to be part of her bank, because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

When she receives her support, Cecilia will invest the requested money in buying skeins of wool for her knitting.

loans.use: to buy skeins of wool.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos Antonio nació en la  ciudad de Quillabamba y ahora vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Carlos Antonio tiene 25 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre pero todavía no tiene hijos.    

Carlos Antonio desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad de Urubamba, él es proveedor de materiales de construcción. Antes, Carlos Antonio trabaja conjuntamente con sus padres pero ahora se independizo. Ya es un año y medio que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Carlos Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, cemento, piedra chancada y otras cosas más. 

Carlos Antonio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. Carlos Antonio pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Urubamba.
texts.en:
Carlos Antonio was born in the city of Quillabamba and now lives in the city of Urubamba. Carlos Antonio is 25 years old and is in a relationship, but has no children.

Carlos Antonio carries out his day-to-day financial activity in the city of Urubamba. He is a supplier of construction materials. Before doing this, Carlos Antonio worked along with his parents, but now he is independent. He has been working at this business for a year and a half, and it is going very well for him.

Carlos Antonio needs the loan to purchase construction materials, such as sand, cement, gravel, and other things.

Carlos Antonio is appreciative of the opportunity granted to him through this loan and commits to care for repayments on time. Carlos Antonio belongs to the communal bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Urubamba.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials including sand, cement, gravel, and other items.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is a 47-year-old married woman who has six sons and one daughter.

To be able to support their big family, Intisar saw that she can help her husband who works as a taxi driver, so five years ago, Intisar started making and arranging artificial flowers at home and selling them in baskets. 

Now she has applied for a loan in order to buy more material to make more artificial flowers to sell in the market to the shops and also to people they know or the neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more material to make more artificial flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccine, and additional hogs to raise.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
Aydee nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Aydee tiene 32 años edad y es madre y padre para su único hijo, ella trabaja en uno de los restaurantes más lujosos de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en el restaurante como chef. Ya son cuatro años que trabaja en el restaurante y le va muy bien. Aydee va empezar a dedicarse a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes por ese motivo requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes. Su sueño de Aydee es comprarse una casa.  

Aydee es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: Aydee was born in the province of Urubamba but lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja. This village is located in the district of Urubamba, Urubamba province and department of Cusco, Peru.  Aydee is 32 years old and a single mother to her only son.  She works as restaurant chef from 6 am to 6 pm in one of the most luxurious restaurants of the town of Urubamba. It is now four years working in the restaurant and she is doing very well. Aydee is going to start to raise small animals such as guinea pigs which is her motive for requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs. Her dream is to buy herself a house. Aydee is a member of the group "The Baja Rumichaca Sunflowers" is made up of 19 members living in the town of Rumichaca Baja and where they conduct their economic activities.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Edes Frank

texts.es:
Edes vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y en especial el cultivo de limones, arroz, entre otros. Edes es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, por ello cada día se levanta muy temprano para aperturar su pequeño negocio de venta de muebles para salas, dormitorios, entre otros, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede sacar adelante a su familia ya que es padre de 2 pequeños de 2 y 4 años de edad por los cuales lucha cada día y se sacrifica para brindarles una vida mejor, sobre todo porque ama a sus hijos y su esposa; Edes cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo  porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de calidad a un precio cómodo.

Edes está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más muebles para ofrecer en su negocio, especialmente porque tiene pedidos de clientes y asimismo poder tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer, así mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle a sus hijos una buena educación y tener varias sucursales de su negocio”.
texts.en:
Edes lives in Guadalupe, known for its warm and cozy climate.  There is farming here, especially lemons, and rice among other things.  Edes is a young man with a great desire to get ahead.  Every day he gets up very early to tend to his small business, selling furniture for living rooms, bedrooms, and others.  He gets his family ahead with the fruits of his labor.  He is the father of two children, ages 2 and 4, for whom he works hard every day so he can provide them a better life.  Above all he loves his wife and children.  Edes believes that he is getting ahead because he is very friendly to his customers and above all offers high quality products at comfortable prices.

Edes is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help he was able to buy more furniture for his business, especially since he has requests from customers, so he can have a greater variety to offer.  In this way he can increase his income and continue working to make his greatest dream a reality, “Providing a good education for his children and opening branch stores for his business.”

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Issifu

texts.en: Issifu is married to a food vendor with whom they have been blessed with 3 children. He uses his income to help his wife pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a middle school lever graduate, Issifu currently sells building materials, bicycle tyre and tube and also stationeries in Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe). With over 26 years of experience in this trade, Issifu sees an opportunity to expand his enterprise further. Nevertheless, he does not have the working capital necessary to increase his quantity of stock. Thus his loan will be used to buy more exercise books, primary text book, note books, pens; pencils etc, indirectly helping him boost his overall sales. Issifu wants to make his business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, he plans to channel the new profits from his expanded business back into his building materials enterprise.

loans.use: his loan will be used to buy more exercise books, primary text book, note books, pens; pencils etc, indirectly helping him boost his overall sales

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kratie province, Sopheak is 41 years old and married. She can earn income to support on her living condition via growing rice for 23 years. Moreover, Sopheak can get additional income via corn and sesame growing. Her rice has destroyed by insects, so it did not produce good yield for her as last year and she can save from her daily income about 7 USD per day. This is her second loan with VisionFund and she has repaid her past loan on time. Her family’s living is getting better than before with good income. She will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed, fertilizer for her rice farm and pay for plowing fee to support on her farmland. Sopheak hopes that she can get higher yield from her rice farm and sell it in good price, so she can upgrade her lifestyle as well.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, fertilizer for her rice farm in order to increase the crop product.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three children. She has been in business over the past ten years. She runs a stationery and schools supplies shop in Dar es Salaam. Her shops stocks general stationery (files, ball pens, maker pens, counter books, flip charts, office pins , paper clips, paper punches etc). Recently she introduced primary and secondary schools textbooks. The new line of business requires high capital because the number of schools has increased in Dar es Salaam due to the high priority now given on education by the government. The new line requires high lumpsum of money to meet seasonal demand for textbooks especially in June and December/January before new semesters starts.

Given a loan of $1000, she plans to increase his stock by buying more stationery and textbooks. The loan term will be twelve months. She has a well established credit history with Microfinance Institutions.

loans.use: Stationary Services

loans.name: Adakou

texts.en:
Born in 1962 in Lomé, Mrs. Adakou A. manages a small garden whose cultivation and products allow her to meet the needs of her five (05) children. For a number of years, Mrs. A. has not received any help from her husband, who is in a difficult financial situation. Based on her garden's products, she has formed a small business selling general foodstuffs, which does very well in her area.

Today, Mrs. Adakou A. is asking for a loan of $500 for a new enlargement to her business which would involve the stockpiling and sale of cassava flour, maize, and rice, which she can sell at a higher price in times of shortage and generate large profits for the survival of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1962 à Lomé, Madame A. Adakou dispose d’un petit maraîcher dont les cultures lui permettent, par leur vente de subvenir aux besoins de ses cinq (05) enfants. Il y a de cela des années que Madame A. ne reçoit plus d’aide de son époux en difficulté financière. Aux produits maraîchers, elle a associé un petit commerce d’alimentation générale qui marche très bien dans sa localité.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Adakou sollicite un crédit de $500 pour un nouvel agrandissement de son commerce en faisant le stock et la vente de farine de manioc, du maïs et du riz qu’elle pourra revendre plus cher en temps de pénuries et faire de gros bénéfices pour la survie de sa famille.

loans.use: To sell cassava flour, maize, and rice

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
La señora Catarina tiene 54 años de edad, por la ruptura de su matrimonio tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus cuatro hijos ella sola. Estudió un curso de manualidades que le ha servido para la elaboración y venta de arreglos florales y coronas, ella inició en su casa pero tiene la ilusión de algún día poder tener su propia florería. Con ayuda de una de sus hijas ha podido sacar adelante su negocio y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, sobre todo cuando se incrementan en fechas especiales como el día de las madres, el día de muertos, etc.

En estos momentos Caterina requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 300 dólares que utilizará en la compra del material necesario para elaborar los arreglos florales, incrementar la variedad de sus productos y obtener mayores ventas, ella ofrece regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Sé parte importante de los logros de Catalina y apóyala.

Caterina is requesting a $300 loan. She will use the loan to buy materials for floral arrangements and to increase the variety of the products she carries. She will repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. You can be part of her achievement.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta is married and has two school-age children (15 and 16). Her husband is a laborer. She started her business seven years ago when her children were smaller, so she can help with household expenses. Her business began by coincidence; she was thinking of how she could help out her husband, and one day he brought the kids some candy. Their little friends asked them who was selling the candy, and they said their mother, and that is how she started her little store. It did well and grew because at that time there weren't any stores in the neighborhood since it was just recently populated. Little by little she added supplies, and now her business also sells beauty products.

Jacinta is requesting a loan of $550 to purchase supplies and stock her store with products in high demand by her clients, so they are satisfied and she doesn't lose their business. She plans to repay the loan within five months. She hopes that you will support her so her business can keep growing and she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Jacinta es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 15 y 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como obrero, ella empezó su negocio hace 7 años, cuando sus hijos estaban más pequeños y fue para apoyar en la economía del hogar, inicio el negocio por una coincidencia, ya que estaba pensando que hacer para ayudar a su esposo y un día él le trajo unos caramelos a sus hijos y sus amiguitos le preguntaron que quien vendía dulces y ellos le dijeron que su mamá y fue así como ella empezó con su tiendita y fue creciendo ya que en su colonia no habían tiendas en esa época por que se estaba poblando recién y poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio, ahora en su negocio también vende productos de belleza.

Jacinta solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 550 para comprar mercadería y abastecer su negocio con productos que son muy demandados por sus clientes y además tener surtido para que sus clientes estén satisfechos y no perderlos, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses y espera que la apoyes a continuar con su crecimiento, para que pueda brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the ten women of the Femmes de Gandiol group, led by Ms. Binta N.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“The town of Gandiol has about 13,968 inhabitants. The principal economic activities of the area are fishing, horticulture, herding, and salt production. But the recent degredation of the climate has done damage to the entire community. And this is reflected in the weak development of the local markets. One thus notes the existence of temporary markets which are insufficient to meet local demand.

In order to address this insufficiency, the members of the Femmes de Gandiol group hope to develop the local market by creating a system of acquisition and commercialization of diverse products, by giving our members the chance to use loans to develop local trade.

Our business will consist of marketing basic household foodstuffs: vegetables, fruits, fresh fish, and other foods used in daily meals. We will buy these goods at a lower cost in the markets of the nearby towns of Potou and St. Louis, and resell then in our village.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Business description translated from French by Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance Fund.

«La population de Gandiol s’estime à environ 13.968 habitants. Les principales activités économiques qui sont menées dans la zone sont : la pêche, le maraîchage, l’élevage, et l’extraction du sel. Cependant du fait de la péjoration climatique et des phénomènes anthropique, le niveau de dégradation et de désorganisation est ressentis par sa communauté entière. Et ceci se reflète dans le faible développement des marchés locaux. On note ainsi l’existence et de marché temporaire qui n’arrivent pas à satisfaire la demande locale. Pour palier à ces insuffisances, les membres des groupements des femmes de Gandiol , espèrent développer le marché locale par la création d’un système d’approvisionnement et de commercialisation de produits diverses à travers la mise en place pour les membres de leurs groupements des crédits pour inciter au développement du petit commerce.

L’activité consiste à la commercialisation de denrées de premier nécessité, légumes, fruits poissons frais et autres condiments utiles pour l’alimentation au quotidien. Pour cela acheter à moindres coût dans les marchés de Potou et St – louis des denrées à revendes sur les places aménagées dans les villages du Gandiol»

loans.use: Purchase of fresh fish, vegetables and fruit in nearby towns for resale in home village

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: A skilled entrepreneur and married mother, Irina is dedicated to the growth and the success of her business. For the past ten years, Irina has sold toys in the central market of Melitopol, Ukraine. The blend of an ideal location and skillful product presentation make Irina’s vending kiosk a point of attraction in the Melitopol market. Her kindness, skill, and outgoing personality have helped Irina to develop a strong client base. With a strong character and eye to smart growth, Irina has maintained a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, Nadiya is requesting a loan of $750 to increase her inventory. With the additional income from profits, Irina hopes to continue improving her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To re-stock her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es:
Rosa Irene P. is a lady who has been selling vegetables at the market La Terminal in León, Nicaragua for 5 years now. She also sells clothes and cosmetics, but at a lesser quantity. Since she was young, she has been known to be very hard working. In addition, she is a mother of two little ones and holds the responsibility of providing them with health, education and a decent home where they can live.

She started her business with a sum of C$2,000 (Two thousand córdobas, or $110 USD) contributed by her husband. These days, she has been able to better her financial situation, but still needs to further invest in her business. To do this, she has taken loans from Ceprodel (3 loans) which according to her, have greatly helped in the acquisition of products and supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Irene P. es una dama que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de verduras en el sector del mercado la Terminal en León Nicaragua. También se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos pero en menor cantidad. Desde muy joven se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y además, es madre de dos pequeños que tiene la responsabilidad de brindarles salud, educación y un techo digno donde habitar.

Inició su actividad con un monto de C$ 2,000 (Dos mil córdobas) obtenidos por aporte de sus esposo, hoy en día, ha logrado mejorar su situación económica pero aun necesita invertir mas en su negocio y para esto ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel (3 créditos) y según cuenta le han beneficiado grandemente en la adquisición de los productos y además en la manutención de su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario and his wife, Juana Fernandez, are tailors. They began their tailoring business several years ago and it has steadily grown over the years. In fact, they started out with only one sewing machine and a small client base, but they now have three other employees with their own machines and have attracted a dedicated and loyal following of customers.

Little by little they grew their business to what it is now and they are currently seeking to increase the quality of their products to be sold. With the requested loan, Mario and Juana will buy more quality fabric and will be able to make a variety of clothing for their customers, which will increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials and cloth, especially high-quality fabrics.

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Viên Thi. D. is 30 years old. She is married and has a 5 years old son. Most of the women from her village make the traditional sedge mats for a living but not her. She owns a clothing store. Since the living standard of the people has improved a lot lately, they now pay attention to the way they dress so her store is very popular. Since she joined TYM, it had given her capital to invest in her store and expand to satisfy the demand. Last year she has bought a car to transport the merchandise. This time she is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy fabrics.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Không giống những người dân trong làng chủ yếu chọn nghề truyền thống làm chiếu, chị Viên Thị D., 30 tuổi, mở cửa hàng may mặc tại trung tâm thôn. Đời sống nhân dân ngày càng cao, việc ăn mặc cũng được chú trọng nên cửa hàng nhà chị D. lúc nào cũng đông khách. Tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn đầu tư, việc vay trả thuận lợi nên quy mô cửa hàng được mở rộng đáp ứng nhu cầu người dân. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển, năm vừa qua chị đã mua được xe máy thuận tiện hơn trong việc chở hàng. Vòng vốn này chị D. xin vay 400USD lấy vải, tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Hiện chị đang sống cùng chồng và 1 con trai 5 tuổi.
