loans.use: Buy fabrics

loans.name: Nikutusya

texts.en:
Mambo (hello) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Niktusya M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 13. In 2006, Niktusya established her food and soft drink kiosk business. Niktusya requires a loan in order to purchase a refrigerator to store beer, soda, and food. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase a refridgerator for her soft drinks.

loans.name: Thi Tien

texts.vi:
Ms. T. thi Tien is forty year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to buy feed to increase her revenues. Her husband helps her in this business. Her son is a carpenter. Her family income is about $VN 80,000/day.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien, a Kiva volunteer

Cô Trần Thị Tiến (MS: 030004), năm nay 40 tuổi. Cô vay 2.006.000 VND để mua cám cho lợn. Bản thân cô làm thêm để có thêm thu nhập. Chồng cô giúp đỡ cô trong việc chăn nuôi, còn con cô làm thợ mộc. Mức thu nhập của gia đinh khoảng 80.000 VND /ngày.

loans.use: Breeding

loans.name: Fanny Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fanny is 46 years old and lives in the Hialeah neighborhood. She's married and her husband works in an office which helps with household expenses. She has 2 daughters - 19 and 11 years old.

4 years ago, Fanny decided to set up a business - computer rentals and services for making international phone calls. The idea of this business came from a suggestion of her husband, who was looking for a way to increase the income for his family. Through these years, this business has been able to support the family and allow them to get ahead in life. The plans for the business include acquiring more computers to be able to make the internet cafe bigger.

She needs this loan so that she can change the ceiling in her living room to protect it from the winter.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Fanny tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casada, su esposo es oficinista y le apoya en los gastos familiares. Tiene 2 hijas de 19 y 11 años de edad. Hace 4 años Doña Fanny decidió poner un negocio de alquiler de computadoras y servicios de llamadas internacionales, este negocio salió como sugerencia desu esposo, buscando la manera de generar mayores ingresos para su familia, y a través de estos años se ha podido mantener y salir adelante, los planes para su negocio son adquirir más computadoras para poder agrandar el cyber cafe. El préstamo lo necesita para cambiar el techo de la sala de su vivienda y protegerse del invierno

loans.use: To purchase materials such as zinc to change the ceiling in the living room of her home.

loans.name: Ida Claudia

texts.en:
Ida Claudia is a sixty-seven year old single mother with one son. Ida Claudia had an Internet computer service business at her house which recently closed because she did not have enough customers. Ida Claudia has a new project to start a restaurant as her house is situated in a busy area.

Ida Claudia is a member of the Despertar Comunal Bank.

Ida Claudia needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles ($375 US Dollars) to invest in pots, plates, and tables to start her restaurant business.

Ida Claudia´s dream is to build a house, see that her new business is successful, and help her son to have a good future.

loans.use: to invest in pots, plates, and tables to start her restaurant business.

loans.name: Riana

texts.id:
28-year old Riana is the mother of two children, Kanza and Kelia. She offers laundry services as her business activity. She has been doing this for a number of years, relying on her washing machine and her iron as her tools/aids. Usually the customers who use her services are those pressed for time because they are busy working or because they don’t have maids, such as boarding school children or college students. Her activity is managed out of a rented house and her earnings are dependent on the volume of customers. Typically her daily turnover is Rp.20.000-Rp.40.000 (approx. US$2-$4). Her husband Handi works as a merchant, and his income helps to meet the household's needs. Riana really hopes to be given a loan to carry forward her laundry business and also help her husband in his efforts. Riana plans to use the earnings from her business to pay school fees for their two children. At this time the older child is already in elementary school.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Aarati, Kiva volunteer.

Riana (28 tahun), adalah ibu dari 2 orang anak Kanza dan Keila. Kegiatan sehari-harinya adalah sebagai penyedia jasa cuci pakaian atau laundry. Usaha ini sudah dijalaninya selama beberapa tahun, dengan mengandalkan mesin cuci dan seterika sebagai alay bantunya. Biasanya pelanggan yang menggunkan ajasanya adalah mereka yang tidak memiliki waktu untuk mencuci karena terlalu sibuk bekerja atau tidak memiliki pembantu seperti anak kost atau mahasiswa. Usaha ini dijalaninya dirumah kontrakan dengan penghasilan yang tidak menentu tergantung banyaknya pelanggan. Biasanya berkisar Rp.20.000 – Rp.40.000 perhari. Pekerjaan suaminya Handi sebagai pedagang cukup membantu juga dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumahnya. Riana sanagt mengahrapkan diberi pinjaman untuk menjalankan bisnis laundrynya dan juga membantu usaha suaminya. Penghasilan yang didapat rencananya dipakai untuk membayar biaya sekolah kedua anaknya. Saat ini anaknya yang sulung sudah duduk dibangku Sekolah Dasar.

loans.use: To purchase an additional washing machine and also to help her husband

loans.name: Horng

texts.en:
Horng S. is 33 years old and works raising pigs on her plot of land near her house. She normally makes around US$3 per day. 

Her husband Tep Hang, 37, has a business making rice wine at his home to earn a living and is able to make US$5 a day. Rice wine is good and poor people like to drink it because it is cheap. 

To make more money, Horng is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to increase her livestock and purchase more feed for pigs. 

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To increase her livestock and purchase more feed for pigs.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 48 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos mayores de edad, de 14, 21, 22,26 y 27 años de edad, tres son independientes y están casados y dos estudiando, habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Villa Reconciliación de la Kativo 8 c al sur, su esposo trabaja y se desempeña como supervisor de vigilancia. Doña Maria vende joyas y ropa de segunda desde hace nueve años esta en las ventas inicio con dinero que su esposo le dio, lo cual ha podido hacer crecer su negocio y captar sus clientes pues la ropa de segunda de vende bastante mas la de niño. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar ropa nueva y joyas ya que tiene muchos encargos pues da al crédito y al contado. A futuro desea tener mejores condiciones para invertir más en su negocio a si  como ayudar a sus hijos que estudien.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children of ages 14, 21, 22, 26, and 27. Three of her children are married and living independently, and two of them are students. She lives in a neighborhood of the capital called Villa Reconciliacion de la Kativo 8 south. Her husband works and acts as the community security supervisor. Maria has sold jewelry and second-hand clothes for nine years. Her business was started with money that her husband gave her and enabled her to grow the business and gain customers that prefer second-hand children's clothes. The purpose of this loan is to buy new clothes and jewelry and she already has many orders to use the credit and cash. Her desire for the future is to have a better ability to invest in her business so that she can support her children while they study.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry and clothes

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, Madame K. Afi est une femme dévouée et très dynamique qui a entrepris la commercialisation de maïs et de gari depuis 16 ans. L’année écoulée, elle a bénéficié d’un financement qui lui a permis de renforcer son commerce. Aujourd’hui, elle a soldé son crédit et a à son actif 2 lopins de terre. Dans la perspective d’augmenter son bénéfice en vue d’entreprendre des travaux de construction, elle décide d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat en sollicitant de nouveau un crédit. Ce prêt lui servira de fonds de roulement complémentaire indispensable à une bonne rentabilité de son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Afi K. is married and the mother of two. She is a very energetic and devoted women whose undertaking has been the commercialization of corn and gari (granulated cassava root) for sixteen years. In the previous year, she benefited from financing that enabled her to bolster her business. Today, she has paid off her loan and is actively working two patches of land. From the viewpoint of increasing her profit for construction purposes, she decided to increase her buying power by requesting a new loan. This loan will serve as added working capital that is indispensible in making her business really worthwhile.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To create an inventory of grain and gari for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy E. is 33 years old and married with 3 children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en: Hamidu H. C. is an enterprising Tanzanian businessman. He runs a shop at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam city center. He sells a variety of items. He purchases the items from various wholesale shops at the Kariakoo business center and stores around Buguruni. His business plan is to run a wholesale store. Income derived from the business is used to capitalize the business and meet his family's daily needs. He requests a loan of Tshs 600,000 to increase the inventory of his store.

loans.use: Increase store inventory and expand business

loans.name: Ojeleye

texts.en:
Ojeleye is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Ipaja, Lagos state, Nigeria.

She has a business where she sells kerosene, wholesale and retail. Ojeleye has been in this business for the past 5 years. Now, she needs a loan of N50,000 so she can purchase more kerosene to sell.

Ojeleye is a client of LAPO. She hopes to expand her business with this loan. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Kabirat

texts.en: Kabirat styles hair for her customers. She also sells children’s clothes. She needs a loan to purchase one hair dryer and styling creams. She is a LAPO client. Kabirat is 37 years old and married with two children. She says thank you to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one hair dryer and styling creams.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama S. is 42 years old. She is married and a mother of three. Currently all the kids are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. She has been selling plantains for a year now to support her family. Her husband sells fuel like petrol.

She treks to farming communities like Kintampo in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her stock of plantains in bulk from the plantain farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. With this loan, she wants to buy plantains in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to support her kids in school. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home. Ama belongs to a village bank called Jordan.

loans.use: Ama wants to buy a bunch of plantains

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 41 years old and is married with 5 children. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Katale Bwaise Kakembo Nuru Group

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Nuru is 45 years old, married with four children, and looking after two orphans. All are going to school.

She has owned a pharmacy selling medicine for over 10 years. She is using the loan to add various types of medicine to her pharmacy. She wishes to get whatever she needs and to help others too.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario M. es una dama muy trabajadora y dedicada a su trabajo de venta de productos lácteos como lo son queso, cuajada y crema siendo comercializados en su localidad donde es visitado por los clientes a diario.

Es de suma importancia destacar que hoy en día ella requiere de la materia prima para la elaboración de los lácteos y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Rosario M. is an extremely hard-working lady. Every day she sells dairy products (cheese, curds and cream) around her neighbourhood. She needs more raw materials for making dairy products, so she has come to Ceprodel for a loan. In order to succeed, she needs your support.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying raw materials

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
" My husband and I work together in our farm. We want to ensure that we will have an abundant harvest to provide the needs of our children. Our previous harvest is 224 sacks. We wished to improve our harvest all the more. Now, we are busy preparing our land and need additional capital to pay for farm necessities," says Mrs. Alicia M., a farmer and mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds. " With my loan, I wish to be able to improve our harvest and increase income for the family", she said.

CEVI aims to help small business to grow. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds

loans.name: Urozali

texts.ru: Урозали Тошев проживает в районе Чоми. Возраст 50 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Урозали 10 лет работал учителем в школе. Но вскоре начал свой бизнес, он занимается посевом бахчевых растений. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы посеить как бахчевые растения, так и семечки. Собрав хороший урожай он хочет продать, а на полученный доход отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Urozali T. lives in the Chomi region. He is 50 years old. He is married and has six children. Urozali has worked as a teacher in school for ten years. But then soon he started own business and sows melons. The client is asking for a loan to sow more melons as well as seeds. He wants to sell it when he collects good harvest and use the profit to repair his home.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sow melons and seeds

loans.name: Letapu

texts.en: Letapu T., 32, is single with one child.  She has five years of experience in the pork buns, donuts, and cream buns business. She sells to the public six days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala. SPBD loans are Letapu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, baking soda, pots, fryer and spoons

loans.name: Sorbeh Ia Group

texts.en:
This is Musa S. B., Abu K. and Adamsay C.. They called their group Sorbeh IA. They are petty-traders in Makump Banna village, about five miles from Makeni City.

This will be their ninth loan from SMT/Kiva. With the help of SMT/Kiva loans, these entrepreneurs have been able to expand their businesses. Notwithstanding, they still want a new loan in order to further strengthen their businesses. Thus, they are requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 each.

Musa S. B. (in the middle of the photo) is the leader of this group. He was born in Makump village and is now thirty-six years of age. He is married with five children. He sells ready-to-wear clothes like jeans and women's wear and has been in this business for more than ten years now.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste P. is a 42-year-old businesswoman living in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City.  She lives with her husband Renante, 34, a company driver, and their two children, who are both in grade school.

Celeste has been a fish and hog meat vendor for 20 years now.  She has a stall in the nearby public market.  She makes P10,000 a month income from her business.  

Celeste came from a poor family, but she believes that there is always a way to get out of it.  In the later part of 2006, she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative.  She has carefully invested the proceeds of her previous loans in her business.  It went well, and brought her enough income to augment her family’s daily needs, including her children’s education.

Now on her 12th loan cycle, she is requesting for a loan of P37,000.  She will use the funds as additional capital for her fish and hog meat stand.  Celeste is optimistic that she can bring her family out of poverty because of the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish and hog meat to sell at the market

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita M. is a married woman who lives in Thecho with her husband and one son. Both her husband, Mr. Bikram M., and Ramita are engaged in making wax statues. They have six years of experience in this work . They learned this work from their suppliers. They sell their statues in Patan. The Patan area is a well-known place for idol-making work in Nepal. 

In order to sustain their business, they have to invest continuously in their business. So Mrs. M. is requesting a second loan of Rs 25,000 from Kiva to buy various types of raw material like wax and equipment for their work.

They have a 5-year-old son who is studying in boarding school. Mrs. M. and her husband are planning to save their income for their son’s education.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: L. señora MarceL. D. L. C. es una señora trabajadora que junto con su esposo han ido construyendo su casa, ellos ya son personas grandes y aunque sus hijos ya formaron su vida quieren dejar un buen patrimonio para cuando ellos falten. L. casa L. han levantado poco a poco ahora solo necesita un enjarre y pintarL. por fuera para esto están pidiendo un préstamo para comprar el material y pagar L. mano D. obra. MarceL. y su esposo estan satisfechos por que con su esfuerzo y tantos años D. trabajar tiene un techo donD. vivir y para su vejez no estén viviendo en casa D. sus hijos y causar molestia.
texts.en:
MarceL. D. L. C. is a hard working woman who, together with her husband, has been building her house. They are senior citizens, and even though their children have their own lives, MarceL. and her husband would like to leave them a good inheritance for when they are not here. They have raised the house little by little. Now, they only need the stucco and to paint the outsiD.. That is why they are asking for a loan to buy the material and pay for the work. MarceL. and her husband are satisfied because, through their efforts and so many years of working, they have a place to live. In their old age they will not be living in their children’s house and bothering them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stucco the front of the house

loans.name: Phok

texts.en:
Phok N. is married with four children. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province.

Phok N. is engaged in selling various kinds of food including porridge, dessert, and pounded papaya, typically earning US$5 per day. His wife helps him in the business every day, and she looks after the household chores. The family is also assisted by the two children who are currently employed in a hotel with an income of US$2.50 each per day.

N. wants to improve his business and generate a better income for the family. Therefore, he is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to buy utensils for making fruit shake. By doing so, he will be able to expand his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy utensils for making shake fruit

loans.name: Rawzi Hatiq Group

texts.en: Rawzi Hatiq is a two-member group and M. Hatiq is the leader. They want to take a loan for progressing their business and making it larger. So they have requested a group loan of 15,000 Afghani. M. Hatiq wants to take a loan for his general store. Hanifa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. They thank  AFS and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For business progress

loans.name: Dambarentsen

texts.en:
Dambarentsen B. is 40 years old and lives with her parents and 10-year-old son in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her son, Barhuu, attends a local secondary school.

B. operates a machinery parts trading business in her town with the help of her brother. She started her business in 2005 with capital of 800,000 tugrugs (~560 USD). Over the years, she has gained much experience in her trade and always tries to grow and improve her business. She has built a stable business and a positive reputation among her customers, and today her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD).

B. is a very open-minded and hardworking person. Her main goal is to provide for her son's education and to help him become a good and responsible person. For the future, she hopes to expand her business, and is requesting a 3,800,000 tugrug loan to buy supplies for her machinery parts trading business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her machinery parts trading business

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: As a mother, Jacqueline P. wanted to save her children from experiencing life being poor. She knew very well how hard and cruel it could be to a person without her own stable source of income. Because of this, she joined ASHI just recently to access a loan, which will finance her in starting a business. The primary business for which she will be using the loan is a hog fattening business. Once hogs are fattened after three to four months, they will be sold either whole or slaughtered, and pork will be sold per kilo. With her proceeds, she hopes that the basic needs of her seven children will be met. Having failed with her three eldest children who have not even graduated from high school, Jacqueline also wants to support the needs of her four younger children in school until they graduate from college.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase piglets and required food

loans.name: Kathy May

texts.en: Kathy May P. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old, is married, and has two infant children. Kathy May owns and operates a business providing rental services to local community members. Kathy May has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Kathy May joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Kathy May has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating her business. Kathy May is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to completion the renovation. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete the renovation of her rooms

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with two (2) children. Her eldest child is 4 years old and her youngest child is 2 years old. Her children are excelling in school. Her husband is a technician. Victoria is 28 years old and her husband is 31 years old.

Victoria is a LAPO client. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell in this festive season. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr: Z. Bernadette est née en 1961 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Il y a environs 36 ans déjà que Bernadette vit à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à VITOFODJI Nicolas, un menuisier, Bernadette est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Bernadette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Agbalilamè. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Bernadette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Bernadette mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (bananes frites, gâteaux de haricot, etc.) à son domicile. Bernadette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Bernadette exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Bernadette avait bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de ALIDé. Bernadette sollicite ce deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour augmenter son capital et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Z. Bernadette was born in 1961 in Ekpè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. She has been living in Agbalilamè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji, for about 36 years now. Married to VITOFODJI Nicolas, a carpenter, Bernadette is the mother of five children; she is still responsible for three of them. All her children are enrolled in school. Bernadette lives with her children and her husband in Agbalilamè. The couple shares the responsibility of supporting the household.

Bernadette never went to school. In order to earn her living, she sells food (fried bananas, bean fritters, etc.) out of her home. She buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has been in this business for eight years and is on her second loan with ALIDé. She reimbursed her first loan from ALIDé in a timely manner. She is requesting this second loan from ALIDé to increase her working capital and bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beans and stalks of bananas

loans.name: Faamanuia

texts.en:
Faamanuia F. is 46 and married with 5 children (ages 9 - 19).  She owns a business venture, baking & selling a variety of confectionaries such cookies and cakes in the local community.  Faamanuia has 7 years of experience in this business.  Faamanuia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase baking equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 355 tala or US $148 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Faamanuia joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faamanuia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faamanuia F. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.7 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Niyoz

texts.en:
N. Niyoz has been dedicated to the activity of agriculture from a young age. He has attended to this activity with great strength. It is necessary to highlight that this gentleman is very involved in his work because he has an obligation to take care of his three children. The need that Niyoz is encountering now is that he doesn't have the financial capital to invest in the crops and for this reason, he applied to IMON International to obtain a loan of $1,000 USD to buy mineral fertilizer in order to prepare his land for the upcoming season. Niyoz promises to repay the loan without any violations and thanks everyone for supporting him.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Chidima

texts.en:
Chidima is a LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) client. LAPO, a Kiva partner, is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. 

Chidima has a stall where she sells used clothes and bags. Her customers are usually residents, friends and neighbors. She hopes to own a classic boutique in the future. 

She hopes for a loan of 90,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more used clothes and bags to sell. She is 27 years old and married with two children. Her eldest child is 4 years old, while her youngest child is 2 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes and bags to sell

loans.name: Florinda Cruz

texts.es: Florida tiene 30 años de edad, soltera, cuenta con una tienda de consumo diario en su casa de habitación, ha trabajado un crédito anterior demostrando su responsabilidad pagando puntualmente el préstamo, necesita nuevamente el financiamiento para incrementar su capital en la su tienda, el destino será para la compra de mas productos e introducir otros que no las vende y que la clientela lo socita.
texts.en:
Florida is 30 years old and single. She has a store in her house, and she sells daily consumption items. She has worked with a previous loan, and she demonstrated responsibility by paying it punctually. She needs a new loan to increase the capital in her store. The loan will be to buy more products. She will also introduce other products that the customers are asking for that she does not now sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah M.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She is 20 years old, married and has small child. They are from the village of Brgy.Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Leah has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Leah joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Natsagmaa

texts.en: Natsagmaa is 41 years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Jadamba operates a taxi service business and also supports his wife's business if help is needed. Natsagmaa operates a vegetable trading business in her town. She sells a variety of vegetables including potatoes, carrots and rutabagas from her 1,5 hectares of land. Natsagmaa has been operating her business since 2000, and has steadily expanded her business. She gets 15 tons of vegetable per year, and sells them to her many customers. The business is supported by the whole family and they have built a stable operation. Natsagmaa has been planning to plant more uncommon vegetables in the future. She is a very enthusiastic person who has had valuable business experience over the past years. She says, “I am working hard to reach my goal.” Natsagmaa is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 375 USD) loan to purchase uncommon vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora Angela Nuñez D. E. es separada, tiene casa propia y vive con su hijo.
Es propietaria D. una despensa en su casa.La señora ha trabajodo en varias oportubidaes con la fundación en esta ocación solicita un prétamos para cubrír los gastos por medicamentos.
Tiene un hijo que habia sufrido un accidente hace dos años atrás y se fracturo las dos piernas y se esta recuperando D. a poco, lo que le causa muchos gastos en medicamentos y por otras cosas.
Es una señora responsable, honesta y muy trabajadora, tiene muy buenas referencias comerciales en todas las entidades.
texts.en:
Angela Nuñez D. E. is separated. She has her own house, and she lives with her child. She has a grocery store in her house. She has worked with the Fundación several times. On this occasion she is requesting a loan to cover the cost of medication. She has a child who suffered an accident two years ago. He broke both legs, and he is slowly recovering. There are a lot of expenses for medication and other things. She is a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman. She has very good references from all of the businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medications

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
34-year-old Nenita P. enjoys the life she spends loving and taking care of her two children whose ages are 1 and 12 years old. Despite the limited opportunities she and her family have, which hampers them from rising above poverty, Nenita still feels blessed because of the love and support of her husband in all her endeavors, especially in business.

In 1999 Nenita and her husband agreed to request for a loan through ASHI to be able to put up a business for her husband to manage. Through its revenue, her family would have a source of cash flow to support their daily needs.

Nenita was able to purchase two motorcycles for a transportation business. One is a tricycle with a sidecar attached and is operated by her husband, and the other one is rented by someone in their village. Because this is one of the common means of transportation for people in the whole of the town, since jeepneys (small buses) and buses are rare and are not accessible in remote villages, Nenita’s business has grown fairly well.

Now, as a matter of fact, Nenita has able to start up her own small sari-sari (variety) store business using the profits from her prior business.

While Nenita’s children are still young, she wants to grow her own business through the loan she is now requesting. This loan will be used to increase the inventory of her store such as foodstuffs, beverages, and other basic commodities for people in their neighborhood to access rather than having to spend money on fares to go to market. 

Nenita is hoping to be able to put up a savings fund for the sustainability of her businesses as well as for the education of her children in the future. She is looking forward to the day when she would be marching on stage together with her children for them to receive their medal and diploma for their graduation from college.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Srey Lean's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Lean L. is a 28 year old married woman and is the village bank president selected by ten members, located in Krang Koam village in Kandal province. With this loan, the members will purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Srey Lean L. is a grocery seller and owns a small store. Mrs. Srey Lean L. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries to enlargen her business. Her husband, Mr. Veasna M., is a car driver receiving a small salary to support his famiL.'s costs of living. This couple has two children; one is a student in the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie B. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old and is single. Emie owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Emie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Emie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her existing vehicle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon T. is a 27-year-old man who is single. He has been operating a retail “kiosk” for last two years in Maweni where he sells items like over-the-counter drugs, soap, cooking oil, biscuits, soft drinks and others.

Simon was introduced to Kadet by a neighbor who knew about Kadet. He is taking his first loan of Kshs 20,000 from Kadet to buy more stock for his business. He hopes to grow his business with the loan and expand to others as well.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his business

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: la Señora Elena vende dulces,chocolates, cigarrillos y otros productos en los distintos acontecimientos como, fiestas de matrimonios, bautizos y en restaurantes por las noches, desde hace veinti cinco años se dedica a esta actividad, vive en alquiler, la Sra. vive sola, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, tambien pertenece al banco de emprendimiento San Andres, esta en su segundo ciclo con este banco de emprendimiento, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Elena sells sweets, chocolates, cigarettes and other goods at various events like weddings and christenings, and in restaurants at night. She has been doing this for twenty-five years. She lives alone in rented accommodation. She is in her third loan cycle. She also belongs to the San Andres communal bank. She is in her second cycle with this communal bank and has proved herself to be a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Rudy Domingo

texts.es: Rudy es de 29 años de edad es soltero, se dedica a confeccionar prendas para vestir, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente 10 años de experiencia, la cual le ha ayudado para sufragar sus gastos, solicita su segundo crédito para comprar una maquina collaretera, lo cual le ayudara para mejora su producción, sus referencia personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador, su crédito anterior lo pago normalmente.
texts.en:
Rudy is 29 years old, single, and works as a tailor creating clothing. He has around 10 years of experience in this line of work which has helped him defray his living expenses. He is asking for his second loan to buy a sewing machine, which will help him increase production. His personal references say that he is a responsible and hard-working person. He repaid his previous loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila G. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Precila is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Precila owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Precila has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Precila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Precila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Precila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: En

texts.en: En T., 48, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia.  This area is known for its quality palm products. T. is a farmer and earns USD 1 per day. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning USD 4 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a pump to help improve farming. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a water pump

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 32-year old married woman from Lebanon. A mother of 3 children, she has started her business offering beauty services to the clients from her home. Her services include manicure, pedicure, tattoo etc. She has been working for the past five years.  Her income is important to help with her household expenses and to pay for her children’s school fees. Today, she is asking for her second loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase beauty products and expand her business. 

In the future, she is planning to open a formal beauty salon to receive her clients.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products and expand her business

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 35-year-old married man living in Chtoura with his wife and three children. Moussa owns a pickup which he has used to transport vegetables and fruit from one place to another since 2000. Moussa works hard on improving his service, as it’s his only source of income. His clients are most army barracks in addition to grocery shops. His good reputation and his strong will are his strengths.

Moussa is requesting a loan for the first time from A. Majmoua, in order to do necessary maintenance on his pickup, in addition to taking care of some other personA. things that need to be done. Moussa hopes he can open a big grocery shop specializing in the best vegetables and fruit in the market.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his pickup

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora.  Por lo que se levanta muy temprano para realizar este tipo de platillos tan deliciosos que sus  clientes le solicitan. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como hojas, masa, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Dolores has been selling nacatamales (pork, vegetables and corn masa wrapped in a banana leaf) for the past twelve years.  She is very committed to improving her food stall and her business. She is a hardworking woman. She gets up very early in the morning in order to make this delicious food that her customers always request. She is asking for this loan in order to buy materials such as leaves, corn masa, and other things.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Bulenga Twekembe Group 1-Mpigi

texts.en: It is now more than 10 years since 36-year-old N. Hadijah began her timber product sales business in Bulenga-Mpigi. Hadija is contentedly married with four kids. 120,000 shillings is what this business generates weekly for this lady, who has all along relied on self-motivation, resoluteness and will power to achieve growth in her dealings. With this loan she wants to purchase more timber for resale. She belongs to 'Bulenga Twekembe' group-Mpigi.

loans.use: The purchase of more timber for resale

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida K. lives in the Kilokore neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who isn’t in school. 

Hamida has a business making and selling chapatti and samosas.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Hamida sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Hamida has requested for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cartons of baking flour, cooking oil and cow peas.     

The main business challenge for Hamida is seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations are expanding her business so that she could start distributing them to different shops, and also to buy a plot of land.   

Hamida lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, cooking oil, and cow peas

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni S. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, Cotabato. She is 35 and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Laarni owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling cosmetics, lotions, perfumes and umbrellas in the local community. Laarni has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Laarni joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laarni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI which she used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Laarni is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be her fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Eoun's Group

texts.en:
This group loan includes five members. They are located in Preaek Samraong village in Kandal province. Mrs. Eoun C., a 30-year-old married woman, is the group leader, having been selected by its members.  The members of this village group loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Eoun C. is a grocery seller in the local village. Since the grocery business is still bringing in only a meager income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Eoun C. would like to expand her store. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her current business. Her husband, Mr. Sour Noeun, 35 years old, works as construction worker where he can receive only a little income to support his family. This couple has a child who is attending a local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her current business

loans.name: Keymin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keymin tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la venta de frutas en un puesto ambulante situado en el mercado de su localidad, ella ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos frescos a buen precio y brindándoles un buen trato, estas prácticas le han valido obtener siempre una buena clientela. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia y solventar sus gastos personales.

Keymin desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más frutas de temporada, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles con los cuales planea lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Keymin, 24, is single and lives with her parents in Lambayeque district, an area with regular commercial activity located over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells fruit from a vending stand in her local market.  She offers various fresh products to her customers at a good price and with good customer service.  These practices have led to her always having a good customer base.  Income from this activity is used to pay for her personal expenses and support her family.

Keymin wants to expand the business acquiring more seasonal fruit so has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan that she plans to use to reach her objective.

loans.use: To get more seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Fente Allabo Group

texts.fr:
FENTE ALLABO est un groupe de l’association FOTEMOGOBAN de TENE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 9  enfants, elles mènent différentes activités : vente de diverses marchandises et jus de fruits. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TENE dans la préfecture de SAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire. 
ASSA D., qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TENE, excelle dans la préparation et vente de jus de fruits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 sacs de bisap, 2 sacs de sucre, 50 kg de gingembre   et 5000FCFA pour les accessoires.  Elle s’approvisionne à SAN tous les Lundis  et vend son jus à TENE et dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires à travers des employées.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 32000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité. Les autres membres comptent sur un bénéfice de 30000FCFA par mois  somme qui leur permettra de rembourser le prêt et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The FENTE ALLABO group is part of TENE’s FOTEMOGOBAN association. It consists of four women who know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. On average, they are 48 years old, married, with at least nine children. They lead different activities, including the sale of various goods and fruit juices. They live in large traditional families in TENE, in the prefecture of SAN (region of Ségou, Republic of Mali).

They have been engaged in small business activities for several years and are in high demand. 
In order to meet their customers’ increasing needs, the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution five years ago. They are currently on their ninth loan cycle.

ASSA D., president of the group and well known in TENE, excels in the preparation and sale of fruit juices. She intends to use her loan to buy three bags of bissap, two bags of sugar and 50 kg of ginger, and spend 5,000 FCFA on accessories. She gets her stocks in SAN every Monday, and sells her juices in TENE and at the various weekly fairs through employees.

She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 32,000 FCFA, which would allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business. The other group members are expecting a profit of 30,000 FCFA per month, which they will use to repay the loan and provide for their families.

loans.use: To buy smoked and fried fish

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea N. has been in farming business for over ten years. She is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province. She has three children:  all of them are single, and they are still living with her. Her husband is a casual construction worker and earns a profit of around US $2.50 a day. In addition to the farming business, Chea N. raise a few pigs behind her house for extra-profit. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Chea N. and her family, she would like to request a loan to buy additional feed and small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.name: Celinda

texts.es: Celinda tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la compra y venta de reses, siendo esta actividad ejercida los fines de semana, que a lado de su esposo, logran vender en cantidad, permitiéndole sostenerse económicamente toda la semana. Su trabajo consiste en elegir y comprar dichos animales, para ello estudia todo lo necesario sobre la crianza de reses, de esa manera logra hacer una buena negociación. En adelante desea tener más capital de trabajo, asimismo conseguir animales de raza, ya que su cotización es mayor que los otros animales comunes. Es su crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para comprar más animales.
texts.en:
Celinda, 50, lives with her husband and two children in a leased house.  For the last 10 years she’s been a cattle merchant.  This activity takes place on weekends.  Together with her husband they sell quite a bit allowing them to support themselves all week.  He work consists in selecting and buying said animals.  To do so, she studies everything concerning cattle raising so that she can carry out a good negotiation.  In the future she’d like to have more working capital as well as to get pedigreed animals since they bring better prices than other common animals.

This is her 15th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial help because she’s always been responsible with her payments.  In addition, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  She thanks all those people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the loan to buy more animals.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith es socia del  Banco Comunal “María Asunción Galindo”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito – Juli, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene un  hijo.  Ella tiene como grado de instrucción secundaria completa. 
Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, como polleras, enaguas, chompas y mandiles. Trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace doce años, la primera vez solicito un monto de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, con lo que pudo comprar una docena de chompas para incrementar su mercadería, aparte de la actividad mencionada hace tejidos como mantones y todo a croché.
Con éste crédito de S/ 1000.00 nuevo soles, comprará polleras y dos docenas de chompas de $ 20.00 dólares, estos productos los trae de Desaguadero para venderlos en la feria de Juliaca  e Ilave
Su sueño es tener una tienda de ropa bien surtida en Juliaca.
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal es el trabajo en equipo y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the María Asunción Galindo Communal Bank.  It is located in the Juli district, Chucuito – Juli province, Puno department.  She is 30 years old, married, and has one child.  She has a high school education.

She sells articles of clothing like “polleras” (traditional Bolivian skirts), “enaguas” (traditional underskirts), sweaters, and aprons.  She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 12 years.  The first time she requested 300 soles, which she used to buy a dozen sweaters to increase her merchandise.  Aside from this business activity, she makes weavings like scarves and crochets everything.

She will use this loan for 1,000 soles to buy polleras and two dozen sweaters for $20.00.  She will take these products to Desaguadero to sell at the Juliaca and Ilave fair.  Her dream is to have a well-stocked clothing store in Juliaca.

What she likes about her communal bank is working as a team and the meetings with the members.

loans.use: To buy skirts and two dozen sweaters

loans.name: Willian

texts.es:
William V. M., está casado, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para la asistencia de su cafetal y tenerlo en buenas condiciones  este año. Él cuenta con el terreno ya en producción, que está en buenas condiciones además cuenta con  la experiencia en el manejo de este desde ya varios años. Lo que el quiere es incrementar la producción de su plantación para  tener más rendimiento en calidad como cantidad de café y crecer como un caficultor de la zona en buena producción este año. El piensa en su futuro y en la de su familia, quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, al igual lograr unas metas propuestas para crecer como persona y como productor.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
William V. M. is married living with his wife and two children who are his main priority.  He wants to buy necessary supplies for his coffee crops to have them in good condition this year.  He has a field already in production that’s in good condition.  He also has several years experience growing coffee.  

What he wants to do is increase production to have higher yields both in quantity and quality of coffee and to grow as a coffee producer in the zone with a good harvest this year.  He thinks of his and his family’s future and wants to provide them with better quality of life as well as meeting some goals he has set up for himself to grow as a person and as a producer.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn’t had any previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR provided the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and feed for one production cycle.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 31 years old, married and has three children who range in age from 3 to 9 years old. She is well known in her community for selling cosmetics. She opened her business two years ago and works from  6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Sunday. She  has one employee and is applying for this loan from Kiva and Vision Finance Company to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to expand her business and provide her children with a better life and a good education.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna R., 30 years old, is currently in business selling fish. She is married to a teacher and they have four children going to school. Her future goal is to buy more goods from her business profit.

loans.use: to stock more fish.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion V., 44, is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard- working entrepreneur. 

Concepcion buys and sells dry goods in the Philippines. Concepcion has been in this business for nine years.  

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est née le 12 Octobre 1967. Mariée à un agent de pharmacie, Gisèle a quatre enfants à charge qui ne sont pas scolarisés. Gisèle et son mari vivent ensemble avec les enfants à charge. Ayant arrêté l’école au cours primaire, Gisèle a appris ensuite la couture, une activité qu’elle exerce depuis une quinzaine d’année et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. De façon secondaire, Gisèle vend des boissons (bissap, sucette, glace, etc.) à son domicile. Gisèle s’approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Gisèle sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit ; crédit lui servira à mieux équiper son salon de couture par une nouvelle machine à surfilage.
texts.en: Gisèle was born on October 12, 1967. Gisèle is married to a pharmacy officer and takes care of four children, who do not go to school. Gisèle and her husband live with the children they are taking care of. Gisèle stopped attending school at the secondary level and then learned how to sew, which she has been doing for 15 years, and which has enabled her to provide for herself. On the side, Gisèle sells drinks (hibiscus tea, lollipops, ice cream, etc.) from home. Gisèle buys her supplies from Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. In order to meet the needs of her customers, Gisèle is requesting a loan for the second time. She will use this loan to equip her sewing room with a new serger.

loans.use: to buy a new serger and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lassina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lassina a 35 ans environ, marié et père de trois enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Wayerma II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Lassina après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié  depuis maintenant trois ans aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont il dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal, où il mène son activité d’achat et vente  de Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing Gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucres, savons, etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Il  a déjà  bénéficié  de 3 crédits qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
Il sollicite ainsi ce quatrième crédit pour pouvoir acheter, 15 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 sacs du sucre, 12 cartons du thé,  5 paquets de bonbon, 9 paquets de Chewing Gum, 25 paquets d’allumette, 15 cartons de savons, etc. Ses marchandises sont achetées auprès de commerçants grossistes de la ville avant de les revendre en détail dans sa boutique.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur Lassina is about 35 years old, married, and the father of three children. He lives with his family in Wayerma II, a neighborhood in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After running several businesses without success, Monsieur Lassina has been buying and selling diverse products for three years. He has a shop in front of his family's home, where he trades in cigarettes, candy, matches, gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, soap, etc. He is very much in demand by his clients because his products are of good quality.

To satisfy his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about four years ago. He has already received three loans which have all been duly repaid.

He is seeking a fourth loan to buy fifteen cartons of various cigarettes, five bags of sugar, twelve boxes of tea, five packages of candy, nine packages of gum, twenty-five packages of matches, fifteen boxes of soap, etc. His merchandise is bought from wholesale sellers in the city to be sold retail in his shop. 

With this loan he plans to make a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA, which will primarily be used to help pay family expenses, pay interest on his loan, and invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, biscuits & candies. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, breads & biscuits.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, breads & biscuits

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Mary Isabel

texts.es: La  señora Mary  es cliente antigua  de emprender que esta retornando de mucho tiempo ella  vende artículos varios en la ceja de el alto, tiene un puesto fijo. Con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería para surtir su puesto, ya que se acercan las fechas festivas de ciudad y tendrá mucha venta, la Sra.  Mary  vive en  la zona  la portada la cliente esta muy contenta de haberse beneficiado  con el credito kiva. La cliente es muy trabajadora porque a la vez doña Mary teje carteras de lana y chompas, tiene  dos hijos que están estudiando, y el deseo de la Sra. es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sra. Mary is a long-time client of Emprender who is returning after a long absence. She sells various products from an established location in the neighborhood of La Ceja in the city of El Alto. Using the money from this loan, she will buy merchandise to restock her stand. As the dates of the city festivals draw near, Mary will be able to generate more sales. She lives in the District of La Portada. Doña Mary is pleased to know that she will benefit from a Kiva loan.

She is a hardworking woman since she also knits sweaters and handbags made of wool. Mary has two children who are students, so she wants to see them become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise in time for the city festivals.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but doesn't have piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

For the past three years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling as retail to his neighbours and passersby. He also operates a retail shop business which contributes his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and, for his retail shop, sacks of rice, sugar and beans. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and, for his retail shop, sacks of rice, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Hoeung

texts.en:
The country of Cambodia operates as a free market, so lots of couples cooperate and make an effort to find jobs that are suitable for them to earn sufficient income to support their families. With many job choices, Hoeung works as a fish trader in a market near her own house, earning about 3 USD a day. Her husband works as a fisherman. Hoeung has four children whom she is presently supporting. 

Hoeung is requesting a 600 USD loan to improve her family’s standard of living. She will use her loan to purchase fishing equipment for her husband’s fishing business. In the future, she hopes to be able to send all of her children to universities.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is a married man with four children: two boys and two girls. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past seven years, he has operated a business selling phone accessories, selling in a shop to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of competition from other sellers in the market. Nathaniel dreams of establishing his own shop in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to purchase phone accessories for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es:
José, tiene treinta y seis años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.
Don José acude nuevamente a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para continuar las mejoras en su casa de habitación, ya que el préstamo era utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción como es la compra de zinc, perlines y pintura para cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.
 Para que su familia pueda contar con una mejor vivienda para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, single, and has two school-aged children.  He came back to the offices of CEPRODEL to request a new loan to continue with improvements that he is making to his house.   This loan will be used to purchase construction materials such as: sheets of corrugated metal roofing, beams, and paint.  He will use these materials to put a new roof on his house since his roof is in bad condition.

He is doing this work so that his children can grow up in a better house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials: sheets of corrugated metal roofing, beams and paint

loans.name: Tsimba

texts.en:
Tsimba is a 59 year old married father of five children. Tsimba is a livestock farmer in Mariakani. He has been in this business for the last 14 years and it is doing well. 

Tsimba has been a KADET client and this marks his fourth borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, Tsimba plans to purchase more goats and cattle. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to expand his business. His dream is to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cattle.

loans.name: Aidha

texts.en:
Aidha is a 26-year-old woman, married to a businessman. They have two children, neither of whom are in school. She has a business selling clothes in the town of Dar es Salam, Yei county in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.
Aidha requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes for sale with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is a working woman who supports her family financially through her bangles business. She also carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well. Her husband has just started a shoemaking business. Earlier, he was involved in a fruit-selling business and on the side started learning shoemaking as well. When he left the fruit-selling business, he went to learn the skill of shoemaking. Now, he is fully trained and gets orders from different factories.
  
Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to establish her husband's shoemaking business. With the loan, her husband will buy items like leather, nails, and shoe polish in large quantities to make a lot of shoes and improve his income.
  
Robina is very confident that her husband will be able to establish his shoemaking business, and that his family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living as a result.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: to buy items required for a shoemaking business

loans.name: Pamoja S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Pamoja Group in Western Kenya! This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
George is the facilitator of the Pamoja SHG Group. He takes care of ten children at home with his wife. He joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on three-quarters of an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest six bags of maize on three-quarters of an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, George will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
In 2012, the members of Pamoja SHG Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.
