Jessica is 28 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store selling hog feed in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Jessica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Soksan

texts.en:
Mrs. Soksan P. (pictured here), has been married since 2004 and has two young sons. She lives with her parents on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Soksan has been a silk weaver since 2000, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband is also a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to Phnom Penh to sell. In addition, she runs a grocery store. 

Soksa has asked for Kiva loan several times before. She now is requesting another loan of $300 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Brisa Del Este. Group

texts.es:
Para la formación del presente comité inició la señora Blanca Oviedo quien contactó  con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona y así conformaron su grupo para trabajar.
 Una de las integrantes es la señora Felicia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de forma ambulante.
Ella trabaja diariamente a la mañana y la tarde se dedica a la labores de su casa.
Esta actividad le ayuda a ella con los gasto de la alimentación diarias de su familia, y al mismo tiempo le ayuda a su marido quien no posee un ingreso  fijo ya que trabaja como vendedor ambulante en el centro de la ciudad.
Con su crédito ella podrá comprar algunas mercaderías como suéter, pantalones,  jeans ya que actualmente no cuenta con un capital para concretar la compra.
texts.en:
In order to form the present committee, Mrs. Blanca Oviedo got in touch with her friends and neighbors to start a group in their area. One of the group's members is Mrs. Felicia who makes a living selling clothing door-to-door. She works each morning and takes care of the house in the afternoon. This business helps her cover the daily cost of food for her family. It also helps her husband who does not have a regular income and works as an ambulatory salesman in the town's center. She will be able to buy some merchandise like sweaters, pants, and jeans with the loan since she doesn't have the money to buy clothing right now.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters, pants, and jeans.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural que se encuentra comprendida dentro del distrito de Pomalca. Las actividades económicas dela zona son la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la elaboración artesanal de sombreros.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la elaboración de adobes (bloques de barro y pajilla de arroz, utilizados en la construcción de viviendas, su bajo precio y accesibilidad le hace muy usado en las zonas rurales y de bajos recursos del país). Durante el tiempo que ha venido trabajando se ha hecho conocido en la zona y actualmente distribuye su mercadería entre los vecinos del lugar en donde vive y en las zonas aledañas.

Adicionalmente percibe ingresos criando y vendiendo animales. El cría animales menores en la parte posterior del domicilio en donde vive y ocasionalmente los vende a sus vecinos y a diversos compradores. Con estas actividades el sostiene la economía de su familia.

Oswaldo desea adquirir diversos insumos para seguir elaborando adobes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. El es una persona bastante trabajadora yque siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a 28-year-old father who lives with his wife and two young children in the San Pablo sector, a rural area that is located within the Pomalca district. The main industries in the area are agriculture, small animal breeding, and the production of handmade hats.

He has been making adobe (bricks made of clay and rice straw, used in home construction; adobe's low price and accessibility makes it popular in the country's rural and low-income areas). During the time that he has been working, he has become well-known in the area, and he currently distributes his merchandise to his neighbors and to people in surrounding communities.

Additionally, he earns a living by raising and selling animals. He raises small animals behind his house, and he occasionally sells them to his neighbors and to other buyers. With these businesses, he supports his family.

Oswaldo would like to obtain several different materials to keep making adobe. For this reason, he is requesting a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternative for the first time, which will help him reach his objective. He is a very hard-working person who is always giving his best to help his loved ones get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make adobe bricks

loans.name: Norbertina

texts.es:
Norbertina H. H., ha sido muy emprendedora. Sus padres con gran esfuerzo lograron darle una educación primaria y continuó por su cuenta con estudios secundarios y una carrera como técnico de oficina. Esta experiencia le enseñó la importancia de la educación, y ahora dirige todos sus esfuerzos para proporcionar una educación universitaria de su hijo. Está muy contenta con su anterior Credikiva y dice  que todos los tiene destinados para que su hijo finalice la carrera universitaria de Contaduría; En la actualidad  terminó de pagar el credikiva anterior y como su hijo ganó el semestre, pasó al séptimo, por eso ahora solicita un nuevo crédito por valor de $1.774.500 COP para pagarlo. Norbertina tiene un negocio de vender mercancia. Su primer crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo fue en el año 1994, por COP $ 110.000 , y desde entonces ha añadido 25 más préstamos individuales a su capital de trabajo. Continua con su meta de convertirse en una mayorista distribuidora y con su microempresa, quiere generar ingresos suficientes para mantener su hogar en las mejores condiciones posibles. Si usted desea conocer su historia este es su enlace en kiva:
http://partners.kiva.org/lend/169823
texts.en:
Norbertina H. H. has always been very enterprising. With great effort, her parents managed to provide her with a primary school education. She continued on to complete high school and start a career as an office technician. This experience taught her the importance of education and now she channels all of her efforts into providing a college education for her son. She is very happy with her previous loan from Kiva and says that it was used entirely for her son so that he can finish his university degree in accounting. Norbertina has already repaid this loan as her son competed the semester. Now that he is starting his seventh semester, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1,774,500 COP in order to pay for it.

Norbertina has a business selling merchandise. Her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo was issued in 1994 in the amount of 110,000 COP. Since then she has taken 25 more individual loans to use as operating capital. She continues with her goal of becoming a wholesale distributor and with her microenterprise, she wants to generate sufficient income to maintain her household and provide the best possible conditions. To learn more about Norbertina’s story, details can be found from her previous Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's seventh semester of university

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mr. San L. (in the photo), 25 and his wife, Mrs. Ratha Thaung, 24, have been married since 2009 and have a new baby. They live in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

San is a security guard and his wife sells groceries at home. He does not have his own transportation, so he must spend a lot of money for traveling. He is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married to Mr. Keino and they have been blessed with two children, aged 8 and 2.5 years old. She runs a business of selling fruits and vegetables like mangoes, bananas, oranges, tomatoes and onions. She has been in the business for six years and she says that it is able to meet all her needs.

Caroline is now applying for her second loan, which she plans to use to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to ensure continued supply to her esteemed customers, whom she says are satisfied with her services.

She plans to buy a plot in the future and develop buildings for renting so that she can earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: Verónica tiene 39 años, su actividad es la venta de frijoles y tortillas. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que fue por iniciativa propia que ella comenzó este medio de vida, por lo que ha sido muy difícil mantenerlo ya que ha tenido problemas de salud pues tiene 7 hijos es una mujer muy luchadora y responsable, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una buena Madre con sus hijos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como maíz, leña, cal y frijoles. Ella sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Verónica is 39 years old. She works selling beans and tortillas. She has been doing this work for more than 11 years and began this way of life on her own. However, it has been very difficult to maintain the business as she has already had health problems and she has 7 children. She is a woman who is a fighter and responsible and she has always shown that she is a good mother for her children. This loan is to buy primary products such as corn, wood, lime and beans. Her dream is that her business continues growing.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Tho T. D. is 26 years old with 2 small children. Before doing farming, she was a worker in a shoe factory.  Currently, she is growing rice, herbal vegetables and sweet potatoes. Tho sells these agricultural products to earn daily income. In addition she raises 300 ducks and sells their eggs.  Tho joined SEDA in 2004.  She has used loans very effectively to invest in her business. Tho is requesting a loan  of 5,450,000 VND to build a pen for her ducks and to buy feed for them.

loans.use: To build a pen for ducks and to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith B., age 57, harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have six children. They live in the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

In 2009, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment. Judith is requesting a new loan of 14,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Judith from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatimatou F. est une femme de 39 ans qui habite dans la localité de Baye Laye à Guediawaye. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Madame F. a choisi l’activité de commerce dans le but d’acquérir des revenus et d’aider son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales. Depuis  10 ans elle évoluait  dans la vente de friperie  dans un marché du quartier. Elle est même  parvenue à acquérir une cantine dans le marché et s’adonne a la vente de tissus. Elle est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis juillet 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour renforcer le stock de tissus dans sa cantine. Son souhait est de développer son activité de commerce et renforcer son épargne dans le but d’effectuer des voyages à l’extérieur pour l’intérêt  de son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Ms. Fatimatou F. is a 39-year-old woman who lives in the Baye Laye area in Guediawaye. She is married and has 5 children. Ms. F. chose to start a business in order to earn an income and help her husband provide for the family. For 10 years, she has developed a business selling second-hand clothing at a market in her locality. She has even managed to acquire a booth at the market and has devoted herself to selling fabric. She has been a member of the Baye Laye local fund since July 2003, and has already repaid 4 previous loans. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 Frs meant to increase the stock of fabric in her stall. Her hope is to develop her business and strengthen her savings with the goal of being able to travel more widely for the benefit of her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA D. LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Dominga; tiene 57 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. verduras, ella venD. todo tipo D. verduras como tomates, zanahorias, lechugas y cebollas, ella trabaja desD. las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado D. Urubamba, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio.  La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the “Reyna D. Los Angeles” (Queen of Angels) Community Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Dominga is a 57 year old widow, and she has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling vegetables.  She sells all types of vegetables like tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, and onions.  She works from six in the morning until five in the afternoon.  She has a small stand at the Urubamba market.  

She wants to improve her business.  She is requesting the loan to buy vegetables wholesale.

She is grateful for the requested loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Fatiya

texts.en: Fatiya N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She also takes care of her mother and father.  Fatiya operates a food stall.  She has been in this business for eight years, and she works seven days a week. Fatiya sells her products from home.  She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cassava, bananas, and sweet potatoes.  The main business challenges for Fatiya include transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to farmers directly.  Fatiya lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, cassava, bananas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel Ángel G. D. J. D. 64 años D. edad, vive junto a su compañera D. vida en Ciudad Arce en el departamento D. La Libertad. Miguel posee una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, el cual esta ubicado sobre calle principal, así mismo es la única tienda que se encuentra en los alrededores, por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela fija, la cual compra a diario. Esto es D. mucho beneficio para Miguel, ya que el negocio es bastante estable, es por esta razón que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos alimenticios como pan, café, pollo, huevos, ya que en la actualidad con lo que más cuenta es con golosinas y bebidas. Poder mejorar el negocio es D. mucha importancia para Miguel debido a que es la única fuente D. ingresos que posee, razón por la cual él desea mucho mejorarlo para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel G. D. J. is 64 years old.  He lives together with his life partner in Ciudad Arce, in La Libertad department.  Miguel owns a grocery store that sells essentials.  His store is located on a main street and is the only store in the surrounding area which means that he has a large number of regular customers who buy from him every day.  This is of great benefit to Miguel since his business is quite stable.  He is requesting a loan to buy food products such as bread, coffee, chicken and eggs since at the moment the only products he has are candy and drinks. Being able to improve his business is very important to Miguel because it is his only source of income.  This is why he would very much like to improve it, so that he can make more income.

loans.use: To buy food products and convenience store items

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the deparment of Cusco, Peru. She is 39 years old and has a common law husband and four children. Lucila has a convenience store in Poro near Oropesa, Peru selling products such as flour, bread, rice, sugar, soft drinks, fruits, and shampoo etc. She is requesting the loan to purchase more products to sell in her convenience store. She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her convenience store

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio C. is from the village of Quiling. He is 48 years old. Virgilio is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgilio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Virgilio has been engaged in his business for over 28 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virgilio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilio is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Virgilio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Carol

texts.es:
La señora Carol es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000, del Distrito de calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, está casada, tiene 36 años de edad y 3 hijos menores.
Carol se dedica a la venta de especería y lo hace en la puerta de su casa, porque esta por uno de los mercados más populosos de Pucallpa, su trabajo no le quita tanto tiempo porque sus hijas la ayudan, sobre todo ahora que están de vacaciones.
La señora Carol invertirá su préstamo de S/1,800.00 en la compra de mas especerías, como son: ½ caja de aceite de ajonjolí, 1/2 caja de tau sí, 1 paquete de canela china, 25 paquetes de fideos chino, 10 paquetes de wantan, 1 caja de aceite vegetal, 3 tiras de condimentos para asado.
La señora Carol de esa manera aporta dinero para su hogar y que es de gran ayuda para su esposo que trabaja como empleado público.
Manuela Ramos, mediante sus promotoras, ha sabido orientar a las socias de los diferentes bancos comunales, muchas de ellas lo han puesto en práctica y les está yendo bien su negocio
texts.en:
Mrs. Carol is a member of the "Mujeres del 2000" communal bank in the district of Calleria, in the department of Ucayali.  She is 36 years old, married and has three minor children.

Carol sells spices out of her home since she lives very near one of the busiest markets in Pucallpa.  She doesn't need to spend a lot of time at her job because her daughters help her out, especially now that they are on vacation.

Mrs. Carol plans to use the loan for 1,800 PEN to buy more spices such as a 1/2 case of sesame oil, a 1/2 case of Tau Si, a package of Chinese cinnamon, 25 packages of Chinese noodles, 10 packages of Wantan, a case of vegetal oil and 3 strips of condiments for roasts.

Mrs. Carol is able to earn an income with her business and is of great help to her husband who is a civil servant.  Manuela Ramos, through its promoters, has been able to guide many members of the different communal banks.  Many of them have put what they have learned into practice and their businesses are going well.

loans.use: To buy noodles, Chinese spices and sesame oil

loans.name: Geydi Janeth

texts.es:
Doña Geydi S. tiene 33 años de edad y se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de Donas y golosinas dentro de un centro educativo de la ciudad de Danlí llamado C.E.B “JOSE TRINIDAD REYES” donde se imparten clases en tres jornadas del día, pero ella solo vende en dos jornadas mañana y tarde y en la tercera jornada se dedica a preparar la venta para el día siguiente, nos comentos que en la jornada nocturna las ventas son bien bajas.
Geydi cuenta con 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es la dueña de la caseta de dicho centro de estudio.
Doña Geydi es madre soltera, tiene 2 niñas, hace más de un año que se separo de su compañero de hogar y es ella la que se ha hecho cargo del hogar y a la crianza de sus dos hijas, las cuales están cursando sus estudios primarios.
La Sra. S. es una mujer de admirar ya que a pesar de su fracaso matrimonial, no le a quitado el deseo de superación y ahora lo hace con mas fuerza por que dice que tiene que sacar adelante sus dos hijas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las donas y de las golosinas.
texts.en:
Geydi S. is 33 years old and her main business activity is selling donuts and sweet treats in an educational center in the city of Danlí called C.E.B. "José Trinidad Reyes".  Classes take place there in three shifts a day but Geydi only sells during two shifts: morning and afternoon.  During the third shift she prepares her sales for the following day.  She tells us that sales are very low during the evening shift.

Geydi has been in this type of business for 4 years and she owns her stand in the educational center.  Geydi is a single mother.  She has two daughters and separated from her partner more than a year ago.  She is now in charge of the household and the raising of her two daughters who are in elementary school.

Mrs S. is a very admirable woman since, in spite of the breakup of her marriage, she hasn't abandoned her desire to improve herself and now she works with even more effort because she says that she has to get her daughters ahead in life.  She will use her loan to buy materials for making her donuts and sweet treats.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter, margarine, oil, eggs, baking soda, sugar, vanilla, meat, tortillas, chicken, potatoes, cassavea, bananas, beans, rice, soft drinks, juice, soft cheese and cheese

loans.name: Alianza De La Cascada Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal   ”ALIANZA DE LA CASCADA”, está iniciando su sexto ciclo en el Centro Focal Cascada.  Esta asociación comunal cuenta con la participación de diez  integrantes.  La  mesa directiva tiene como presidenta a la señora María Magdalena, como tesorera a la señora Agustina, y como secretaria de actas a la señora Sofía.   Los negocios de las señoras son diferentes, entre ellos tenemos comercio, producción y servicio.
La presidenta, la señora María Magdalena es una mujer de 48 años de edad, casada y madre de cinco hijos.   La señora María Magdalena tiene  mucha experiencia en el trabajo con asociaciones comunales, antes de formar parte de la asociación comunal  “Alianza de la Cascada”, fue parte de otras asociaciones comunales en Pro Mujer, su primera experiencia fue en 1993. Con relación al negocio que realiza, comentó que desde hace veinte años elabora el tejido artesanal de mantas, su hermana le enseñó a realizar este trabajo.   Con el monto de crédito solicitado piensa comprar lana de vicuña y alpaca, materia prima para la elaboración de las mantas. La lana de vicuña y alpaca, puede ser adquirida en la Feria 16 de Julio en la Ciudad de El Alto.  La venta de las mantas producidas es realizada en esta feria también, los días jueves y domingo de siete de la mañana hasta las doce y media del medio día, cuando es necesario sus hijos le ayudan en la venta de las mantas.  
Cuando le consultamos a la señora María Magdalena qué es lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde compartir con las compañeras, el “ahorro” y la “capacitación” porque aprendemos.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Alianza de La Cascada” is starting its sixth loan cycle as part of the Cascada Community Center. This group consists of ten members. Its Board of Directors consists of the following members: Sra. María Magdalena – President, Sra. Augustina – Treasurer, and Sra. Sofía – Sectretary of Records. These women have businesses in different sectors such as trade, manufacturing, and services.

The president, Sra. María Magdalena, is a 48 year old woman. She is married and the mother of five children. Sra. María Magdalena has plenty of experience working with groups prior to joining “Alianza de La Cascada” since she was a member of other Communal Associations with Pro Mujer. Her first experience occurred in 1993. With regard to her business, María Magdalena says that she has been producing woven blankets for twenty years. Her sister taught her this trade. The amount of her loan request will be used to buy vicuña and alpaca wool, the material she uses to make blankets. She acquires the vicuña and alpaca wool at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto. Her finished blankets are also sold at the fair on Thursdays and Sundays between 7am and 12:30pm. When necessary, her children help with selling blankets.

When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, Sra. María Magdalena indicated that she likes sharing with the other group members, the savings account, and the training classes because she is able to learn.

loans.use: To purchase vicuña and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Yuri Jofre

texts.es:
Yuri de 42 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene muchas aspiraciones de seguir ganando dinero por su familia. Desde muy joven él comenzó a trabajar como taxista. 

En la actualidad el trabaja desde muy temprano haciendo carreras a diferentes lugares de Guayaquil. La tarifa que la cobra para las carreras es según sea el kilometraje que gaste es un promedio de $ 1.00 hasta $ 10.00. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su taxi por eso quiere seguir trabajando, por ahora quiere compran con el préstamo llantas, tijeras, y herramientas para su taxi.
texts.en:
Yuri, age 42, is a hardworking gentleman who has many aspirations to continue earning money for his family. He started working as a taxi driver at a very young age.

Yuri currently starts his work very early, making the routes through different areas of Guayaquil. The fare he charges is based on the number of kilometers traveled, with the average fare ranging from $1.00 to $10.00. He has many plans for his taxi because he wants to continue working. Yuri will now use this loan to buy tires, a scissor jack, and tools for his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase tires, a scissor jack, and tools for his taxi.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS AMISTOSAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veronica; ella tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de jugos en la plaza de armas del distrito de Urcos y también estudia en la universidad en el área de ciencias de salud, la socia quiere prepararse para seguir aprendiendo en la universidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad y tambien para pagar los estudios de su hermana.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Verónica, 19, is a member of the “LAS AMISTOSAS” (The Friendly Ones) communal bank that’s located in Urcos District which belongs to Quispicanchis Province, Cusco Department.

She is single and alternates her daily chores with the sale of juices in the main town square in Urcos.  She’s also going to the university majoring in Health Sciences.  She wants to prepare herself to continue learning at the university.  She is asking for the loan to pay for university fees and to pay for her sister's studies as well. She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and her sister's tuition

loans.name: Corona

texts.en:
Corona C. lives in the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old, married and has two grown children. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells canned goods, snacks, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for more than four years and earns about 12,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Corona joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one to expand her business by buying additional items to sell to her customers. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Segondalina

texts.en:
Segondalina L., from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City, is 50 years old, widowed and has three grown children. To make a living, Segondalina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, breads and beverages in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Segondalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more canned goods, snack foods and beverages, she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra en su 2º ciclo. Es un grupo excelente, se caracteriza por su humildad y su responsabilidad en cuanto al comportamiento en el pago y solidaridad con las vecinas. Todas las señoras son madres de familias que ayudan a su pareja en la manutención del hogar.
Liduvina es una mujer que desea progresar y por ello ha optado dedicarse a la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, incluyendo remeras, camisas, pantalones, polleras, vestidos, etc. razón de la solicitud del crédito, para comenzar este emprendimiento que le permita hacer frente  a los grandes desafíos de la vida actual.
texts.en:
This group is in it's 2º phase, and its members are humble and responsible in terms of repaying credit.  All of this group's members are in solidarity as mothers of families whose earnings help sustain their households.
Liduvina has chosen clothing sales as her business, and she sells a variety of women's, children's and men's clothing (pants, shirts, suits, etc.)  Obtaining this credit will help her build a wholesale inventory for re-sale and attain better earnings to confront life's challenges.

loans.use: to buy inventory of women's, children's and men's clothing (pants, shirts, suits, etc.)

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcosa; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y venta de papa, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa y venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar papa e insumos para preparar la chicha.                                          
                           
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcosa belongs to the Munay Tika Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Marcosa, age 44, is married and has six children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling “chicha” (a corn based drink) and selling potatoes.  She sells in an itinerant manner from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  It is through these small businesses that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand the business of selling potatoes and selling chicha.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy potatoes in order to make "chicha" (a corn based drink).

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen, age 32, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He sells coconuts, palm sugar, and palm juice, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by his wife who sells chickens, earning an income of $1 per day. 

Sen is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to transport coconuts to resell. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport coconuts.

loans.name: Ganyana Womens Group

texts.en:
43-year-old Aisha is married and a mother to six kids. Her business day involves keeping and selling poultry. She has been in this business for five years now and she operates from Kampala. This business is becoming one of the most lucrative businesses, especially in many urban areas in Uganda. The consumption rate of chicken in Ugandan urban areas is rising every day. It’s for that reason that people like Aisha are doing excellent business. 

Aisha says she took over this business from her deceased parents. Weekly she makes sales profits amounting to Ugandan shillings 70,000. She anticipates her business's prospects to get better with the passage of time and with the acquisition of this loan. She says she will use this Kiva loan money to purchase more poultry to resell to her increasing clientele, principally small restaurant owners and bar owners.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to resell.

loans.name: Bropo

texts.en: Brorpo, 43 year old, is a farmer with her husband. Their income is $2 per day. She has five children. Four of the children are studying and one is working in a factory with  an income of $5 per day. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $25 on school fee, $20 on transportation, $10 on rent and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy cows to feeding and breed to produce calves to sell so that she can gain more income for her family. She plans to have a farm to feed chickens and pigs if she is able to save enough money to start. She expects to send all of her children to study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy cows to breed

loans.name: Hermie

texts.en:
Hermie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 

Hermie has a retail shop that sells home-made sausage or "chorizzo". She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for home-made sausages.

Hermie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hermie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for home-made sausage.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has one child and has earned a living for the last five years by running a retail shop where she sells snacks, noodles and canned goods. She is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more of these items to sell to her customers. Evan is a new member of HSPFI, but is very committed to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gege

texts.en:
Gege, a married father of three boys and a girl, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over 10 years, Gege has operated a natural medicine business, selling from home to his neighbours. He faces the major business challenge of competition, and dreams of expanding in the future.

Having joined Yehu to access business loans, Gege wants to start a poultry enterprise with a loan of Kshs 15,000 to purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: to start a poultry business by purchasing chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
Jose, tiene treinta y nueve años de edad, es casado y con dos  hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
José acude a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo para el mejoramiento de  su vivienda, por lo  que este préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción como es: arena, zinc, bloque y cemento, para la construcción de cuarto de habitación para uno de sus hijos. 
Todo esto es para que el joven pueda desarrollarse mejor.
texts.en: José, 39, is married and has two school age children.  José calls upon Ceprodel’s office to request a home improvement loan.  The loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies like: sand, zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks and cement to build a bedroom for one of his children.  All of this is so that the young man can develop better.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, 44, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo who is a driver, and mother to her three children, two are still at home while the eldest is already studying. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  
 
Erlinda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons (for other meals) when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Aside from this she also sells fruits in her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operationing her business she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda hopes her business grows and finds a place in the local market, and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food stall

loans.name: Nenesa

texts.en:
Nenesa is a 40-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has a business seling fish in the town of Dar es Salam, Yei county in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Nenesa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more fish for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en: Dexter,  26 years old and engaged in a hog-fattening business, is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy two more hogs and feed. He hopes to eventually earn enough income to build his own beauty parlour. In order to reach his dream, Dexter is working hard to care for his hogs, and hopes to steadily expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to buy two more hogs and feed.

loans.name: Mikoadomé

texts.fr:
Mikoadomé est  un homme âgé  de 45 ans. Il est marié å un/e coiffeuse avec 06 enfants en charge.
Mikoadomé travaille comme plombier et vend en même temps des matériaux de construction. depuis 2010. Une personne l’aide dans l’exercice de son activité. Il achète les produits chez les grossistes à Lomé et revend dans une boutique.
Mikoadomé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des tuyaux, 01 tonne de ciment.
texts.en: Mikoadomé is a 45-year old man. He is married to a hair dresser and has six children in his care.   Mikoadomé works as a plumber and also sells construction materials, since 2010. One additional person helps him in his business. He buys his supplies from wholesalers in Lomé and resells them in a store. Mikoadomé has requested his first loan from WAGES in order to buy some pipes and one ton [about 2200 lbs] of concrete.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok is a 65-year-old farmer who has four children. He has been farming for over 30 years. Sok has been with VisionFund since 2008. He leads a group of 2 members. He completely paid his loans to VisionFund and now is applying for a third loan to cultivate a rice paddy. Sok hopes that this loan will enable him to improve his crop yields, earn more income to feed his family and set aside some savings. Most importantly, he hopes that he can keep his children in school.

loans.use: To cultivate a rice paddy.

loans.name: Mariuska  Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Mariuska Marina; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de manualidades, ella hace manualidades y luego lo vende en forma independiente y también tiene un trabajo como docente en la universidad, por medio de este negocio y trabajo la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de manualidades. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos y lanas para hacer las manualidades.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Señor de Tete Caca communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member, Mariuska Marina, is 29 years old and married with one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling handicrafts.  She makes crafts and later sells them independently.  She also has a job teaching in the university.  By means of this business and job Mariuska Marina gets her child ahead.  She wants to expand and improve her handicraft business.

She is requesting the loan to buy materials such as thread and wool to make the handicrafts.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread and wool to make handicrafts.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.en:
Ruperta is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Ruperta has a shop that sells electronic loads (prepaid phone cards) of several networks like GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy stocks of electronic loads. Ruperta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Ruperta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of electronic loads (prepaid phone cards)

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es: Oswaldo.de 32 años de edad,el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años el nos cuenta que es una actividad que le a gustado mucho porque le gusta la agricultura,el esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono para su cultivo,ya que nececita comprar para abonar su siembra para que cresca sin plagas,y asi poco poco aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en: Oswaldo is 32 and has been a farmer for four years, he mentions this is an activity he really enjoys because he likes agriculture, he requests this loan to buy fertilizer for his crop so it can grow without infections and this way have higher sales.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Dalina

texts.ru: Далина жительница района Джиликул. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Далина занимается шитьем. Она шьет национальные платья, скатерти и пастельное белье. Этим видом деятельности она занимается три года. Кредит берет для покупки разноцветных ниток и иголок.
texts.en: Dalina is a resident of the Djilikul district. She is 21 years old. She is not married. Danila is engaged in sewing. She sews national clothing, tablecloths, and ben linen. She has been engaged in this kind of activity for three years. She is taking a loan to buy needles and multicolored yarns.

loans.use: To purchase needles and multicolored yarns

loans.name: Mayra Elena

texts.es: Mayra Elena es una emprendedora que ha salido adelante, ella  tiene 44 años de edad y su actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Uno de los sueños que ha tenido Mayra es de tener su propio negocio lo cual hoy en día se encuentra muy orgullosa porque lo pudo cumplir y además de poder generar ingresos para su familia. Mayra está solicitando crédito a Fundación León 2000, para poder invertir en su negocio en mercadería para comprar ropa para dama y caballero, ropa de niño, sandalias entre otro productos que sus clientes le están solicitando y darle un buen servicio ofreciéndole variedad de mercadería.
texts.en:
Mayra Elena is an entrepreneur who has gotten ahead.  She is 44, and she sells general merchandise.  One of Mayra’s dreams is to have her own business and now she is very proud because she was able to do it, as well as generating income for her family.
Mayra is requesting a loan from Foundation Leon 2000 for her business to buy women’s and men’s clothing, children’s clothing, sandals and other products for her customers.  They are requesting these items and she also wants to give good service by offering them a variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothing, children's clothing, sandals and other items

loans.name: Musharam

texts.ru: Мушарам замужем имеет троих детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина и не боится трудностей. Занимается откормом скота. В данном бизнесе помогают все члены семьи. На полученную прибыль от бизнеса она благоустроила дом. В настоящее время хочет получить займ в размере 1000 сомони для приобретения несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота. Она знает, что добрые люди не оставят ее и протянут руку помощи. Она заранее благодарит всех, кто ее поддержит. Спасибо
texts.en: Musharam is married and has three children.  She is a hardworking woman and is not afraid of hardships.  She is involved in fattening up livestock.  All of the family members help with this business.  Musharam used profits from this business to make improvements to her home.  Currently, she wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 1000 somoni to purchase several heads of small livestock.  She knows that kind people would not abandon her and would extend a helping hand.  Musharam is grateful in advance to all, who will support her.  Thank you.

loans.use: to buy small livestock

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en: Rosela is married and has 8 children. She is 56 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Rosela has owned a sari-sari (variety) store for 5 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 5,000 from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more stock for her store. Rosela has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Sainte Abondancia Group

texts.fr: SAINTE ABONDANCIA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même église. La représentante du groupe, Eugenie Bayi (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un certain Galbert. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Eugenie Bayi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis plus de huit ans, Eugenie Bayi vend des bijoux et des colliers en perles par le système de distribution. Eugenie Bayi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Eugenie Bayi et les autres membres du groupe SAINTE ABONDANCIA sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.

loans.use: Acheter des perles.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mariette Olga est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mariette Olga est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Louis. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mariette Olga vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Mariette Olga vend depuis dix ans des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Mariette Olga s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mariette Olga ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicite un troisième crédit. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Yich's Group

texts.en:
Yich, 33, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Sangkae district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last 10 years, Yich has been farming rice, fishing and rasing pigs. She is able to earn about 40,000KHR per day. 

Yich has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she completely repaid the loan. She has used the past loan wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Yich is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to grow her rice fruitfully so as to improve her living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
L. Mary is an active member of Life in Africa. She works as a bracelet maker in the Invisible Children Bracelet Project. Here she earns enough to support herself and her children.

She is Acholi and was born in Northern Uganda. Eight years ago she was forced to flee the brutal war in the north and since then she has been living in the camp known as the Acholi quarters in Kampala. Here she lives in a small rented house. However, she has acquired a plot of land which was donated by the King of Buganda because of his sympathies for the Acholi. She now wishes to apply for a loan in order to build a two roomed house for her family. Growing up during 20 years of war and living eight years in a camp have made having a permanent safe home a priority. For this she is asking for 600,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Poles for the wall 120 @ 2000/ = 240000shs

Iron sheets 12 @ 10000 = 120000shs

Roofing timbers 15 @ 5000 = 75000shs

Nails 10kgs @ 2000 = 20000shs

Labor = 120000shs

Total = 575000shs

Mary's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by her peers at the Life in Africa WE Center community in Kampala. She has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest on her loan to support Life in Africa's Talent Discovery team. For more about Mary, her life and her worldview, visit http://lifeinafrica.com/4/lalammary

loans.use: Building Family House

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy works in the production and sale of fertilizers and insecticides. Jimmy started his business learning in a friend’s laboratory. In the beginning he only produced the product and sold it door to door. Now he offers his products to pharmacies and to pest control for businesses.

Jimmy aspires to have his own laboratory and give work to whoever may need it. He would use the loan to buy fertilizers at wholesale prices. He has faith that with these products his sales will increase.

Jimmy is married. He has 4 children, all of whom are currently in school. He is 39 years old. Through his business he supports himself and his family. His dream is to build his own house and improve his children’s quality of life and grow and thrive in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jimmy se dedica a la elaboración y venta de fertilizantes e insecticidas. Jimmy empezó su negocio aprendiendo en un laboratorio de un amigo. Al principio el solo elaboraba el producto y lo vendía puerta a puerta. Ahora ofrece estos productos a farmacias, y a la fumigación de empresas. Jimmy aspira tener su propio laboratorio y dar trabajo a quienes lo necesiten. El usara el préstamo para invertir comprando fertilizantes a precios de mayorista. El tiene la fe que con estos productos su negocio se incrementara. Jimmy esta casado, tiene cuatro hijos todos estudian. El tiene 39 años. El por medio de su negocio apoya a su a su familia. Y su deseo es construir su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y crecer y mantenerse en el negocio.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer from a wholesale distributor

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en: Habibullah was born in 1972 and lives in a  household of 2 in district 8 of Kabul. He sells parts of cars and motor bikes also, but his main business is painting and designing cars. He is happy with his job and thanks to the MFI that support him to he has been able to increase his business and buy lots of materials for his shop. He believes that by being a good client he can continue to have these kinds of chances in the future.

loans.use: Buying parts of car and paint

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: wholesale purchase and retailing of clothes

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo has been working as a seafood and fish vendor for over thirty years. After working at a fish-packing factory when he was younger, he decided to deal directly with clients and start his own business. For most of his life, he has also worked in construction and as a handyman, using the income from his jobs to finance his business.

This is now Pablo’s second loan from Kiva and Mifex. He uses the loan capital to invest in different types of seafood, although his primary product is shrimp. The capital allows Pablo to concentrate on his business more and not have to depend on the jobs he gets as a handyman.

Pablo has five children who are already grown up. He lives with his aging mother and cares for her. They hope to be able to fix up their house with the extra profits they make.

loans.use: Invest in different types of seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a shop window and a tent

loans.name: Majida

texts.en: Majida is a 56 years old woman living in south Lebanon, in Saida. She has one child and owns a grocery shop. This is the 7th time Majida is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. Majida is a very good client and has a solid history with A. Majmoua. Majida had recently suffered the loss of her husband and is therefore trying the best she can to continue providing for her family with the help of her son.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery shop

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. R.' business consists of preparing food of all sorts, including breakfasts and lunches which are popular among her customers. She started selling in a corner of the central market, on a bench with some pots where she carried her food. Now she sells in the southwestern corner of the market in a location that gets her a lot of attention from customers.

Maria R. has had this business for 34 years, and she started with an initial capital investment of C$ 1.500.00 thanks to a loan she got.

Ceprodel has been supporting her for 3 years now, giving her 25 loans which have increased her business, improved her locale with tables and chairs for her customers as well as more space for them.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la señora Rodríguez es elaborar comida de todo tipo todos los días desde desayunos y almuerzos, en donde logra acaparar la atención de los clientes. Comenzó vendiendo en la esquina del mercado central en una banca y unas panas en las que traía su comida, ahora vende en la esquina sur-oeste del mercado central en lugar vistoso y llamativo para su clientela.

Maria Rodríguez tiene 34 años de tener este negocio y dio inicio con un capital inicial de C$ 1.500.00 gracias a un préstamo que realizo.

Ceprodel apoyándola desde hace 3 años le ha concedido 25 créditos que han incrementado su negocio, ha mejorado su lugar de trabajo con mesas y sillas para los clientes y a la vez tiene mayor espacioso físico para los clientes.

loans.use: Buying ingredients to prepare food (Compra de ingredientes para la comida)

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana S. is 59 year old and the proud mother of three children. She has sacrificed much to make sure that all of her children attended school. With a great role model for a mother, all of her children have grown, graduated college, and now have professions and families of their own. Today, she lives with her husband in a house of their own in the city of Encarnación. Both she and her husband worked hard their entire lives to save and buy a piece of land and house of their own. Sadly her husband is now unable to walk and is restricted to a wheelchair. Ana has become the sole supporter of her family and has to make enough money to buy her husband’s medicine.

For many years Ana has been the owner of small dressmaking store where she makes dresses and other types of clothes for people of all ages. This has been her contribution to the income; however, today it is the only source of income. After many years in business she has formed a dedicated clientele who place orders with her for special events, or who come in on a daily basis to fix clothing.

Ana is asking for a loan in order to buy more cloth for requests that she receives. Recently there has been an increase in clientele and she does not have the necessary amounts of fabric and goods to meet the demand. She will use the loan towards buying more cloth, however, with any additional funds that is not used for cloth she hopes to use to repair and upkeep her machinery.

loans.use: To buy various cloth and to maintain her sewing machinery.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
José has 20 years of experience in producing pineapple and pitahaya (a yellow-skinned fruit) in his community, which has a favorable climate and where the cultivation of these fruits is an established tradition. He works the fields with the support of their 4 children, who are also dedicated to the production. This family has been perfecting and modernizing their production processes. The maintenance of the land has a high cost, due to the attention that must be given to the plants in each phase of the productive process: manually weeding, using organic fertilizer and natural supplements for the control of diseases. These give better yields to their crops, since they prevent the soil from deteriorating so much, provide better conditions for cultivation at planting time and improve the quality of the crop, increasing its value since organic products currently obtain better prices in the market. José requests a loan for the purchase of supplies for his work, since the planting season is from May to July.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don José tiene 20 años de experiencia en producir piña y pitahaya en su comunidad, ésta presenta un clima favorable, en el que los cultivos se producen de manera asentada. El señor trabaja en las manzanas de tierra junto con el apoyo de sus 4 hijos, quienes también se dedican a trabajar en la producción.

Esta familia se han perfeccionado en todo el proceso productivo así como también se han ido tecnificando en la actividad, el mantenimiento de las tierras tiene un alto costo, debidos a los productos que necesitan en cada etapa del proceso productivo como son el deshierbe manual o control natural de plagas y el uso de abonos orgánicos, el cual les brinda mejores rendimientos en su cultivo, ya que contribuye a que el suelo no se deteriore tanto, brindando mejores condiciones al cultivo en siembra y una cosecha de mayor calidad, con valor agregado por ser un producto orgánico que en la actualidad obtienen mejores precios en el mercado. El señor solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos de trabajo, ya que la época de cosecha esta entre mayo a julio.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and natural supplements to improve the yield and quality of his crop

loans.name: Warno

texts.id:
Warno is a used goods collector who look for used goods, collects them to be resold to used goods depot (mainly for recycle purpose). He has a 1.5 year old daughter. He usually walks for 2 km per day to collect the used goods, mainly the ones made of plastic, aluminum, iron and glasses such as bottles.

He can earn up to IDR 800 thousand per month (around USD 100/ month) from this work which he uses to pay his rent, to pay for his daily needs and even to be saved for some amount for future necessities.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Warno adalah seorang pemulung, yang setiapharinya mengumpulkan barang-barang bekas yang kemudian dijual kepada pengepul barang bekas. Warno mempunyai seorang anak perempuan yang masih kecil dengan usia 1,5 tahun. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya Warno harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2 kilometer guna mendapatkan barang-barang bekas tersebut. Barang-barang yang dikumpulkannya berupa barang-barang yang terbuat dari bahan plastic, aluminium, besi, dan kaca seperti botol minuman. Dari usaha yang dilakukannya Warno mampu mengumpulkan keuntungan sekitar 800.000 rupiah/minggunya dan hasil tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiaphari, membayar kontrakan, dan sebagian lagi di tabung untuk keperluan dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use: To purchase more used goods (Menambah modal untuk membeli barang bekas)

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga lives in the province of El Seibo, in the community of Colinas Don Guillermo.  She is a hard-working woman, puts a lot of effort into her business, and has an entrepreneurial spirit.  She has now become quite the businesswoman!   She started out by selling accessories for women, such as hair pieces and beauty supplies.  She developed her business to the point that she now owns a boutique where she sells clothes, shoes, beauty accessories, and home accessories! 

She requests a loan of 15,000 pesos (450 USD) to continue investing in her business, expanding it, and moving forward.  She says that her goal is to continue developing a sustainable business, generate the necessary income to repay her loan, and satisfy the needs of her clients. 

We wish Olga the best of luck, and thank you all for supporting her!

loans.use: To buy high-quality clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly S. is a rice farmer in Kampong Cham province. She has been working the same land since 1980 and knows her homeland well. She is very smart when it comes to her time and the seasons; during the rainy season she keeps tools for fishing to supplement her income. Between fishing and farming she earns about $4.50 per day. Her husband farms even while she is fishing and earns an additional two dollars per day.

They have six children (a normal amount for a farming family) and one is married. Two of the older children help support the family working in a garment factory. They each make $40 per month.

Ly S. wants to develop both her farm and fishing businesses. She will apply her loan towards buying a small wooden boat with a small outboard motor. She will also buy gas for the boat and good fertilizer for her fields.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat, fertilizer and gas.

loans.name: Port

texts.en: Mrs. Port S. is a Khmer noodle (Num Banh Chok) vendor in the Ang Ruon Market where she earns an average of $4 per day. She is a widow and lives with her two children in the Ang Ruon Village, Siem Reap Province. Her business is stable, but she wishes to expand in order to better care for her family. She requests a loan of $700 to purchase a store from which to sell her noodles. (The picture is of one of S.'s daughters.)

loans.use: To purchase a store from which to sell her noodles

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.en:
Martha is a forty-four year old married mother with four children. Martha has a convenience store located in her home where she works with the help of her children from 6:00 AM in the morning until 10 PM at night; selling groceries, vegetables, stove gas, firewood, drinks, and meat. She also prepares lollipops in her store.

Martha is a member of the Suni Village Bank. (Suni means “Secure” in Quechua).

Martha needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($725 US dollars) to invest in more sugar, rice, oil, potatoes, noodles, and firewood.

Martha´s dream is to improve her business, further stock her store, and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in more sugar, rice, oil, potatoes, noodles, and firewood.

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Kadiatou C. est âgée de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 1 enfant. Elle vit dans le 3ème quartier de Ségou (quatrième région économique de la république du Mali) avec son mari et son enfant.
Dès son jeune âge elle s’essaya à plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus sans succès .Elle finit par approcher et apprendre auprès de sa grand-mère (qui est une spécialiste réputée d’une science traditionnelle à savoir la fabrication de Gongonlili et d’encense qui sont des produits aphrodisiaques traditionnels). Après sa phase d’apprentissage, depuis maintenant 15 ans, elle exerce cette activité (relevant des connaissances sécrètes). Madame Kadiatou C. jouit aujourd’hui d’une notoriété d’envergure sous régionale. Elle reçoit des commandes de toute la sous région de l’Afrique de l’ouest (Mali, Burkina et Cote d’Ivoire). Pour avoir ces produits aphrodisiaques, il faut amener une nouvelle calebasse qu’on remplit d’eau propre et qui sera versée sur le gongonlili (plante exotique très prisée en Afrique de l’ouest pour avoir des vertus aphrodisiaques et médicales). Elle donnera à ce gongonlili totalement imbibé une forme circulaire ou ovale après l’avoir attaché d’un fil blanc.). Cette plante est soit bouillie dans de l’eau chaude et la décoction en liquide est consommée. 

Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt : 50 sacs de gongonlili, 20 kg d’encense, 2 cartons de parfums, 2 rouleaux de fil local et des bouteilles vides de mayonnaise. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières essentiellement à partir de Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et San (région de Ségou). Très connue pour détenir cette science, elle réalise d’énormes ventes au comptant souvent en gros à une clientèle variée. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice de 200 000 FCFA et rêve ardemment de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kadiatou C. is 47 years old, is married and a mother of one child. She lives in the 3rd district of Ségou (fourth economic region of the Republic of Mali) with her husband and child. At a young age. she tried herself out at several businesses but without success. She ended up approaching and learning from her grandmother (who is a famous traditional science specialist) to learn the production of Gongonlili and incense, traditional aphrodisiac products. After completing her training, she continued to work in this area concerning secret knowledge. Today, Mrs. Kadiatou C. enjoys a great reputation in her region. She receives orders from all areas of West Africa (Mali, Burkina and Ivory Coast). To produce these aphrodisiac products, a new water bottle needs to be filled with clean water that is poured on the gongonlili (exotic plant in West Africa believed to have aphrodisiac and medical properties). She then shapes the completely soaked gongonlili into a circular or oval form after having attached it to a white wire. This plant is then boiled in hot water and the liquid concoction is then consumed. She decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution 3 years ago in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientele. After 4 group loans, this is her second individual loan, with all preceding loans refunded in full. With this loan, she intends to buy: 50 bags of gongonlili, 20 kg of incense, 2 boxes of perfume, 2 rolls of local wire and empty mayonnaise jars. She gets her raw materials primarily from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) and San (Ségou region). Very well known in this science, she generates enormous cash sales, often in wholesale, with various customers. She hopes to generate a profit of 200.000 FCFA and passionately dreams of building a house.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials to produce aphrodisiac products

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mr. Chan C. and his wife, Mrs. Sochiet Long, live in a small village along National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2003 and have one son and one daughter. 

Mr. Chan has been a construction worker for five years, while his wife stays at home to take care of their small children. She was a garment factory worker for many years. Chan lacks the money to build part of his house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US $200 to build a staircase for his house.

loans.use: To build a staircase for his house.

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es: LA SEÑORA AMALIA CECILIA  ES LA REPRESENTANTE D. ESTE BANCO EN EL CUAL NO EXISTEN PARENTESCOS FAMILIARES ENTRE LAS SOCIAS, LA GRAN MAYORIA D. LAS SOCIAS SE DEDICAN A SER PROMOTORAS D. COSMÉTICOS, OTRAS A LA VENTA D. COMIDA , Y POR ÚLTIMO A LA VENTA D. ZAPATOS Y ROPA ,PRECISAMENTE EL FIN D. ESTE FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA HACER CRECER LOS DIFERENTES NEGOCIOS Y AUMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO YA QUE LA COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO LES EXIGE MAS CADA DIA..
texts.en:
Señora Amalia Cecilia is the representative from this bank. There are no family relationships among the members. The majority of the members sell cosmetics, others sell food, and some have recently started selling shoes and clothes. The loan will allow the women to expand their different businesses and increase their working capital as competition in the marketplace demands more from them each passing day.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Tuoi Thi

texts.vi: Chị Phạm Thị Tươi năm nay 38 tuổi.Gia đình chị  hiện có nghề làm đậu phụ bán. Trước đây do nguồn vốn gia đình còn hạn chế  nên anh chị mỗi ngày chỉ làm 5 kg đậu bán cho thu nhập 400.000đên 600.000đồng/ tháng.Đến nay  sau gần  tham gia vào Quỹ được vay vốn gia đình anh chị mạnh dạn đầu tư làm nhiều hơn  mỗi ngày làm 10kg đến 15 kg đậu và nuôi từ 10 đến 20 con  lợn cho thu nhập ổn định 2, 1 triệu đồng/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới gia đình chị Tươi mong muốn được vay 9 triệu về mua 800kg đậu tương làm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho việc sản xuất đậu phụ
texts.en:
Mrs. Tuoi Thi P. is a 38 years old woman. Her family makes their living on tofu. Before, they did not have enough money, so every day, the couple could only make 5 kilogram of tofu to sell, making from 400,000 to 600,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. After joining the TYM fund, they started borrowing money and tried to expand the production, producing from 10 to 15 kilograms of tofu every day and raising from 10 to 20 pigs. Their income now reaches about 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. Mrs. P. plans to make the next loan of 9,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy 800 kilograms of tofu supply.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Tuwisana Group

texts.en:
Celestin delivers and sells plastic bags and wrapping papers for food items. He began his business in 1989 after the company where he used to work closed due to political and economic instability. He now goes to different areas of the city on a regular basis to deliver goods to his clients. Celestin sells his products at a good price. By providing good customer service, Celestin has permanent customers to keep up his business.

Celestin’s business has been successful in delivering and selling wrapping papers and plastic bags. He is planning to rent a larger place in order to sell wrapping papers and plastic bags in bulk. Many people like Celestin because he keeps good relations with them and provides for their needs on time. He has been a member of Tuwisana, one of HOPE’s loan groups, since last May.

Celestin is 58 years old. He is married and has eight children. His business is located in Ngaliema, in the Western mountainous area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To rent a larger place in order to sell wrapping papers and plastic bags in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is a 36 year old trader. She is a single mother with two children, who are both currently in school. She is a very resourceful single mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family.

Grace supports her kids by selling used clothing, which has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new cloths are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has being in this business for the past eight years. Selling used clothing has created a market for many women.

She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bed sheets and used towels sales. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade.
