Her records can be identified in group called Adehye, meaning Royals. She is very much convinced that your help would enable make her dream come through.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is the 35-year-old widowed mother of two girls and three sons; one of her children has completed senior high school while the others are currently in junior high and elementary school. She and the children reside in a rented apartment in Offinso, a farming and commercial community in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Theresa works very hard to provide for her children, selling fresh yams in the local market square as well as to local food vendors. The sole support for her family, Theresa has been in business for six years, and sometimes treks to Kumasi to sell fruits. She is now requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of yams in order to expand her customer base. It is her heart’s desire to sponsor her five children in the pursuit of university education.

loans.use: To buy yams to sell.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon has a minivan and provides transportation services. His usual itinerary is the Isfara-Khujand-Isfara route. He has been in this business for 5 years. Initially he rented the car, but after saving his money, he bought his own minivan with the support of his father. The business is stable and generates the main  income for Abdumanon’s family. Currently his minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of $ 500 USD. Abdumanon thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts  to repair his minivan.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana A. D. Diaza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amistad y Paz”, vive en el Jr. 28 D. Julio, Distrito D. Juanjui, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 10 hijos, 04 D. ellos ya fallecidos y el resto todos independientes. 

Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00, motivada por uno D. sus hijos  emprendió su  negocio propio. 

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, en su bodega ubicada en su misma casa. 

Con el préstamo D. S/1,300.00 que pagará en un  plazo D. 06  meses, lo invertirá, comprando más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en sacos , papel higiénico en paquete, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas, insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, productos variados para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Ella, toma las decisiones en las ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que es más sociable, más segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. 
 
Juana, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana A. D. Diaza is a member of the “Amistad y Paz” (Friendship and Peace) Microfinance Institute. She lives in the Juanjui district of the department of San Martín. She is a 69-year-old widow with 10 children, 4 of whom have passed away while the others are independent.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, which she obtained after much encouragement from one of her children, she started her own business.

She currently sells goods in her general store, which is located within her own home.

With this 1,300.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase more products to re-stock her shop, such as sacks of rice and sugar, packages of bathroom tissue, crates of milk and canned fish, household cleaning products, and various other goods in order to keep her customers satisfied.

She is the decision-maker in her business. She personally feels that she is more sociable, more confident, and more responsible with her repayments. Juana expresses her gratituD. to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina B. is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. Currently, the last born is in primary school while the rest are in senior and the junior high schools. Ernestina lives with her husband and the children in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mampong is mainly a business town. Her husband is farmer while she is a trader.

Ernestina trades in eggs. She procures eggs from the poultry farmers in nearby communities and sells in the local market and at times travel to nearby markets to sell. Ernestina also supplies eggs to retailers and food vendors (beverage sellers).

Ernestina has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk so she can expand her business and increase her profit margin to cater for her children.

loans.use: Procure crates of eggs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, or “Virgie” as she is called in their village, is engaged in hog raising. She is now 55-years old, married to Federico and they are blessed with three children. Aside from raising hogs, they are also engaged in farming as their major source of income. They plant rice, vegetables and root crops. She lives happily in the rural place of Barangay Tuao North over Bagabag Nueva Vizcaya with her family. Virgie and her husband send their children to school hoping that they will finish their studies and have good jobs someday. The couple is glad that, despite the difficulties in life they are experiencing, they have been able to support their children's studies.

Because of their desire to save for the future, Virgie was encouraged to request a loan of 20,000 PHP to maintain and improve their business. The loan will be used to buy additional piglets and feed for their hogs. She will also use some of the money for their farming needs such as buying farm tools. They hope to increase their income with this financial assistance. They are so thankful to the lenders who are willing to assist them financially.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and hog feed

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Sra. Irma J. cuanta con 46 años de edad, está casada con el Sr. Ramón Ruiz y tienen 7 hijos, de los cuales 3 son profesionales y los demás en edad escolar.

La actividad que realiza la Sra. Irma es la venta, en su propio local, de bienes de primera necesidad, tales como yerba mate, azúcar, fideo, harina, panificados, etc., además se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas, como empanadas, milanesas, croquetas y otros.
Para poder comenzar con este negocio, el cónyuge quien es  constructor, había conseguido trabajar en una obra muy grande en donde consiguió un buen capital por dicho trabajo y de ahí comenzaron a montar la despensa.
En la actualidad es una de las despensas de mayor consideración en la zona y su éxito se debe a la buena atención, buena calidad de los productos, buen precio y además de ofrecer variedad de mercaderías.
Actualmente el Señor Ramón sigue dedicándose a su profesión, que sigue dandole un ingreso importante para la familia.
Es importante mencionar que tienen casa propia, y el orgullo de tener en la familia a tres hijos profesionales, dos docentes y una contadora pública.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de mercaderías, como ser arroz, fideo, azúcar, yerba mate, panificados, bebidas gaseosas, almidón, etc.
Una de las metas que se han propuesto, es la de hacer profesionales a sus otros hijos, y darles la oportunidad que ellos no tuvieron cuando jóvenes.
texts.en:
Irma J. is 46 years old and married to Ramon Ruiz. They have 7 children, 3 of them are grown up and working and the others are still attending school. Irma has a small shop where she sells staples such as tea, sugar, noodles, flour, bread, as well as some fast food items such as empanadas and fried meats.

She was able to start the business with the help of her husband, who works in construction. He had worked on a large project which paid well, and so she had the capital to launch her store. Today it is one of the larger stores in the area, and her success is due to her good customer service, high quality and variety of products, as well as good prices.

Ramon continues to work in his profession, which generates an important income for the family. It's important to mention that they have their own home, and they are proud to have a family with three children who are now professionals, two are teachers and one is an accountant.

The requested loan will be used to purchase merchandise such as rice, noodles, sugar, tea, bread, sodas, etc. One of their main goals is that their other children will also become professionals, and have opportunities that Irma and Ramon never had when they were young.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store,  such as rice, noodles, tea, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira C. is a rice grower. She is a 48-year-old mother of three children. She told CEVI about her experience in farming: "My husband and I are tilling the land of our friends. We are tenants. Someday, I wish to have our own farm to be able to support better the needs of our family."

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase seeds, herbicides and complete fertilizers. Aside from that, Mrs. C. plans to venture to some other business.

CEVI provides not just loans to their clients. They also include training and insurance coverage in their services.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, herbicides and complete fertilizers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 39 años, es una madre soltera muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia con su única hija, Karina de 14 años, y desea mejorar la vida que actualmente lleva. Se dedica a la venta de celulares en una tienda ubicada en una de las calles más céntricas de la ciudad de Juliaca, su negocio es muy concurrido, ya que siempre trata muy bien a sus clientes y los recibe con una sonrisa en los labios. A Juana le gusta mucho vender y conversar con las personas, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas laborales. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad y anhela que su negocio crezca y genere mejores ingresos, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y está dispuesta a poner todo de su parte para salir adelante. Este es el primer préstamo de Juana con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre bromea con sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más celulares para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Juana, 39 years old, is a hard-working single mother. She lives in her own home with her only daughter, fourteen-year-old Karina. Juana wants to improve her standard of living. She sells cell phones in a store located on one of the streets close to the center of the city of Juliaca. Her business is very popular. She always treats her customers very well and greets them with a smile. Juana enjoys very much selling and talking with people, and her enjoyment makes her long work days more pleasant. She has done this work for five years and longs to increase business and earn a higher income. The most difficult part of her work is staying inside the store the entire day, but she knows that all-day attendance is required, and she will do whatever is required to succeed. This is Juana's first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She knows she must make her payments on time. At her local bank, she is very cheerful and always jokes with employees and other customers. With the $350 requested, she will buy more cell phones to increase her sales volume.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en: Pelenatete S., 62, is married with 5 children.  She has experience working in the plantation business.  She sells to the public 4 days per week.  She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala (~ 120USD).  SPBD loans are Pelenatete’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers and wheel barrow.

loans.name: Ataro

texts.en:
Ataro L. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Ataro is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a watchman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Sann, 49, and her husband, Mr. Phen Mao, 50, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1980 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of their sons are in college. 

Y. has run beauty salon at her house for 3 years and her daughters assist her in the business. Mr. Phen Mao is a farmer. He grows jasmine and many kinds of flowers. Y. doesn’t have enough materials to operate her business, so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy more materials for her beauty salon and to use as capital for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jania Valeria

texts.es: La joven Jania M. de 25 años de edad, es una joven esforzada que a mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con su matrimonió como con sus estudios, tiene una niña de 4 años, que ayuda cuidar su mama ya que ella trabaja en la alcaldía  como responsable de los derechos de la niñez, su esposo es cadete de taxi, y junto han logrado hacer su casa. Con este préstamo que esta haciendo es para terminar de pagar sus estudios ya que es su último año en la carrera de Administración turística y hotelera y son muchos gastos gracias a la ayuda de su esposo y ahorro ha logrado poder cubrir los gastos, también va hacer una pequeña remodelación de su pequeña casa. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible hacer los trámites.

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer mejoras a su casa y pagar  parte en sus estudios

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Doña Juana Francisca de 51 años de edad, es una mujer esforzada que desde joven a trabajado para apoyar a su familia tiene cinco hijos cuatro trabajan y una estudia, su esposo es técnico en aluminio y vidrio. Su negocio es el alquiler de sillas y mesas y tiene 17 años en este trabajo, es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic y con ellos ha hecho mejoras a su vivienda como comprado sillas para incrementar su negocio. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para hacer divisiones de cuarto y poder tener privacidad. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijas a que termine sus estudios. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de estos créditos.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Francisca is 51 years old and is a strong woman who since she was young has worked to support her five children (four work and one is in school). Her husband works with aluminum and glass. Her business is renting chairs and tables and she has been in business for 17 years. This is her third loan with Afodenic and with the loans she has made improvements to her home such as buying chairs to grow her business. With this loan, she will buy construction materials to create room dividers and be able to have privacy. Her plan is to help her daughters finish their studies. She is grateful for the opportunity to get these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kristina Howe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to make room dividers

loans.name: Marng

texts.en: Marng S., 37, is a widow and resides in Kompong Cham Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a business of selling groceries in her village, earning approximately an income of US $10 per day in revenue. She has to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for her family, and her standard of living is improved since she starts her current business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase more various kinds of grocery to expand her inventory and to satisfy all of her clients’ need. By doing so, she hopes she will be able to raise a good standard of living for her children.

loans.use: buy groceries

loans.name: Hanifa's Group

texts.en: N. Hanifa is the leader of her lending group in Kayunga. She is a very hard working lady and a mother of 6 children as she takes care of her other siblings. Hanifa is a business lady that sells smoked fish to families and restaurants in and around her village. She buys the fresh fish from the landing sites in Mukono and smokes the fish herself which enables her to save more. For the experience she has in the business, Hanifa is able to make 200,000/= as profits a week, although she wants for this to increase since the school fees and other family needs keep on demanding. She admires those people that sell her fish hence in future, she would want to join the fishing trade and supply the fish herself hence increasing her income and profits. At the moment, Hanifa needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for smoking hence resale.

loans.use: Buying more fish for smoking and resale.

loans.name: John G.

texts.en: Thirty-five year old John G. C. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to buy house building materials. John is married and has three children who are attending primary schools.

loans.use: Buy house building materials

loans.name: Mrs.many Pech Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Many P. is the leader of a five-member loan group. All of the members live in Samraong Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Many P. owns a grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more groceries to sell, so she can earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Chae Phat, grows rice on a piece of land that he owns. Mrs. Many P. is 37 years old and the mother of five children. Three of her children work a garment factory; the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sen D., 30, is married with two school-aged children, both enrolled in a local primary school. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. Her husband operates a business as a realty agent, earning an income of US$3 per day to help cover the family expenses.

D. sells various kinds of groceries, earning an income of approximately US$2 per day. She and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, D. is asking for a loan of US$300 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ANASTACIA es casada y tiene cinco hijos. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Cusco. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARY CUSCO” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de granos secos y la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos de arcilla. La socia tiene un stand en el mercado de Tito (urbanización de la ciudad del Cusco) donde vende los granos secos. Ya son varios años con el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar granos secos como cebada, trigo, fréjoles, pallares y maíz.             
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Anastacia is married and has five children. She is from the city of Cusco. She belongs to the community bank "Ricchary Cusco", of the Arariwa Association. She balances her household activities with the sale of dried grains and the production of brick and clay work. She has a stand in the Tito marketplace (a development in the city of Cusco) where she sells dried grains. She has been with this business for several years and it has gone very well thanks to all the effort she puts into her work. Anastacia is a hard-working, enterprising woman who works to get her family ahead. She needs this loan to increase her business capital and wishes to buy dried grains like barley, wheat, beans, butter beans and corn. Anastacia is appreciative for the opportunity offered through this loan service and commits to repaying the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase business capital and to buy dried grains like barley, wheat, beans, butter beans and corn

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 23 años, es una joven mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su pareja (José Luis), de 28 años, y con sus 2 hijos; José de 3 y Dayana de 2 añitos.
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que realiza debido a la comodidad que le brinda, pues puede hacer las labores de su hogar y dedicarse por las tardes y en sus ratos libres a ofrecer la variedad de productos que tiene.
María es muy conocida en la zona donde vive, además tiene muchas amigas que van a su casa con amistades y familiares para hacerle pedidos, incrementando así, su lista de clientes.

Este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y espera ser muy puntual con cada uno de los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar mercadería para tenerla en stock y aprovechar la venta en estas épocas navideñas.
texts.en:
Maria is a 23-year-old hard-working young woman. She lives with her partner (José Luis) who is 28, and with their two children: José who is 3 and Dayana who is 2. She sells beauty products, which she does because of the convenience it offers her. She can do her housework, and spend evenings and free time selling the variety of products she has.

Maria is well-known in the area where she lives; she also has many friends who come to her house with friends and family to place orders, and so Maria is able to increase her list of customers.

This is the first loan she has had with MFP, and she intends to be punctual with each of her payments. With the money requested she wants to buy merchandise to have it in stock to take advantage of sales during the Christmas season.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sèkinatou

texts.fr: S. Sèkinatou est née en 1989 à Abomey-Calavi au Bénin. Mariée à AHOUANMAGNIMON Lawal, Sèkinatou est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a un an que la famille vit à Houénoussou à Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Sèkinatou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Sèkinatou n'a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Depuis près de 5 ans, Sèkinatou vend du charbon de bois au marché de Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Sèkinatou vend également des bijoux pacotilles, ce qui lui permet de diversifier ses sources de revenus. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sèkinatou s'approvisionne. Sèkinatou a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé et qu'elle a bien remboursé, malgré le vol de ses marchandises dont elle a été victime au 2ème prêt. Sèkinatou souhaite rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Mais Sèkinatou ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y parvenir. C'est la raison pour laquelle Sèkinatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sèkinatou S. was born in 1989 in Abomey-Calavi in Benin. Married to Lawal Ahouanmagnimon, Sèkinatou is the mother of one child, who is in school. For the past year, the family has lived in Houénoussou in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Sèkinatou helps her husband take care of the family's expenses, thanks to the money she makes from her business. Sèkinatou only attended primary school. For nearly five years, Sèkinatou has sold charcoal at the Sainte Rita market in Cotonou. She also sells costume jewelry, which has given her an additional source of income. She buys her stock at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Sèkinatou has already received two loans through Alidé that she repaid in full, despite being robbed of her merchandise after she received her second loan. She would like to bolster her business and better meet her customers' needs. However, she does not have the financial means to do so. This is why Sèkinatou is requesting a third loan through Alidé.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Mr. Moussa B. started out as a “taximan” (taxi driver) 7 years ago, at the age of 20, after being introduced to the job by his older brother. Moussa lives and works in the city of Thies, some 50 miles from the capital Dakar. In 2005, Moussa was able to purchase his own taxi, and has been driving for himself ever since. With the loan of 300,000 FCFA he would like to fix up his car to make it newer looking and more comfortable for his customers.  The majority of the loan will go to buying four new doors and having them painted. This is the second loan for Mr. B..

loans.use: Taxi repair

loans.name: Tuwisana Plus Group

texts.en:
Papy K., aged 31 and unmarried, is the president of the Community Bank named “Tuwisana Plus”, which is composed of 32 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Papy started his business in 2007 with $30 in initial capital. He manages his own general store located west of the city of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE DRC who has already received four different loans and has repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to buy goods to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $45. His ambition is to become a wholesaler in his area.

loans.use: To purchase goods to resell

loans.name: Jeonardo

texts.en: Jeonardo C. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, is a single father, and has one school-aged child. Jeonardo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jeonardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his child. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma A. is from the village of Pandan, Gingoog City in the Philippines. She is forty-seven years old. Wilma is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns and operates a specialized retail business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Wilma's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie B. is from the village of Tru-Cut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Tessie is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business providing motorcab services in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Tessie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia C. sells vegetables such as garden eggs (eggplant), okro (okra), tomatoes and other food supplies at Akotokyire.

Patricia has been through junior high education. She is married to a petty trader and lives with her son. She helps her husband in educating, clothing and feeding the children.

Patricia’s loan will be used to buy extra vegetables and other food supplies for sale. Her wish is to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and other food supplies to sell

loans.name: Ederlina's Group

texts.en:
Ederlina D. is from the village of Brgy. Baresbes, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Ederlina is 52 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Ederlina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2006, Ederlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ederlina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn R. is from the village of Brgy Poblacion South, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school aged children. Evelyn owns & operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
Lhagvajav S., age 54, lives with her husband, who is retired, and a son. She has been operating a meat trading business since 1998 and has gained much experience in this field. Her health is not good; she had a medical treatment last winter. Her husband ran the business while she was out. Her son is involved with inter provincial transportation. 

Lhagvajav is clever and creative. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik loan to purchase livestock from the sub-provinces.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 39 years old and he is married.  Augustin owns a motorcycle and this motorcycle allows him to earn his family's daily living.  Augustin has been the driver of a motorcycle for about 3 years.

Augustin needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and this loan will allow him to buy one additional motorcycle which will increase his daily profit.  In addition, he will create one additional job for one of the people from his community.  Augustin will start also saving for the future in order to create some other sources of income apart from driving.

loans.use: The purchase of one additional motorcycle

loans.name: Juana Lidia Cristina

texts.es: La señora Juana Lidia Cristina T. V. de 36 años de edad, con nivel  académico de sexto primaria aprobado, Casada, vive con un hijo. Se dedica a la elaboración de Muebles de madera como: Roperos, Chineros, Mesas entre Otros, quiere ampoliasr nsu capital de trabajo, para tener una mejor producccion en catidad de los muebles que elabora, tiene empleados a su cargo y lo que  espera es mejorar sus ganancias del trabajo que realiza , la que contribuirá a obtener mejores ingresos y tener una superación y mejor calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana Lidia Cristina T. V. is 36 years old and has a sixth grade education. She is married and lives with one son. She works at making wood furniture such as wardrobes, china cabinets, tables and others. She wants to increase her working capital to be able to have increased production of the furniture that she makes. She has employees working for her and wants to improve her realized gains, this will contribute to her obtaining better income and growth and a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo, cliente antiguo de nuestra institucion se dedica a la actividad de filmaciones de eventos.Es un joven talentoso y muy dinamico ,ya que para los diferentes eventos que realiza pone todo  su empeño ,esfuerzo y dedicacion ,cabe recalcar que para todo filmacion de eventos toma los mejores angulos para asi mismo obtener un buen trabajo. el sr. Hugo, vive por el  norte mas especificamente  en el barrio juan pablo II,calle sinai , vive en la cuidad de santa cruz de la sierra. Don Hugo  acudio a nuestra Institución debido  a  que tiene bastante demanda y nesecita incorporar una nueva computadora mas para su negocio,(proceso de grabacion y modificacion en gral. en las filmaciones de eventos ),  por tal motivo decidio acceder a un Crédito en nuestra Institución, para poder de esta forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo, an old client of Emprender, films events. He is a talented and very dynamic young man who puts all of his determination, effort, and dedication into the different films he makes. It should be noted that for every event he films, he shoots from the best angles in order to obtain a good result. Mr. Hugo lives towards the north, more specifically on Sinai Street in the Juan Pablo II neighborhood, in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Mr. Hugo came to Emprender because he had a great deal of demand for his services and he needed to purchase a new computer for his business (filming and general editing of films of events). For this reason, he decided to take out a loan through Emprender, as this would allow him to offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer for editing films of events

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina D. P. is from the village of Bantay, Solana, Cagayan. She is 37 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes T. is a widow who lives in Ruiz Street, Brgy. Libacao, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 businesses: pig fattening and e-loading. Mercedes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercedes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to pay for more pigs so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Mercedes T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Los Genios De La Alcancia Comunal Group

texts.es:
ELIZABETH M. C. tiene 43 años vive en el AA.HH diez de octubre en el distrito de san Juan de Lurigancho.-es conviviente madre de siete hijos de los cuales cuatro hijos ya son independientes y tres mas pequeños que aun los tiene que educar.
 Elizabeth anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosmeticos,hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de ropa, pero no es el único trabajo también es auxiliar de educación en un colegio y dentro de ello también dicta clases de alfabetización.
 Elizabeth ejerce el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía“LOS GENIOS DE LA ALCANCIA COMUNAL”es una alcancía nueva formada por 7 entusiasta y comprometidas socias que viven en una misma urbanización; conocieron a EDAPROSPO –PROSPERIDA gracias a una amiga que ya había realizado prestamos con nosotros; Ella agradece la confianza  que lo brindamos al otorgarle el primer préstamo.
 El sueño de Elizabeth es ver a sus hijos desarrollados profesionalmente y terminar con algunos acabados en su casa, porque ella nos cuenta que todo lo que gana como educadora y parte de su negociolo lo invierte en educar a sus hijos porque es la mejor herecia que los puede dejar, ya que su esposo lo ayuda con los gastos de la canasta familiar.
El reciente préstamo lo utilizara en pagar los estudios de uno de sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la universidad.
  En la foto la señora Elizabeth se encuentra de pie tiene el cabello rubio y viste una polera manga larga color gris.
texts.en:
Elizabeth M. C. is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband in a community called "Diez de Octubre" [October 10th] in the San Juan de Lurigancho district of Lima, Peru. They have seven children, four of whom are already living independently. The three youngest are still in school. Elizabeth used to work selling cosmetics, but for the past year and a half she has been selling clothing. This is not her only job, as she also works as a teaching assistant at a local school and teaches literacy classes there. Elizabeth is the president of a communal bank called “Los Genios de la Alcancía Comunal” [The Geniuses of Communal Banking]. It is a new communal bank whose members are 7 enthusiastic and dedicated women who live in the same community. They found out about EDAPROSPO –PROSPERIDA [the Kiva field partner] thanks to a friend who had taken out a loan with the group. Elizabeth is grateful for the confidence shown in her with the granting of this loan. Elizabeth's dream is to see her children have successful careers and to finish with some home improvements. The money she earns as a teacher and part of her business profits go towards her children's education, because it is the best legacy that she can leave them. Her husband helps to cover the family's everyday expenses. This loan will be used to pay educational expenses for one of her children, who is a college student. In the photograph, Elizabeth is standing up. She has light hair and is wearing a long-sleeved gray shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for educational expenses for one of the member's children, who is a college student

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie L. is a 37-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store.  She lives in Mauswagon, Brgy. Sibucao, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Rosie is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 so that she can buy additional items for her general (sari-sari) store.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Rosie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines and click the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Buy additional items for general store

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Buth K. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children who attend the local public school. Her husband is a farmer in Kompong Tom Province. In 2008, she began selling rattan beds. She also orders rattan items in bulk and then sells them door-to-door throughout the province. It always takes a week or two weeks to sell her products. 

This is currently the rainy season and a good time to grow crops. However, Buth K. and her husband do not have any capital yet for their farm. Buth K. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for growing crops on their farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with two children who go to school. He runs the 'Samchem' chemist to earn a living. In his chemist's shop he sells drugs, soft drinks and cosmetics.

Samuel started running the business three years ago. He was previously selling charcoal and fruit to earn a living. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to stabilize his business. He has requested 70,000 KES to buy more cosmetics in readiness for the peak season.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 58 years old and is in business. She does bead work at her home where she makes bags, purses, wallets, and necklaces, among other products. 

She began this business last year and describes her business environment as convenient. She has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to stock different types of beads and threads. She also does quarrying to earn extra income. 

She was formerly employed as an elementary school teacher and later at the Lyons maid company. A mother of six adults (all over 18 years of age), Damaris is married and one of her children is in schoool. 

She describes herself as hard-working, honest and responsible.  She hopes to buy her own house so as to stop renting, and have children who are financially independent. 

In five years time, Damaris desires to have numerous orders for her products, have a premises to operate her business and employ people. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Damaris has become a good saver.

loans.use: To buy beads and threads

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik A. is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ijevan city. Hasmik works at an accounting firm as an accountant. At the same time, she and her husband are engaging in swine breeding and land cultivation, which they run not far from their house. This business enables them to support their family. She and her husband also help Hasmik’s parents, who engage in swine breeding as well, with farming in Sargyugh village. 
Hasmik says pig breeding is a profitable business, so she wants to increase her farming. Hasmik is asking for a 750,000 AMD loan to buy three or four pigs and fodder for them.

loans.use: To buy three or four pigs and fodder for them

loans.name: Pakris

texts.en: Pakris, who is 66 years old, married to Serian Pakris and the father of three children, has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan with which he will buy five cows to rear and later sell at a profit.  In the future, Pakris hopes to have a big farm to raise his animals on.

loans.use: To buy five cows to later sell at a profit.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora C., age 50, is a dealer of Natasha and Avon clothing and footwear products in her local community. She also buys and sells electronic load credits for the Smart and Globe cell-phone networks. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and it brings her approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Sto. Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon, and have four school-aged children.

Earlier this year, Flora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Flora is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase T-shirts, blouses, and other additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase T-shirts, blouses, and other additional products to sell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un regroupement de 10 femmes de l’association BENKADI du village de KANSSENE dans la préfecture de TOMINIAN (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans. Mariées et mères d’au moins 11 enfants. Elles mènent différentes activités : vente d’oignons, de patate, de haricot et  de condiments. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles. 
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser mieux leurs activités et satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, le groupe DJEKAFO a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année.  Elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
MAFINI  D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 12 sacs de haricot  dans les petits villages en l’ambulant. Elle revend au marché de TOMONIAN aux grossistes qui viennent pour la foire.  
Elle espère sur un bénéfice de 21000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
DJEKAFO is a group of 10 women from the BENKADI association in the village of Kanssene, in the Tominian prefecture (in the Ségou region, Republic of Mali). They have an average age of 53, are all married and mothers to at least 11 children. They work in different businesses: selling onions, potatoes, beans and condiments. They live in large traditional families and know each other through family and neibourhood ties.
In order to make their businesses more profitable and to satisfy the growing needs of their customers, the DJEKAFO group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program this year. This is their first loan.
Mafini D. plans to use her loan to source 12 bags of beans from small villages. She resells to wholesalers at the market in Tominian who come for the fair.
She is hoping to make 21000 XOF in profits that will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of beans

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo B. is from the village of Aurora. He is 31 years old. Leo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $117 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: La señora Blanca Rosa es madre de 2 niñas, hace tiempo su esposo falleció por lo que se vio obligado por las circunstancias que quedo a tener una mejor opción. A pesar del dolor que estaba pasando siguió adelante y puso un negocio que es una papelería y mercería llamada “Angelique”con 3 años de antigüedad. Blanca ofrece a sus clientes variedad de artículos escolares a un bajo precio, pero en este momento requiere de un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa has two children.  Her husband passed away some time ago.  Therefore, she had no choice under the circumstances.  She had to have a better alternative.  In spite of the pain she was going through, she kept going.  

She established a business, a stationery and general merchandise store called Angelique.  She has had the store for three years.

Blanca offers her customers a variety of school items at a low price.  She now needs a loan to be able to stock her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Boussoura  Lô / Samba Ka Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Boussoura  Lô / SAMBA KA a été crée le 30/12/2009 . Il est composé de 28 femmes qui sont du même village. Elles son unies par des liens d'amitié, de parenté et de fraternité. Leurs activités dominantes sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine. 

Madame NDEYE L. (debout à l'extrême sur la photo, emmitouflée d'une écharpe rose) est la responsable de groupe. Elle âgée de 69 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de ses trois neveux.

Elle fait de l' embauche comme activité. Elle a commencé à pratiquer cette activité depuis qu'elle a commencé à travailler avec CAURIE-MF en 2009. Son mari l'aide pour la vente des animaux

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter au moins trois moutons qu'elle va engraisser pendant 5 à 6 mois pour les vendre ensuite dans les marchés.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité des enfants et de la nourriture pour la famille
texts.en:
The solidarity group Boussoura Lô/Samba Ka has been created on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 28 women from the same village. They are joined by friendship, family ties and common work. Their main activities are retail and raising sheep. 

Mrs. Ndeye L. (standing at the far edge of the photo, wrapped in a pink scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 69 years old. She is married and the mother of five. She also has three nephews in her care.

She raises livestock. She has started this line of work since joining Caurie-MF in 2009. Her husband helps her sell the animals.

Her new loan will allow her to purchase at least three sheep to be fattened for 5-6 months for later resale at   a market.

Her goal is to help her husband cover the school fees for her children and the food expenses for the family

loans.use: Purchasing sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a two-bedroom studio apartment. Ganbat’s two older sons are attending the local secondary school and the youngest son is just one year old. His wife Uranjargal, 26, is a doctor. 

Ganbat has been running a kimchi factory for the last three years with 2 employees. He worked in a kimchi factory when he was in Korea. He is dedicated to supplying his customers with his own label quality products by paying close attention to taste, quality and hygiene. He is a very optimistic person who wants to improve his family’s living condition and is planning to have his own working place.  He also wants to give his children a good education and teach them morals.

Ganbat plans to use the loan he is asking for to purchase plastic bags to use in his business.

loans.use: To purchase plastic bags for kimchi production factory

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a 51-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in the island of Cebu. 

Antonia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Antonia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy a new fishing boat so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Antonia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Gloria, de 46 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, vive junto a sus hijos, y actualmente necesita comprar materia prima para hacer los refrescos, su especialidad es el refresco de Horchata, y su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado del centro de la ciudad.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales por ejemplo, azúcar, maní, ajonjolí, bolsas, esta compra le ayudara a mantener lo suficiente en su inventario, del cual puede disponer para preparar sus ventas, en el momento deseado.

Su objetivo es que a través del negocio pueda recibir las ganancias necesarias para cubrir la el pago de agua potable en su vivienda y ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán Department.  She sells soft drinks, and lives with her children.  She needs to buy supplies and ingredients with which to make her soft drinks.  Her specialty is hibiscus soft drink.  Her business is located in the city's central market.

She is asking for this loan to buy sugar, mani, sesame seed, and bags.  This will help her to keep her inventory up, so that she can be ready to make sales at every opportunity.

Her goal is to earn enough money through her business to be able to afford potable water and help her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies

loans.name: Ann Muthoni

texts.en: Ann has practiced farming in the town of Ndunyu Njeru for the last nine years. She is 49 years old, married to John Karanja and they have two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be his second loan. She paid her previous loan of Kshs 15,000 in good time. Ann plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In future, Ann hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en:
Placidie is 53 years old. She is married with three children and she takes care of seven children. Her business is well-organized. She sells shoes. Her business is open from 5 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on the weekend and she has 20 years of experience in her business. 

Placidie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase different shoes to sell for women, men and children. With any profit, Placidie will reinvest in her business, and she will be able to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell for women, men and children.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Todas las integrantes del grupo desean iniciar y aumentar sus actividades a través de este crédito. Las señoras que aún no cuentan con actividades destinarán toda la plata para invertir de inmediato en compra de alimentos para chanchos así como medicamentos que los mismos requieran.
La Sra. Gervacia desea una buena crianza de estos animales a fin de destinarlos luego a la venta y comercialización de los mismos.
Ella es una mujer que se dedica a esto para poder brindar a su familia una vida digna, en la que pueda mantenerse tratando de superar cada día la pobreza que amenaza a muchas familias en nuestro país.
Con este crédito esperan obtener más ingresos y mejorar sus niveles y calidad de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
All of the members of this group want to start or expand their businesses through this loan.  Some of the women will use the money to invest right away in the purchase of pig feed and pig medications.  Gervacia wants to do a good job of raising these animals,  so that she can later sell them.  She is in this business so that she can provide her family with a decent life; she keeps trying every day to overcome the poverty that threatens so many families in this country.

With this loan they hope to obtain better incomes and improve their living standard and the quality of life of their families.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for raising pigs

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive con su esposo y una hija la cual es enfermera, se dedica a la agricultura, desD. hace 11 años junto a su esposo trabajan sembrando maíz y frijol, cultivan una parte en terreno propio y otra parte alquilan.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, fertilizantes y tratamiento para plagas, esta inversión le ayudara para iniciar  la siembra con todos los cuidados necesarios, con la esperanza D. lograr una buena cosecha.
Para María como cada año, su objetivo es tener una buena siembra, cultivar y producir, tiene también el proyecto D. arreglar su vivienda pero dentro D. algún tiempo.
texts.en:
María is married living with her husband and a daughter who is a nurse.  She is a farmer.  For the last 11 years she and her husband have worked planting corn and beans.  They grow part of it on their own field and another part on leased land.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure and insecticiD..  This investment will help her start the planting with all necessary care hoping to get a good crop yield.

For María, like every year, her goal is to attain a good planting, to cultivate and to produce.  She also has a project involving home repairs but that’s for a little later on.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en: Adriano is an individual client from Ibanda.  He is 36 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.  He is a God-fearing and hard-working man with a grain milling business in Nyabihoko Trading Centre that he has owned for seven years.  In his business, he employs casual workers and deals mostly with the local community.  He is able to generate 320,000/= weekly, and in addition, he has a retail shop and sells produce from the same area of Nyabihoko.  His dream is to have better health and increase his production.  He needs a loan to be able to purchase produce like maize grain, millet, and cassava for milling.

loans.use: To purchase produce like maize grain, millet, and cassava for milling.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has two children, all of whom are in school. She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Florence has a food stall in Uganda where she sells her products at retail. She has been in business for three years, and she works seven days a week. The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and the perishability of tomatoes.

Florence has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start growing tomatoes and onions herself.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of tomatoes and onions for her stall.

loans.name: Magelyn

texts.en: Magelyn is 43 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide the needs of her family. She is an Avon cosmetics products distributor in the Philippines and because of insufficient capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She wants to buy additional stock of Avon products to sell like lipstick, pressed powder, lotion and perfumes. She has been in this business for five years and she is earning an income of PHP 4,000 monthly. According to Magelyn, she will do everything just to provide the needs of her family, especially to do her responsibility as a mother of her two kids in terms of education and daily needs. In the future, Magelyn would like to save more funds for their future needs and to alleviate her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, pressed powder, lotion and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Merlinda has a retail shop that sells T-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

Merlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts & blouses to sell.

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He lives with 11 family members. Two of the family members work.

Sadek has owned a store since 1995, selling women's clothing, accessories and cosmetics. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan to make a ceiling light for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole

loans.use: To make a ceiling light for his store.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 52 years old and is married to Rajab. They currently live with their two grandchildren.

Beatrice sells groceries and has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by a friend who is also a registered client with KADET Ltd. The profits made from the business will be used to cater to the family's needs.

She hopes to diversify into a clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to add to her stock.

loans.name: Gabriela Milagro

texts.es:
Gabriela, de 27 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León, casada, ella es comerciante es dueña de una pequeña pulpería y una mini tienda  de ropa, ella estudia su segundo año de la carrera de contabilidad. Inicio su negocio a la edad de 23 años de edad, después de su casarse ella no encontraba un pasatiempo su vida era muy rutinaria, se sentía agobiada, su mama la motivo a establecer su negocio como pasatiempo, ella recuerda que comenzó con un capital muy pequeño de menos de $200 dólares y en poco tiempo se dio cuenta que mas que un pasatiempo era una fuente de ingresos y eso la ayudo a sentirse mas útil  y posteriormente puso una mini tienda y con esto se ayuda pagar la universidad. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería tales como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles para vender en su pulpería y comprar también cosméticos, ropa y perfumes para vender en su mini tienda. Al hacer esta inversión lo clientes se sentirán mas atraídos por la variedad de productos que su venta ofrece y sus ingresos mejoraran. Una de sus metas es logra convertir su pequeña pulpería en una distribuidora y su mini tienda se convierta en una tienda de variedad de productos de ropa y productos de uso cotidiano y  finalizar sus estudios univeristarios.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 27 years old, married, and a native of the city of Leon. She is a business woman. She owns a small grocery store as well as a small clothing store. She is studying accounting and is in her second year. 

She started her own business when she was 23 years old. After getting married, she couldn't find a hobby. She found her life very routine and felt overwhelmed. Her mom encouraged her to start her business as a hobby. She remembers that she started with a small capital of less than $200 dollars and that in a short amount of time she realized that more than a hobby, it was a source of income. This made her feel more useful. Later on, she started a small store which helps her pay for her college education.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, and beans to sell in her grocery store. She also wants to buy cosmetics, clothes, and perfumes to sell in her clothing store. With this investment, her clients will feel more attracted by the variety of products that her store will offer and her earnings will increase.

One of her goals is to turn her small grocery store into a wholesale store and also to turn her small clothing store into a store with a variety of products for clothing and everyday products. She also wants to finish her college studies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, oil, and beans to sell in her small grocery store. She also wants to buy cosmetics, clothes, and perfumes to sell in her small clothing store.

loans.name: Ibaale Kwesiga Group

texts.en: Christine is a 50 years old, married, and has six children. They live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main dream is to educate her children. Christine owns a retail shop which she has operated for the last two years. She faces a challenge of price fluctuations that in turn affects the demands of her clients. In the future, she hopes to trade in wholesale. Christine is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and groundnuts.

loans.name: Chuluuntogtokh

texts.en:
Mr.Chuluuntogtokh always worries about his family's house which is in bad condition currently. He says the roof is so bad that rain water leaks through. He is a 24-year-old taxi driver. He lives with his wife, 3-year-old son, mother and two brothers. He has been running his taxi business for three years and has a number of loyal customers. He is a self-motivated and hardworking young man. 

Mr.Chuluuntogtokh requested a loan to purchase building materials for making repairs to his house to improve conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for repairing his house.

loans.name: Taikoh

texts.en:
Taikoh is 36 years old and married to Sipanto.  They are blessed with three children.  Taikoh is a livestock trader in the area of Bissil where most of his clients are men.  He has been in this business for the last five years and earns an income of KES 10,000 per month.

Taikoh was introduced to Kiva partner KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff person.  He has a good credit history with KADET and is applying for his second loan of KES 80,000.  Taikoh plans to use KES 70,000 to purchase livestock and the remaining 10,000 to pay school fees.  He will use the anticipated profits to start a butcher shop.

Taikoh hopes to start a ranch.  He is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and pay school fees.

loans.name: En El Nombre De Dios Group

texts.es:
El grupo en el Nombre de Dios está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Miriam quien tiene una fritanga desde hace 6 años. Ella con el crédito comparara sillas, mesas e insumos (granos básicos, carne, plátano…etc.)
Los otros integrantes son Ana María de 32 años quien vende productos Avon y Bismar comerciante de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The group “En El Nombre de Dios” (In the Name of God) consists of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Miriam, who has managed a fried foods restaurant for six years.  She will use her loan to buy chairs, tables, and supplies (basic grains, meat, plantains, and other items).  

The other members are Ana María, who is 32 years old and sells Avon products, and Bismar, who is used clothing merchant.

loans.use: to buy chairs, tables, and supplies.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is 31 years of age and married to a farmer. They have been blessed with three children. The couple do their best to support their family. Her husband is a farmer and at the same time an operator of his motorcycle transport business. Janette is glad that she and her husband work together to sustain the needs of her family. 

Janette has run her corn farming business for three years, and she is able to earn about P5,000 per cropping season. Aside from the farming business, she is also a teacher within the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista. Janette would like to maintain her corn field and provide all the important farm supplies to make it more productive, but due to the high cost of farm supplies, she is in need of additional capital amounting to P27,000. This amount could be a big help in maintaining and improving her corn field. She hopes that she could obtain her loan request. She would be glad if she could increase her crop production this next cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides and to pay the labor costs of planting certified seeds.

loans.name: Vilma Abigail

texts.es:
La señora Vilma tiene 40 años D. edad, es acompañada con dos hijos.

Ella vive con sus dos hijos, ya que su compañero D. vida emigro a otro país. Vilma tiene 4 años D. dedicarse a la venta D. frutas y refrescos que ella misma prepara. Los productos que necesita los adquiere en el mercado D. una ciudad del oriente del país.

Vilma solicita el préstamo para, construir una habitación para sus hijos, ya que la vivienda es pequeña, y con la habitación adicional sus hijos tendrían privacidad, espacio para tener sus cosas y desarrollar sus tareas escolares. Así su vivienda será más confortable. Vilma desea tener su propia habitación y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old. She has a partner and two children.

She lives with her two children as her life partner emigrated abroad. Vilma has spent four years selling fruit and soft drinks that she prepares herself. She acquires the products she needs at a market in a city in the east of the country. 

Vilma is applying for a loan to build a bedroom for her children, since their house is small.
