With the additional room, her children would have privacy, and space to keep their things and to do their homework. This will make their home more comfortable. Vilma would like to have her own room and to be able to allow her children to study so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to build a bedroom for her children.

loans.name: Netra

texts.en: Netra, 22, is married and resides with her husband in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality rice products. Netra and her husband are goldsmiths. They also sell jewelry. Netra is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more jewelry to resell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to resell

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es:
La señora Agripina tiene 51 años y vive en la aldea de Hicaque en el municipio de Arizona. Ella es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de 19 y 22 años de edad. Ambos hijos ya se graduaron. Los tres contribuyen a los gastos familiares. 

Desde hace 10 años, Agripina se dedica a la venta de mercadería como lociones, cremas, cosméticos y sandalias. Trabaja 6 horas diarias en su negocio. Empezó con L2000 que le regaló un familiar. Ella iba invirtiendo las ganancias para ir haciendo crecer el negocio. En aquellos tiempos, ella estaba en una situación económica muy crítica y quería sacar sus hijos adelante. El negocio le ha ayudado bastante. 

Solicitó este crédito de L10,000 para la compra de lociones, cremas, sandalias y cosméticos. Su plan y meta es mantener su negocio ya que es su única forma de sustentarse.
texts.en:
Señora Agripina is 51 years old, and lives in the village of Hicaque in the Arizona municipality.  She is a single mother, and has two children aged 19 and 22.  Both her children have already graduated from school.  All three of them contribute to covering the family expenses.

For the last 10 years, Agripina has worked selling merchandise such as lotions, creams, cosmetics and sandals.  She works six hours daily in her business.  She began with L2,000, which was given to her by a relative.  She has been re-investing her earnings to be able to grow her business.  In those earlier times, she was in a very critical financial situation, and wanted to help her children move ahead in life.  Her business has helped her significantly.

She has requested this loan of L10,000 for the purchase of lotions, creams, sandals and cosmetics.  Her plan and goal is to keep her business running, as it is her only form of sustenance.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, creams, sandals, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 54 years old. Myrna is married and has 4 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, Myrna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Sussana

texts.en:
Sussana sells cassava and plantain at Efutu. She is married to a driver and has one child.

 Sussana  has been selling food for two years now. She uses her income to help her husband to provide for  their family. 

Sussana will use her loan to purchase more food to sell. With the new profit Sussana will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more food for sale.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Муродджон женат и является отцом двоих детей. Он трудолюбивый добросовестный человек. Любящий семьянин. Он является леном дехканского хозяйства и имеет свой земельный участок. Выращивает виноград и зерновые. По бизнесу ему помогают его родители. Он любит своих родителей и старается во всем их поддерживать. Полученную прибыль тратит на благоустройство семьи, воспитание  и содержание детей. Он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони и приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота. Он уверен, что добрые люди помогут ему и протянут руку помощи. Спасибо.
texts.en: Murodjon is married and the father of two children. He is a hard-working, honest man. His is a loving family man. He works on a communal farm and also  has his own plot of land. He grows grapes and grains. He uses his business to help his parents. He loves his parents and tries to support them completely. The profits he earns he spends on improving the standard of living for his family, on education, and on supporting his children. He wants to get a loan of 3,000 TJS to purchase a few head of cattle. He is confident that good people will help him and lend a helping hand.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio is 26 years old and lives in Conat Aloran, Misamis Occidental. He is single. Artemio has a hog fattening business, earning approximately PHP 10,000 each month from it. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase pig feed and vitamins for his business.

Artemio has been a member of PMPC for 8 months. In the future, he hopes to earn money because he wants to build a new house and is planning to get married. Artemio is a hardworking son and an honest and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anah

texts.en: Anah is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 6 to 18. She describes herself to be a jovial and faithful woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals such as maize, peas, beans etc. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local households. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor impassible roads leading to high prices of transportation to her business premise. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Morayo Nafissatou Alakè

texts.fr: Morayo Nafissatou Alakè est âgée de 34 ans et est mariée à un certain Idriss. Morayo Nafissatou Alakè est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à la charge du couple. Morayo Nafissatou Alakè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins, Morayo Nafissatou Alakè vend depuis trois ans, des tissus, des vêtements, des chaussures et des bijoux dans son quartier. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Morayo Nafissatou Alakè s’approvisionne au Bénin, mais aussi au Togo et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Morayo Nafissatou Alakè sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son revenu.
texts.en:
Morayo Nafissatou Alakè is 34 years of age, and is married to Idriss. She is a mother to two children, one of whom is at school and both are under the care of the couple. She lives with her husband and children and, together with her husband, covers the various household expenses. 

To provide for her family, for the past three years Morayo Nafissatou Alakè has worked selling fabrics, clothing, shoes and jewelry in her neighborhood. This business allows her to meet her needs without any great difficulty. 

Morayo Nafissatou Alakè gets her supplies in Benin, as well as in Togo and Nigeria. In order to satisfy her customers and increase her turnover and income, she has asked for her first loan from Alidé. This loan will allow her to increase her business levels, as well as to have more customers and higher income.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, clothing, shoes and jewelry.

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a resident of Rukanga- rural Ishaka. He is married to  Patience. Obed is a boda boda rider (motorcycle), and he has applied for 2,500,000 UGX to help him buy a new motorcycle. Since he already has one motorbike his plan is to hire someone else to ride the old one while he rides the new one. This will increase his daily income and help him fulfill his dream. His dream is to complete his house that has been under construction for some time. In the photograph is the loan officer in a checked shirt, Obed and his wife.(left to right)

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a very hard working woman who sells shawl and bed sheet by clothing. She has been in business for four years so she has many customers who request her bed sheet and shawl. She is 26 years old and lives with his life partner and one child. Her husband is responsible for entire family. Sadia wants to stock her business for the winter season in order to have enough variety to offer customers. Therefore she is requesting a loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy clothing, bed sheet and shawl to offer her customers.
Sadia and her family will be thankful to the KIVA’s lender and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy bed sheet and shawl for her bed sheet and shawl bussiness

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: <font size="2">I am a young lady aged 26, married with two children. My business is at Mukuyu market in Muranga District, Kenya. I have been in this business for over four years and for all this time it has been growing steadily. My current stock is about USD.325 and need to be boosted to increase the rate of return. By stocking new clothes, i will be in a position of pulling more customers because of having a variety which ar</font><font size="2">e of high quality and </font><font size="2">pocket friendly. I have been using loans from the group but because of not being enough to cover all members, i have opted this funding. I had an opportunity of using three loans and paid them back. </font>

loans.use: I would like to stock new clothes. I have been selling used clothes but of recent my clients are requesting for new clothes.

loans.name: Gubad

texts.en:
Gubad is cobbler. He has been engaged in this business for 17 years. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region, but has relocated to Sumgait city. This 50-year-old man is a hard worker. He is married and has three children. He borrowed his first loan of $500 from Normicro to buy shoemaking supplies and other items needed in the production of the shoe leathers.

Gubad currently needs a loan amount for $800 to build his own shoe store.

loans.use: He plans to build the own shoe store

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S. is 56 years old and a widow with 4 children.  She is blind, but has learned traditional Khmer massage and earns $2/day.  Her 4 children and 2 nephews live with her in Phnom Penh, and they all contribute to the household income and supporting their mother.  Cheng S. will use this loan to buy a motorbike for her children and nephews to get to and from work.  As the family continues to earn money, she dreams of building a concrete house so everyone can live properly together.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for her children's transportation

loans.name: Víctor

texts.en:
Victor sells clothes and accessories. He stared the business with the help of a brother who provided merchandise for him to get off the ground. At first he only sold clothes and plastics door-to-door and now he has opened a store where he sells all types of clothing and accessories.

Several months ago, Victor received his first loan from Kiva and Mifex. He did extremely well with the loan as he was able to break into the household appliances market while continuing to buy clothing. The investments in appliances were the most successful as he was able to make significant profits from those items. He immediately invested the profits into his business by fixing up his store with more glass cases, a new sign outside and doors to keep his business safe. Business has been booming ever since. He has also decided to pay the rest of his loan off early in hopes to receive a larger one soon. He plans to continue investing in appliances as he did before. His goal is to save up enough money to open a second point of sale for his products.

loans.use: Invest in more appliances and possibly open a new point of sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business stock

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Business Description

Edith has 5 years of experience with her work. She used to maintain a store, which she had to close because of the death of her husband 5 years ago. This motivated her to become strong and achieve going forward with her business. She started with the sale of food. She works every day of the week on a schedule of 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. Currently she delivers food in the center of the city and to known areas. Her son helps her with the services of the business.

Loan Use

The credit will be invested in the purchase of chairs and tables for her business in the home, besides the purchase of wholesale supplies, which will give her discounts in her purchases.

Personal Information

Edith is a widow. She has one son, who studies. Her little house is made of cement. Her wish is to return to take up again her store business and hopes that with the investment she will achieve this goal little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Edith tiene una experiencia de 5 años con su actividad. Ella mantenía una tienda la cual tuvo que cerrarla por el fallecimiento de su esposo hace 5 años. Este fue motivo para que ella tome fuerza y logre salir adelante con su negocio. Se inicio con la venta de comida. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. Actualmente ella reparte comida en el centro de la ciudad y conocidos del sector. Su hijo le ayuda con el servicio del negocio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de sillas y mesas para su negocio en el domicilio. Además de compra de víveres al por mayor lo que le dejara descuentos en sus compras.

Información Personal

Edith es viuda. Tiene un solo hijo que estudia. Su casita es de cemento. Su deseo es volver a retomar su negocio de la tienda y espera con la inversión que realizara poco a poco lograrlo.

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and wholesale products

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 31 year old father of 2 children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Saida. He is a car painter but wants to have another source of income. This is why he is asking for $1000, to help him buy a small truck for transportation services. Abdallah started working with A. Majmoua to buy the required tools for his car painting business, and is now planning to expand his professionA. activity.

loans.use: To buy a small truck

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. wants to increase the production of her bakery. She wants to start producing products for various areas like schools, shops, and supermarkets. This loan will help her to increase the raw materials necessary for her bakery like cartons of wheat flour and Jeri cans of oil. Elizabeth wants to enlarge her business and expects that, at one point in the future, she will be able to produce bread and cakes for parties, weddings, and many more occasions. This will allow her to enlarge and promote her business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of her bakery

loans.name: Agossou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Agossou A. was born in 1955. He is married and has nine children. He earns his living selling sheep and it is thanks to the income from this business that he is able to support his family. He takes the sheep on credit from the breeders, and after selling them he pays off his debts. However, this is very expensive and thus deprives him of a larger profit margin. To increase his income, Monsieur A. is asking for a $300 loan to purchase more sheep and satisfy market demand.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Agossou est né en 1955, marié et père de neuf (9) enfants. Il exercer comme activité la vente des moutons. Et c’est grâce à ces revenus qu’il arrive à subvenir aux charges de sa famille. Il prend les moutons à crédit chez les éleveurs et après vente il paie ses dettes. Ce qui le prive d’une grande marge bénéficiaire car cela lui revient très cher. Pour améliorer ses revenus, il sollicite un financement de $300 pour faire plus d’achat et satisfaire la demande du marché.

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Ni Ketut Soli

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Soli, 39, is a hard working lady. She is married to Putu Tamanaya, a Cacao farmer. Ni Ketut Soli is very active in taking care of her family's cacao plantation. She applies fertilizer and harvest the cacao, while her husband usually does the insecticide. Cacao is a long term plant, as it only produces after it reaches 4 year of age. Depending on the quality and weather, cacao can produce year round. It usually needs fertilizing every trimester and insecticide spraying as needed. It is usually harvested once a week. Each kg of dried cacao can be sold for about $11 to $15. Ni Ketut Soli is very pleased with her current result. She plans to obtain a loan from Dinari to purchase more fertilizer and insecticide to increase the yield of her plantation. Ni Ketut Soli is very motivated in taking care of the plantation as she hopes to improve her family's financial situation.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Ketut Soli, 39 tahun, adalah wanita yang sangat ulet dan pekerja keras. Sebagai istri dari Putu Tamayana, seorang petani Kakao , Ni Ketut Soli sangat aktif dan berperan dalam mengelola kebun kakao keluarga ini. Dari pemupukan bahkan sampai pemetikan hasil panen dilakukan oleh ibu dua orang anak ini kecuali dalam penyemprotan hama biasanya dilakukan oleh suaminya. Kakau termasuk tanaman jangka panjang karena tanaman ini baru bisa berproduksi setelah berumur kurang lebih 4 tahunan. Baru setelah itu tanaman ini akan berbuah terus hampir sepanjang musim dan sangat tergantung dari cara pemeliharaannya, seperti pemupukan setiap 3 bulan sekali begitu juga dengan penyemprotan sesuai dengan kebutuhan. Sedangkan untuk panen raya biasanya dilakukan pemetikan setiap seminggu sekali. Satu Kilogram kakao kering harganya berkisar Rp 10.000,- s.d 13.000,- .Ni Ketut Soli sangat senang dengan hasil yang di perolehnya saat ini. Saat ini ia berencana untuk mendapat pinjaman yang di pergunakan untuk membeli pupuk dan obat-obatan anti hama agar hasil kebun kakaonya menjadi lebih baik. Ni Ketut Soli lebih bersemangat dalam mengelola kebunnya karena ia mempunyai prinsip bahwa semua yang dilakukannya sekarang adalah untuk keluarganya

loans.use: Purchase Fertilizer and Insecticide

loans.name: Eoeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Eoeng R., age 33, lives with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works as a garment worker, earning approximately $1.80 a day. Her husband, Mr. Kean Sothea, 34, owns a plot of farmland and grows rice, making $1.70 a day. The children are students.

To generate more income to support the family, they are requesting a loan to purchase a new generator. The generator will be use to recharge the batteries in the village. Most of the villagers depend on batteries to power lights and TV's, etc. This will allow the family to save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new generator.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa is a good and very responsible client. She sells recyclable materials, which greatly helps her maintain her family being that her husband is much older and breeds animals.

She previously received a group loan, which she repaid responsibly and punctually, but she had to retire from it due to family problems. Despite these problems, she never fell behind in any of her payments. She decided to retire and not receive any more loans for fear that her family problems would cause her trouble repaying them.

Today, she needs this loan to purchase more prime materials and more animals, and in that way increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Rosa es una cliente muy responsable y buena, ella se dedica a vender material reciclable, con lo que ayuda bastante a mantener su familia, ya que su esposo es bastante mayor en edad y se dedica a criar animales,

Ella tenia un crédito grupal, el cual pago muy responsable y puntulmente pero tuvo que retirarse debido a problemas familiares, aun con estos problemas ella no se retraso en ninguna de sus cuotas, decidio retirarse y no trabajar mas con creditos por temor a que los problemas familiares le ocasionaran problemas para pagar sus cuotas.

Ahora ella necesita de este préstamo para poder comprar mas material de trabajo y tambien para comprar mas animales y asi poder incrementar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase fodder and more recyclable material.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana A. is a seamstress who specializes in sewing women’s clothing. She is married and has 5 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family so Juana is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

She wishes to improve her conditions of service to attract more customers so she is asking for a loan to buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier.

loans.use: To buy modern sewing tools and materials to make her work easier
